My only complaints are that it's a bit front-heavy after a while, and the battery lasts about 2-3 hours of constant gameplay. Neither of those issues make me regret my purchase. Once I get some more money saved up, I'm going to buy another one so my wife and I can both play together! Thanks for this incredible experience, Oculus! I look forward to upcoming games and accessories.
review_title: First VR experience and couldn't be happier

one_reviews_text: This is my first VR rig (if you don't count Google Cardboard) and it is unbelievably good. I wanted to try VR and just the set up and "first look" app experience was enough to justify the price to me. I'm very excited to see where VR will go. I'm not a gamer, so I need more exploratory apps. I love Mission: ISS that lets me explore the space station - I feel like I'm there. Wander gives me Google Street View in 360, but the interface is a bit clunky. I wish there was Google Earth. I bought Sports Scramble and played it with a friend who lives 400 miles away. It was fun for a few days but now seems repetitive and gimmicky. First Flight was interesting for a couple of hours, then got boring for lack of new experiences. VR in Virtual Reality was interesting. I played through, but got tired of it towards the end. I've tried some of the chat room apps, but they seem populated with screaming and badly behaving 13 year olds. Rec Room has some interesting stuff, but is not intuitive to use and I do not want to watch a bunch of YouTube videos to figure out how to change the color of my "dorm room".UPDATE: I wanted to watch an Amazon Prime movie but found it was locked for "parental controls". But there are no parental controls in the Oculus. Turns out the only way to watch all the Prime content in the Amazon Prime app is to disable the "purchase pin" on your Amazon account. Now you can watch movies, but you are exposed to people buying digital goods on your account. Seems like Amazon should have spent less time on making their VR app cool and more time thinking through the mechanics of watching Prime - which is the main point.
review_title: Fabulous Experience - except for viewing Amazon Prime content

one_reviews_text: I just got this as my first VR set after researching the many options and I am so glad I chose the Quest.  I was completely amazed by VR when I first used the set.  It is very simple to set up and with the side and top of head straps, can fit any size/shape head.  The eye glasses insert also fits extremely wide glasses, so if you wear them, it is likely to fit yours without issue.  Pixelation is also not a huge issue, the graphics are clean and crisp.  Always make sure to play in a well lit room as the tracking can struggle in a dark or dimly lit room.The biggest issue with the Quest is its game and app library.  The system is fully capable of playing the Rift games, but they just aren't available yet.  You also cannot use Steam VR.  The exception to this is when you plug your Quest into a PC,  you can play the Rift and Steam library, but this defeats the purpose of having a standalone, portable set.  Beat Saber is also lacking the extensive library of custom music/map downloads and mods, but you can get around this by sideloading them onto it, using Sidequest (you can google some great guides on how to do this).The Quest is also missing many of the streaming services apps.  It includes YouTube VR and Netflix, but lacks Hulu, Disney+, HBO, and others.  You can use the web browser to watch from these companies however and there is also an inexpensive Virtual Desktop app so that you can stream movies and music from your PC.
review_title: A great VR set for the beginners and long time gamers alike

one_reviews_text: After having both first and second gen head sets I can safely say this is a game changer.  I played this thing in one night more that I did with the two other headsets combined - Why?  Because it's wireless. It has no base stations, has a huge (25X25) possibly playing area.  Yes you take a hit in the graphics, these are snapdragon processors and not Radeon Vegas and nVida RTXs, but trust me - the wirelessness more than makes up for it.  This will drive more VR specific hardware in the the near future. PLUS you can stream SteamVR games with almost no latency  - That is there SOME latency, but very minimal.  I've also started using it to replace my steady state and HIIT cardio work outs with PistolWhip (Using Deadeye and real gun handling) which is a hell of a work out, and BoxingVR and Thrill of the Fight are a hell of a workout too.  I'm able to get my heart rate peak in the 150s after about 20 minutes of good playing with weights on ankles, wrists, and a vest and that is no mean feat as I'm already pretty much an athlete already and it takes quite a bit to get my HR up that high and stay there.I really can't stress how much fun this thing is.  I play it every day now as part of my workout... a hell of a lot more fun than going out to jog or do HIIT.
review_title: This is what I've been waiting for...

one_reviews_text: I have been a fan of VR since trying it in 1992, and always dreamt that one day it would be possible to affordably have it at home.  After owning the PlayStation VR for more than a year, I thought that it was great to have, but still had some limitations about setup, wires, and freedom of movement.Enter the Oculus Quest!  Despite having less graphical power than it's PC or PSVR counterparts, it's relatively low cost and utter portability take VR into a whole new generation.  And Oculus seems to be continually updating and improving it with free updates that add significant new features, like hand tracking without a controller, and the ability to tether to a PC for the full PCVR experience!  This is honestly my favorite bit of tech that I've ever owned, and I would recommend this to anyone that is interested in Virtual Reality but was put off by the cost and technical hoops.  This is your entry point!

Dislike:The Oculus Quest library is pretty solid but the Quest versions of popular games, such as Beat Saber, are way behind the PC versions in terms of customization options and user-generated content. I am also kind of dubious of how closed the Quest system is and signs Oculus is more aggressively trying to monetize their store compared to Steam.Like:You can use the headset without a PC.This is great for stuff like YouTube watching, Tilt Brush, and many other apps where the Oculus Quest version is just as fleshed out as PC versions.This is a bargain at $400 retailLOVE:Wireless Virtual Desktop to run PC VR gamesYou can run Virtual Desktop to play PC VR titles wirelessly via wifi. Yes, there is noticeable input lag when things get intense but for most players and in most titles, it's not a problem at all.The wireless experience is so good and liberating my wife and I have mostly left the Valve Index to collect dust and play PC VR games via Virtual Desktop.

No video I saw did it justice you have to try it for yourself.ConsSweating and then sharing. Depending on what you play you will sweat so playing with friends is kind of nasty.Grab buttons are very sensitive. It will take a few days to get 100% comfortable with that controller. It’s different And there’s no glancing down to see where the buttons are obviously.Also having to adjust it on your face to have it properly sit for the clearest image is a little clumsy That again speaks to sharing it because once you get it perfectly set you really don’t wanna have to readjust it.Most games are very short. It does not mean bad But $10 for an hour or so ep of Vader??? Ok!  Because it was great and if I ever lose my mind I will tell stories about the time i met Darth Vader In person. The games are getting longer and better I so it definitely has a future. Those are gripes because all in all I highly recommend if you’re interested you’ll probably be amazed.

I've been excited about VR since the original Oculus rift was announced years ago. I've been to multiple "try VR" experiences including The Void. I've tried friends headsets and tested the waters with mobile Daydream VR.  The problem is that I'm a casual gamer and have refused thusfar to buy a high end gaming rig to play VR. The Oculus Quest is finally what I've been waiting for!This device has been a blast from day 1. Even my spouse has been blown away by Beat Saber. The quality is a slight downgrade over higher end units but I promise you that you won't miss it. The immersion is second to none and VR without cords is a dream come true.I cannot say enough good things about this unit but will try and be realistic. The fit and comfort of the unit is decent and isn't a problem for extended sessions with it seated properly. Definitely leaves marks on my cheeks though. There is a significant gap around the nose which bleeds some light. This was an initial concern of mine but after real use I've come to appreciate being able to quickly peek through this hole back to reality and it also helps with airflow. I get very hot and sweaty when swinging a lightsaber. The adjusting straps are simple and Intuitive enough for my less than tech savvy wife to pick up immediately.The catalog of games is excellent so far. I have ever been more immersed than when I stepped into the world of Vader Immortal. This VR headset has ruined all other forms of gaming for me. My Switch and Xbox are now collecting dust.Excellent replayability and so easy to hop in for a quick 20-30 minute session. The ability to avoid external sensors is truly a game changer.I am not one to trust Facebook but they absolutely killed this one. If youre interested in VR, then you should buy this. It's that simple.
review_title: This is what we've all been waiting for!

one_reviews_text: O.M.G! This is the neatest think since...well, I don’t know what!I purchased this set after trying it out at my Sister’s place a couple of weeks ago. I tried Beat Saber, Box VR and Sports Scramble and heaven help me, I was beyond hooked! I’d just started a diet and exercise regimen and was handling the diet part, but not so much the exercise. My Quest has changed all that.As this is my first VR, I don’t have anything to really compare it with, but I LOVE this system! To me (again, I’m a VR noob), the immersion is simply amazing. There is a “getting started” app already built in, and it REALLY helped me get acquainted with how the controllers work. Plus dancing with that adorable robot had me at the hello wave. 🥰Because I purchased primarily for the calorie burn apps, I haven’t tried any shoot ‘em up games, yet. This does EXACTLY what I purchased it for; it gets me off my lazy keister and exercising! My Apple Watch calories burned have been pretty much off the charts since I started using this, so mission accomplished. Had zero idea that getting my heart rate up would be so much fun!

Mine sadly arrived with a dead pixel in the right eye but thankfully it's impossible to see it during game-play and it only prevalent when turning the machine on or off or i'm in a pitch black environment.I was originally going to buy the Vive and had bought tons of PC VR games ahead of time in anticipation, then I heard that this headset could play PC VR games wirelessly and a wired option for PC VR would come out soon. So I took the risk and pre-ordered it.While there are a few compromises, it works FAR better than I could have hoped. fair warning ALVR may be free but it's kinda crap, bite the bullet and buy Virtual Desktop and then sideload it. the quality is better, fewer crashes and much less compression issues. (If you have good internet, don't waste your money on the link cable, the quality is very similar to Virtual Desktop.)The Quest store didn't have a lot when this headset first released but the quantity of great games now is very respectable.I tend to play Beat Saber and Recroom on the go and play Skyrim VR and Saints and Sinners in my home space.I'm so glad I spent 450 for this instead of 1000 for a Vive and wireless setup or even an Index I can only play in my house.
review_title: Better than I could have hoped for, and it just keeps getting better.

one_reviews_text: The quest is unexpectedly more immersive than I anticipated. After reading that they're using a Qualcomm Snapdragon 835 I thought that well it's a first gen thing. Surely they can use a better chip in succeeding generations. I can wait for it. What changed my mind is the recent update that allows for a link cable to connect to the PC. essentially converting this unit from a stand alone VR to an optional PC VR unit.  That meant that even if the hardware is replaced, I could still find a use for the headset as a backup PC VR Rig. Since I'm purchasing it in this time frame, Vader Immortal comes bundled with the quest. While there is a number of expensive apps you could buy, there are also a number of free apps you can get. Rec Room, Altspace, bait and a few others. Connecting online also gives you the option to play online VR games. There's easy access to these sites on the quest and I haven't had any trouble playing them. Watching video you can see the screen door effect but I still enjoyed watching futurama on Prime VR and found streaming video from my PC to be simple. I found myself breathless in some of the games which is what I wanted. A means to trick my body into some light exercise while having fun. Motion sickness is a problem when moving without teleporting. I had assumed it would be no different from looking at a monitor and moving with keyboard and mouse but the immersion factor does something weird and its easy to get disoriented. My advice is to keep your turns small and slow and take breaks. Over all I've had a lot of fun with it the first day and look forward to the tech improvements of the future.

I'm having so much fun with the Oculus Quest and I'm glad I got it when I did as it's not available for the foreseeable future.  My main reason for pulling the trigger was for Half-Life: Alyx.  With the Oculus Link cable I'm able to connect to my PC (yes, a wireless headset now as a wire) and get way more games to play albeit with a wire.  You get access to Oculus Rift games AND steam VR games.  A lot of the time I'll check to see if steam has the same game that Oculus Quest is selling so that I can just get it during a steam sale  for dirt cheap.  Yes, once again you'll be playing with a wire but you'll be able to get a buttload more games to play. It's very much well worth it.  I've yet to try side loading apps and streaming the PC games to my headset to avoid having to use a wire but it's definitely an option.Aside from gaming, there's other cool apps you can use. I connect to my PLEX server and watch movies, there's a sports app that lets you watch highlights as if you were on the floor with the athletes (very cool), Amazon has their own VR videos, Google Maps street view is so much fun to visit places around the world like the Vatican, Stonehenge, etc.It's a really awesome product and I just went with the smaller 64GB version because the games aren't really that big to begin with (1-3GB) and the PC games are playing off of your PC.  Mine came with Vader Immortal and it definiely blows everyone's mind when they try it. Get it right meow!

I had never used any type of VR before purchasing the Oculus Quest so I had no idea of what to expect.  I am not really impressed by electronics and am disappointed quite often so I was a bit wary of the Oculus.  However, once I turned it on and went through the 1st tutorial I was absolutely blown away!  This is the coolest device (by far) I have ever seen in my life.  I still can't comprehend how it can be so real and fun.  If you are on the fence, buy it--you will not be disappointed.I can't answer for PSVR/Rift users as I never used those headsets.Pros*An un-tethered VR experience.  You actually feel like you are in that world.  I still can't get over how real these games are.  In Vader, it literally felt like Darth Vader was right there.*Lots of great games*Quick to turn on and jump in*Great controllersCons*I wish the graphics were a bit more clear, but that is not realistic based on the specs/price of this unit (I would NOT get a PC-based VR instead of this---the games are so fun as they are)*The headset straps are not the greatest.  I find myself messing with them a bit

Can barely write a review, left controller didn't work out of the box, so Oculus support had me send it in. Its been over a month ago. Would return to Amazon seller had I not dealt with Oculus direct and sent them the faulty piece. Now I'm stuck waiting for them. All they told me today is that its under investigation and I'll get an update when something new comes up... SO, review score is for Oculus Support as I have not yet been able to use device. Buyer beware, Oculus Support is terrible!!!
review_title: Buyer beware, Oculus Support is terrible!!!

one_reviews_text: I've tried other VR headsets. They have 2 big problems that interrupt the experience. The biggest is that there are wires. They are always on your mind because they're touching you and you don't want to trip over them or wrap them around you. It seems like a small thing, but it's not as it totally distracts you from enjoying VR. The second issue is that you can't see the walls, desks, etc. around you ... but you know you might hit them if you're not careful ... even though you can't see them. This is a distraction from enjoying the experience too, and it's potentially painful! The Quest solves both. No wires! It also lets you easily define a "safe space" in your room, and when you get close to an edge it shows you inside the VR view ... in other words, you can see it when you get close. It's very clever and works great. It feels like magic. :-)
review_title: This is the best VR experience.

one_reviews_text: Had the Quest for 3 days. Returned it, while simultaneously ordering the S (which I received Saturday thanks to Prime One Day). Have a high end laptop (with a mini DP), but I was looking to replace my old Rift. Loved the idea behind the Quest, and it's no doubt, excellent hardware, but for me, it was too uncomfortable, and I saw some compromises being made with certain games in order to keep up with my original Rift's performance (did back and forth comparisons while my Rift was still connected). The screen was kick butt over the Rift, but I missed my Steam games and some of the Rift/S only (for now) games.If I didn't have a capable PC, the Quest would have been a no brainer (eventually, I would have purchased whatever I needed to make it comfortable). The S turned out to be everything I was hoping for. Comfortable as heck, smooth as silk gameplay, a beautiful screen which made the Rift seem blurry in comparison, and no longer a slave to sensors. I do miss the black level of the OLED Quest, but now I can sell off my old Rift. Still excited to see how the link cable turns out. I will always keep my eye on the Quest! One never knows....
review_title: Awesome Tech with limitations, one being it's super uncomfortable.

one_reviews_text: Excellent product which is pretty easy to setup out of the box. As well as its use as a standalone VR set, it can also be connected to a PC and play PC VR games. The PC needs to be relatively high spec per Oculus' stated minimum requirements. There are instructions on the internet on how to setup the Quest for wired or wireless connection with a PC. On its own the Quest is already very immersive. With a PC playing Half Life Alyx it truly feels like the future has arrived.The Quest hardware is high quality and controllers are comfortable and intuitive. As important is the software and interface which are excellent and easy to use. Friendly enough so you can just pick up and play (assuming you at least have basic familiarity with your smart phone and home network), but also giving you ability to tweak more advanced settings if you want to.Overall, the package exceeded expectations, especially given the user-friendliness and versatility of not only the headset itself but also the accompanying software, software eco-system (needed for PC VR) and its price point.UPDATE (2020/8/30): I am reducing my rating from 5-stars to 3-stars. Originally, Oculus did not require purchasers to register with a Facebook account. Unfortunately, that policy has changed and in future all users will need to have a valid Facebook account to use this device. I personally do not feel comfortable having all my personal info vacuumed up by Facebook and hence cannot in good conscience maintain a 5-star recommendation. The hardware is good but in future all user activity and data will be logged by Facebook
review_title: Simple to set up, excellent room scale wireless VR, great product all round

one_reviews_text: Update: 2019 Aug 14 : Casting to Chromecast Ultra 4k works with ~1second lag. Occasional freezes but continues.Used to play with Google VR using the phone but the lack of input made it more of a hype.Pro:The Oculus Quest with the two controllers is so much more immersive. Beat Sabre is a whole lot fun with it.There's no perceptible lag in the tracking of the controllers!The portability of it is amazing!I could see ray tracing of the the light glow from the lightsabre in Vader Immortal - so Real!Cons:Managed to cast to Chromecast Ultra with ~1 second lag. Occasional freezes but recovers.You can't record mixed reality videos at the moment with Liv, the Mixed Reality Capture (MRC) support announced by Oculus requires you to have an Oculus Rift for calibration on top of a video capture card.The controller's battery cover tend to slip open during play - especially Beat Sabre where you're swinging a lot, not so much for shooter games.To prevent controller battery cover sliding open or just accidentally throwing the whole controller itself, I highly recommend getting rubber sleeves for the controller, some folks use elastic bands. I've accidentally thrown it once as my hands got sweaty during gameplay.The screen door effect is visible in some games, not in others. *meh* on this one.

My only exposure to VR was the google cardboard which I hated. Made me nauseous, graphics were awful from a phone so never tried anything VR again. I heard so much about this item that I decided to get one for myself for Xmas. So glad I did. I'm now a VR addict and I'm an older gentleman. Games are amazing to play in the virtual world. Beat Saber is addicting.Screen door effect is there, but I don't really notice it much in games and is minimal. Graphics are fine, I'm sure with a Valve Index etc , the graphics are probably much better. But there's nothing wrong with the visuals with this.I'm now gonna get a computer tethered headset Vale/Rift S upgrade as soon as I can afford it. But this is great for quick playing and worth every cent. If you're someone like me who had only tried phone based options then you have to give this a try. And I'll always keep one of these around for the wireless option. Can't wait to see the next generation of this item. I will be buying one of those as well.
review_title: I LOVE it!!! You have to give this a try

one_reviews_text: Just got it in the mail today.  It took me about an hour to get it going with all the downloads and updates and all.  I already had the Oculus App because I have the Oculus Go, but it wouldn't bring up the Quest for headset to install.  So then I had to uninstall my Oculus App and reinstall the app.  To do that I got put in a long queue because everybody and is brother is trying to install their apps on opening day.  Then when I finally got it paired, I had to wait a while for the headset to update.My main beef is that Oculus didn't update the app I already had, so I wouldn't have to uninstall and then reinstall the app.I'm sure we'll have a lot of fun with it.  We've only just begun.

无法加载媒体。
                



 This is a truly ground-breaking device for VR. The price is acceptable for the experience you get from it and after attending the Oculus Connect 6 via Oculus Venues in VR, I think there is a bright future ahead. This is not just a toy or a gaming platform. This is a new way to consume content, be it surfing the net, socializing online, watching movies or YouTube and of course playing games. Oculus Connect 6 Day One presentations showed the business sector has some uses for it as well. Getting it now, is getting head start to the future of the media creation and consumption.As for the quality of the device itself - it is my first VR device (Google Mobile VR not counting) so I have nothing to compare it to and perhaps this is a good thing. I understand that the graphic quality is not up to par with the Rift and Vive counterparts, but what it has is enough for the brain to be completely fooled into believing the virtual environments it creates. It's not just my opinion. I took it to work and half my office ordered one the same day. They all were blown away. This ability alone, to take it on the road, anywhere is worth its money already.I've read that it felt heavy for some people but I didn't notice it at all, neither has my wife and my 11-years old kid. The little one 6-years old did complain a bit. The sound quality could be better though again we didn't mind. I bought special earbud earplugs for it (not the original as they are quite expansive) and it, apparently, didn't make that much of a difference. I understand that quality earphones for Oculus Quest have not materialized yet on the market.I really recommend this product and I really recommend reading about what Facebook and Oculus has in their mind for its future (hands tracking in software, completely free in November 2019). This is a great purchase for anyone. A glimpse into the future and fantastic entertainment value for its money.
review_title: A ground-breaking consumer device. Excellent experience!

one_reviews_text: This thing is amazing. One of my best purchases ever. Even my sister's kids that have the Oculus Rift are jealous. I love that I can wear my glasses with it. I love not being tethered to any cords, and the battery life between charges is good. The graphics are great, and even with no computer, it has been able to handle every game I've downloaded. There were a few cons but nothing too annoying. Quite often when I first boot the headset, it can't locate the controllers. That's fixed by popping the controller batteries out and back in. And the weight of the headset on my face means I have to be careful how I adjust the straps so I don't get a headache. I can't overstate how much I love this thing. I advise everyone to play in a cool area and take frequent eye breaks to ward off dreaded VR sickness, and you'll enjoy the Quest as much as I have. And protect your investment with an inexpensive face shield of some sort, so face grime doesn't collect on it.

I own, in addition to the Quest, the Oculus Go and the Lenovo Mirage Solo.  Both the latter two headsets will usually keep a pretty good charge for at least a couple weeks when turned off.  However, every time I charge the Quest and then unplug the charger (which I did last night) the next time I want to use it won't start and gives me a  low battery warning.  I just tried to use it and it happened again.  They need to fix this!  So my only option is to always leave plugged into the charger which I really don't like to do.  I've tried turning it on after a charge and doing a shut down. Doesn't help.  The battery still drains out in a a few hours.  As much as I like the Quest, and I do like it, a lot, I would not have bought it knowing what I know now.Update. My battery is now keeping a charge just fine while not in use even over a couple of weeks. I might add at the latest update to the headset is marvelous. It’s like I got a whole new headset. I’m really pleased with how they continue to work on an upgrade my purchase.
review_title: Standby battery life OK now. I have revised my review

one_reviews_text: This was my first VR experience, and initially, I was just blown away.  It's amazing how real it feels.  That said, there just aren't good, fun games to play.  After Beat Saber, there really wasn't much interesting to me, and Beat Saber really lacked a good variety of songs without spending absurd amounts of extra money on DLC.  I did purchase 7-8 games, and there are a bunch that are cool, but none really have great staying power after Beat Saber.  Almost everything in this feels like a novelty rather than a real game.

I have zero experience with VR and paid no attention to it until I started seeing some reviews for quest. I didn’t expect people to be saying such good things about vr but from what I saw in the reviews, being a wireless untethered device with solid motion tracking, my interest grew. I decided to order one and upon receiving it, had read about a lot of the games, pros, cons. My initial experience has been impressive to say the least. This technology is pretty cool and it blew me away with the interaction you have with the hand controllers. Being a console gamer since NES, I had never played anything like this before. It is a game changer for sure. Best saber, superhot vr, and drop dead are all pretty excellent games that I like. I’ve tried a few others and while they are good, the price might not justify their worth. You can tell that this technology will continue to improve as the resolution isn’t the greatest and the battery life a bit short. That would be my biggest complaint...the resolution. Considering $400 can get you a 4K console, the quest is obviously not that and a bit pixely, but by no means is it a deal breaker and doesn’t negate the fun factor. From what I understand that’s the compromise being made in order to be completely wireless, which is fantastic. I can’t imagine being tethered to a high end computer (that I don’t have) while playing these games. At $400 plus the cost of games, it’s a bit steep, and unless oculus continues with a steady stream of strong titles, not sure how long the wow factor will last...it’s incredible technology that will depend on a continual release of new fun games. Just know you won’t be getting console/pc quality resolution. I expect the inevitable quest 2 or quest 3 will be the real game changers, but for now this is an extremely fun device worth giving a shot if you have the money to spend.

Facebook forces you to get a Facebook account to fully use it. Without it forget about playing online or using Oculus Venues. So basically if you want to use your $400-$500 device you also have to relinquish your privacy and give them your personal information or go through the struggle of creating a fake account.
review_title: If you do not have a Facebook account you cannot fully use it

one_reviews_text: The Oculus quest is taking Virtual Reality to the next level. If you only get one app, make it Beat Saber.Beat Saber is the reason I purchased the Oculus Quest. I was playing on my Oculus Rift CV1, and I was thinking, if there were no wires this would be perfect. Boom! Oculus Quest!There is a great selection of game and apps to choose from now that the Quest has been out for a while.Now, with the Oculus link capabilities, you can connect your Quest to your PC, and enjoy much higher quality games. I’m playing Alien Isolation with the Mother Mod, and is is awesome!The reason I took off one star is because while the audio is functional, it is a total letdown compared to the Oculus Rift. Those headphone are amazing compared to what they went with in the Quest. It’s doable, but barely. I’m using some iPhone earbuds until I find something better.  Don’t buy the Oculus earbuds or similar. They don’t produce sound that is worth the money.
Excellent technical product, but it is super proprietary.  Only games Facebook (owner of Occulus) allows in their store are playable.

If you've used an Oculus Rift on PC, the experience is almost identical to that, but with a slight downgrade in graphics. Fewer special effects, lower-resolution textures, etc. But if you compare the actual interaction and playability within games, the experience is almost 100% the same, and I'd argue considerably better given the wire-free nature of the product. Further, the fact that I can press a button and jump into VR means that I can use the Quest in short stints here and there, without firing up a PC to do it, making it 100x more likely I'll use it at all. This right there is the kicker that makes it even remotely possible that my wife would try it - it's so easy, she can throw it on, fire it up, and get to playing Beat Saber or what-have-you.Battery life is good (2+ hours so far), game selection is good and improving, responsiveness and tracking accuracy is perfect, as far as I can tell, and it even remembers the locations and boundaries I draw for the play space! I'm blown away! Now make a 2.0 with a modern SOC (preferably a new Nvidia Tegra chip) and we're in business!If only this were available 6 months ago! Alas, it's available now, and I can't recommend it enough.

Exceeds my expectations. The package arrives with a very premium look and feel. It was very easy to setup but I did watch a few Youtube videos so I could get up and running as quick as possible. Vader Immortal was my first purchase and it does not dissappoint. It is almost as realistic as the VOID experience at Disney Springs. Wielding a lightsaber in the game works flawless. Tried the other apps and things like Netflix and Amazon Video were interesting to sit an enjoy watch TV or movies. Dont think I would do it that often because the quality isnt as good as my own TVUPDATE - 8-6-18 After 1 week I have bought a few games to go along with this from the Oculus store. Battery life is about 2.5 hours so you need to buy an external 10000+ mAh for longer sessions. I suggest getting rechargeable AA batteries for the Touch hand controllers. Already went thru 2 sets of batteries the first week. I have watched movies from my Plex server thru the web browser. Firefox VR was just released and works pretty good as well. Good assortment of free content. Download SideQuest to install mods and other content not available in the Quest store. I am using Virtual Desktop  to access my Steam VR content. I couldnt get other free solutions working like ALVR. Steam VR content is not flawless, you do get a little bit of stutter every now and again. Possibly a really good NightHawk gaming Wifi router would solve that issue. I have AC1700 Netgear router.

I definitely recommend this device for people interested in checking out the VR experience. In 2016 I spent a lot of time using an HTC Vive in college. In 2017, I decided to purchase an Oculus Rift and I used it for architectural design using custom software. In 2018, I bought 11 Oculus Go's in order to use them to teach VR development at the college level. In May 2019, I purchased the Oculus Quest and I really love it.Fifty years from now historians will look back and may well consider this the watershed device for VR. The Rift and Vive required an expensive computer and were tethered with cables. The Go is only 3 degrees of freedom and one controller. The Quest is the first Minimum Viable Product in my opinion. Here's why: It has a good price point, the graphics quality is just good enough to eliminate the screen door effect, no wires, it's very comfortable, the processing power is just at the bottom level to be good enough for a very good experience and the tracking seems flawless to me. I highly recommend this device with one caveat... Oculus is restricting independent development on the device which might keep the level of quality higher but will ultimately suffocate innovation at a critical time for VR. There just aren't enough things to do with it beyond shooting things. I hope this is useful.
review_title: The first truly viable VR device for the masses

one_reviews_text: In the first 30 days of using the Quest, I lost 15 pounds and felt like I was 35 again (I'm 57). I started out at 240 pounds. My knees had gotten to the point that I had to go up and down stairs one step at a time using my right leg. After 2 weeks of beat saber, I was able to go up and down stairs like they were nothing and was already feeling 10 years younger. By the end of the first 30 days, I was kicking ass and taking names. My daughter and grandkids said I looked like I was a ninja when I played beat saber. Then Thanksgiving hit. I quit working out, ate way too much and the next thing I knew it was the 10th of January and I had not only gained all my weight back but even more, as I was now 245 pounds. I was back to taking the stairs one step at a time. I'm back on the Quest again, and back to where I feel like I'm 20 years younger again. It's now February 9th and I'm back down to 223 pounds. The thrill of the Fight makes me lose the most weight I think as it is a High-Intensity Workout. But, my favorite now is Pistol Whip. I like to play two ways. For the most aerobic workout, Iike to put it on dual guns and the hardest setting and go as hard as I can. I can beat all the levels doing this without dying but it's hard and you'll have to move your ass to not die. The other way is to truly challenge myself. I usually do this at the end of my workout. Put on deadeye, where you have to be accurate and get it on. Pistol Whip is so much like being John Wick, I started actually thinking it was saying hello Mr. Wick instead of Pistol Whip at the beginning. You'll notice the John Wick references as soon as you hit start. Great game and within 30 minutes I'm soaking wet with sweat. Don't have a large area? I play all kinds of places including sitting down. You wouldn't believe how much you can sweat and how tired you can get after an hour of sitting and playing some of the games. The only think I can suggest is to get into it full swing. I watch a lot of people who barely move in VR, I guess because they're scared, but you've got to get involved and make those hard shots, jump to the side, and duck all the way down if you really want to benefit.
review_title: Best Exercise Equipment You'll Ever Buy!!!

one_reviews_text: While the Oculus Quest had a bit of a rocky start for me, with some graphical glitching and screen tearing, those issues have since been patched out. Even with those issue though, they didn't hamper my complete amazement and fasination with using the headset. Having tried PC VR before, the lower graphic quality is noticable, but matters little as the experience is still thoroughly enjoyable, and the lack of any wires to contend with is very liberating. If you have ever considered trying out VR, or just want a headset of your own and can't afford a good enough gaming PC, I cannot recommend the Quest enough. Honestly, even if i did have a gaming pc, the Quest might still be my first choice.

It took some years to finally decide to go with this VR set.  The resolution is pixelated since you are so close to the screen when wearing it, but not a gamechanger for me.  The benefits outweigh the cons for a completely wireless headset.  Many of the games and videos are short, but an awesome workout when you have the space to use it.  This headset may be a little weighted for some so compare to other models to see what works for you.  Ultimately, the latest update to use hand recognition is great so the controllers are not required for some navigation.  Great way to save on controller batteries.  I will more than likely respond with more info after longer use but really like this device.

The quest has been the go to for many consumers for the past year. With frequent updates and amazing support from Oculus this headset is a must buy!I recently received mine on June 13th and have been amazed since powering it on. Before purchasing I tried my friends Rift S and found that I did not get motion sick like I thought I would. After researching several products I decided the quest was the best bang for my buck and I wasn't wrong!Once it showed up I powered it up and even though is has a lower refresh rate, at 72Hz vs the Rift S i previously tried at 80Hz. I still did not feel the effects of motion sickness. That was a major concern for me and I am happy to report that its superb in curbing motion sickness, for me anyway.The astounding amount of updates and new software capabilities of this machine has been staggering, considering that is has only been out for just over a year. The fact that you can use it wirelessly and tethered to your PC opens up a massive library of games you can't get on other devices. With the quest you can utilize the quest store for headset specific games, the oculus store for Rift and Rift S games, and the steam store for even more content to digest.All in all with today's current tech and the plethora of abilities that this headset currently possesses i would highly recommend to anyone who is currently in the market for a VR system.Thank you Oculus for making such a great  debut, and then actually spending time improving upon your efforts tbe way you have!! Keep up the great work!!!

This is my first VR experience and I've never done anything like it.  Serious gamer my whole life and this thing will really change the game.  When I first put the headset on....some light was coming through the bottom and I was like "oh this isn't going to be immersive at all".  And then the demo started and you're just instantly transported.  Just incredible.  Everything just....works.  No problems at all, great variety of games.  LOVE

I've been a VR enthusiast since the nineties, but only with the current resurgence have I been able to really explore it. I've owned most of the major platforms to come out over the last few years, I recently picked up the Go as a pick-up-and-play solution, but wound up returning it to get this instead. As much as I enjoy the PC VR experience, I have to say it's a lot easier to just pick up the Quest and go to it.Currently, my favorite game is Moon Rider, a free web-based "Beat saber" clone with a punch mode which has become my nightly exercise. You know you're on to a winner when you have to pace yourself on exercise. The graphics are not as good as PC, admittedly, but they are good enough, even at these early days. Give it a year and devs will be really pushing the hardware.Basically, VR has been waiting for a fully untethered and portable room-scale solution, and this is really doing the job. I think of it as the Model T of consumer VR: not the first, but the one that will bring the technology to the general public. This is a definite step in the right direction, and a lot of fun.

I like the Quest, and I have a Go and like both however my problem lies in Oculus procedure to return content. They make it very difficult to look up the procedure and have links to instructions that do not work. When you finally do figure it out and go to your orders history page there is no way to make a return request. I get the feeling this is by design, and it bring the integrity of Oculus to question.
review_title: Claims to allow you to return content but then does not support it.

one_reviews_text: Worth every penny! This thing has exceeded my expectations. We use it daily for exercise. I use the Supernatural app, which costs extra, but it’s so fun! It’s perfect for someone who hasn’t worked out in years & doesn’t have time to go to a gym. It’s helped my 7 year old & 5 year old tremendously with coordination, & it’s added a lot of fun to an otherwise difficult year! I’m a mom of young kids, not a “gamer”, & even I think this is worth every penny. The only downside is that most of the apps/games cost $$ like they would on another game system, so know that you’ll probably end up spending more $ after you buys this.
review_title: Great purchase for anyone, even for moms!

one_reviews_text: Everything about the quest is awesome except these few things that could be a deal breaker.The resolution needs to be increased, small details are hard to make out which has my eyes almost constantly trying to focus.The weight of the headset gets quite uncomfortable after 30min-1hr. Neck muscles are tired and sort of gives you a headache. Maybe that goes away after a few weeks?The games on the quest don't feel like full titles like on PS4Other than that I love it.

Was cov19 going on It's nice to have this. I've been watching daily on Amazon and they sell out fast unless you want to pay way more money elsewhere just wait they'll come back in stock. So when I ordered it it said arriving in 3 weeks. Day after I ordered it they came in and they sent them out and I had it in about 3 days. It was quicker than 3 weeks. But I am very pleased I love it I got the 64 gig The games you can store is more than enough storage. I'm happy I don't know what else to say read more reviews but I'm happy with mine. The battery life could be a little better but you know all I did was took some rubber bands and attached a little power block on the back It actually works out good got some more life to it for battery life. But this machine will blow your mind.
review_title: I didn't think it would blow my mind but it did I love it

one_reviews_text: So just now I was surrounded by five dudes with guns when my friggin' right controller ran out of battery, leaving me to take out all of these red jerks with only my left hand. After running out of ammo from my terrible aim, I was left crawling around my apartment floor for cover from their fire, cracking up, scrambling to find ninja stars and vases and such to finish off the last couple enemies... and I succeeded. Super hot? Most definitely.I haven't been this amazed with a video game system since I was in the 6th grade and played Mario 64 for the first time. This device is a game changer, with everything you need for immersive VR right out of the box, no wires or sensors, and no motion sickness. Everybody needs to try this.
review_title: Digital action hero in boxer briefs, right here.

one_reviews_text: Amazing for the price and for what it is, but still not quite a replacement for PCVR, if you have the money to support PCVR that is. An amazing starting point for those just getting into VR, and an awesome continuation for those tired of the cables and setup required for PCVR. A little uncomfortable, still blurry in some circumstances, and the speakers are passable at best, but when you take into account that this is an entire 6 DOF VR experience all built into a headset, you can forgive the shortcomings.
review_title: Amazing for the price and for what it is, but still not quite a replacement for PCVR

one_reviews_text: For what it is: a completely mobile VR gaming rig — it’s fantastic.  I’ve had an amazing time playing with it and it’s so easy to set up and play my non-techie girlfriend has no trouble with setup and playing.Cons:It’s pretty uncomfortable to wear. I dunno how they missed the mark but it’s just ... not great. Battery life is decent, at about two hours, which would be ok except for the fact that it takes about that long to recharge it. For comfort and batt life implementing a battery-pack counter-weight improves things considerably.The mobile process is underpowered. That’s not to say that games are good but by going with an older platform ( ostensibly to save money) they sacrificed resolution. The speakers sometimes crap-out, especially when the rig is being taxed.Tracking is excellent, however, and while maybe ‘lower’ resolution, the games I’ve played are smooth, engaging, and so much fun. In most cases, it just works and well!I am overall very happy with my purchase and excited about the future of VR gaming.Oh— I’m a software developer and almost 50!  😀
review_title: Great but. Works very with a couple tiny glitches SO worth wireless VR gaming!

one_reviews_text: My first time using this was one of those once-in-a-lifetime moments you never forget.  I cannot believe technology has advanced this far.  I am totally blown away by it.  TOTAL IMMERSION.Shortly afterwards I brought it to a party and everyone got into it.Honestly, I think it was worth the price just for the experience alone.  It's about what you'd pay for a family to go to one of those immersion rides at Universal Studios or something.  Instead, you can use it every day!The Google Earth function is also pretty awesome.  It's like you're anywhere in the world.  Try visiting the top of Mount Everest and looking around!  You won't believe it.
review_title: Most fun I've had in years.  WOW.  It was like being on the Starship Enterprise in the holodeck

one_reviews_text: Pros:* easy to set up and use* no additional equipment needed* good stability of VR world while moving one's headCon:* limited frame rate and image detailThe Oculus Quest does a pretty good job for its price.  In a few years it will probably seem hopelessly antiquated and crude, but it's good enough to use and enjoy today.  The illusion of a virtual world is convincing enough that I have to get my bearings when I remove the headset.  Most users may see it primarily as a gaming device, and the Quest comes with a small set of demo games, but it can also be used to stream 3D videos.  Be prepared to encounter encouragement to buy games and connect to social media.To use the Quest you must create an Oculus account, but a traditional Facebook account is not required -- if there's a difference, given that Facebook owns Oculus.  Consider the Quest to be like an early PC or an early smartphone: good enough to use, but not (yet) the ultimate VR device.
review_title: a good entry point into VR

one_reviews_text: The VR experience is amazing. It's pretty easy to get lost in the experience and time just slips by. Actual usage is primarily limited by the number of games/titles. Would love to see more concert and live sporting events for viewing. One note of caution is if you've had Lasik with different focal lengths in each eye, it's difficult to find a good focus with the Oculus. When I had my Lasik, the focus distance for my eyes were not made the same so that I could have vision far away and up close. Otherwise, I would have lost my near vision. The brain eventually resolves this difference. However, with the Oculus, it's difficult to find the right focal point because both eyepieces move together. It would be ideal if each eyepiece could be adjusted separately for optimum focus.
review_title: Great experience, need more games/titles, be wary if you have had Lasik

one_reviews_text: First, wow when I got this I was so excited for it but slowly its letting me down with three things really. Tracking, tracking and tracking. Man I cannot play Beat Saber without it losing tracking. Ive only had it for 2 weeks maybe. And it just keeps getting worse. Ive looked into all the reasons it could be happening, clean the cameras, big room, lots of light. Expert mode on Quest is impossible, the left side (red saber) is the worse it seems. It just disappears sometimes as I'm about to hit a block. Just stops tracking for a second. Maybe I have a defective piece of machinery, I dont know. The game itself will hiccup too. It just freezes and starts up again randomly during times. I haven't found anyone else having this issue yet. But it makes me not want it anymore. I cant do what I want on it. Are their external tracking set ups I can get? Should I just send it back? Should I wait for the new generation or next one? Im not having fun when it happens, very disappointed. I would love to write more or even write things I like about it but that gets shadowed right now by this tracking issue. Hope yours runs better then mine, its just like me to get the one defective Quest. Everyone else's Quest works but mine.
review_title: Having more issues then I thought...

one_reviews_text: I purchased this device as an entry level VR set and so far it has exceeded my expectations.Prior to the Oculus Quest I only used smart phone VR and Google Day Dream and Oculus Quest takes the cake. With the recent additions of Oculus Link I can see Oculus putting a lot of Effort for updates in the future and with the recent retirement of Oculus GO the Quest is looking like it will only grow from here on out. The portability is also awesome especially to demo at family events.So far my recommendations for the Quest are as follows:-SuperHot- An amazing first person shooter where time moves when you do. A great mechanic.-Beat Saber- Great for the whole family including grandparents.-Accounting+ a fun puzzle adventure from the creator of Rick and Morty.-Rec Room- Great fun for little ones and even adults. I spent so much time just playing dodge ball against my little cousins on PSVR.I strongly recommend for anyone interested in VR and doesn't want to break the bank.
review_title: Great entry level VR and great for VR Vets.

one_reviews_text: I bought one of these after following a few Youtubers who owned them.  I finally saved up and bought the Quest and was not disappointed at all.  In fact I was blown away by what this device can do for you.  I not only play games on this device but you can download videos that transport you to other places and you really feel you’re there!  I downloaded the Norte Dame Cathedral video and was transported to Paris, France in a matter of minutes.  I love my Quest and am glad I purchased it.  I can take any stressful day, slip on the Quest and disappear into VR for a few hours.  It actually has lowered my blood pressure while I was in the fishing games.  I had been out of the gaming scene for many years and this device has sold me on VR.  If you have the money, buy one.  You won’t be disappointed.

Had to return my ment to be bought new, Quest. Had a previous user's profile already loaded and had to factory reset it. Spent most of the night trying to get it to connect to PC with link, only to find out is usb port was broken and kept losing connection to the computer on and off. I saved up for about 2 1/2 months to even order this. I was trying to buy new to avoid having issues and have everything work smoothly. Now I am without a Quest, and am not sure when I'll even be able to acquire a new one at retail again. Very upset with Amazon not checking what they ship before shipping it. So stuck without. So again I say buyer beware. Make sure its new and working correctly.
review_title: Beware return resales sold as new.

one_reviews_text: It’s pretty freaking sweet! I have zero issues with this and quite honestly better than actually gaming on a console or PC. My only thing is sometimes I feels blurry but I am not sure if it's because that’s just how it looks or because it’s not sitting right. I’m assuming it’s cause it’s not sitting in the “sweet spot” as they say so I’m gonna go with user error. It’s a lot of money to dish out but it’s brandnew what do you expect 🤷🏼‍♂️. Honestly if you’re thinking about it and alreadybinterested chances are you know what you’re getting into and have tried out VR. GET IT. the 64gb version is perfect for everyone the only time you’d need more is if you’re side loading other media like movies or side loading other games etc.

Bought as a present and it was a hit. Pictures are so real looking as if you were there. Does not come with headphones so everyone can hear what is playing. Unless you lower it and where is the fun in that. Game pictures on box are NOT included. Those are samples. You can buy a game or download some for free. You do not need to register this Oculus to Facebook at this time but in the future you may have to. I bought the 64GB to save some money instead of the 124GB.  No Regrets but it was pricy.

I currently play Pistol Whip, Dance Central, and Beat Saber. I followed an online tutorial to get custom songs on Beat Saber.  My SO likes Pirate Hunter Trainer and SuperHot.The battery life is really good and I usually charge it after about two 1 1/2 play sessions. The batteries for hands has lasted a long time!With the right case it's super portable and a Google Chromecast let's you project to the TV for parties or having friends over.I am a small female and about at the 1 1/2 mark is when it starts to feel heavy on my head. I'll be getting an extra strap to help with that in the future. I haven't experienced any motion sickness but sometimes I do get a pit in my stomach when it feels like I'm about to fall off a fake ledge.

I wanted an all-in-one VR headset and this baby does not disappoint!Pros: This is an incredibly immersive experience! Nothing like I've ever experienced before. This is the VR we were promised in the 90s. There are plenty of games, from first-person shooters, to aerobic dancing and saber games (that don't feel like exercise!), to 3D movies, historical site visits, and so much more.Cons: It's a little heavy, especially after an hour of use. It also has about an hour of battery life, and I suppose that helps not to binge too long. You can plug it in for extended play.

Gotta be one of the most unique and fun experiences I've ever had. I've been playing video games since I was a kid and I'd heard about VR. Oh man, I've been missing out big time. This is some cutting edge stuff, and it's not kidding when people say that it's immersive. It's really hard to explain what makes it so good other than saying that it makes you feel like you're actually in the game. Just get one, you won't regret it.
review_title: One of the best purchases I've ever made... for gaming

one_reviews_text: Well, truth be told, this headset didn't leave me speechless. All I could say when using it was "wooooow", "oh my goodness", and "you gotta try this!" I've become a VR evangelist. I literally take it anywhere I can and have my friends and family try it out (the more people get interested in VR, the better the market gets)! If you have any doubts about this, buy from Amazon or Best Buy and return it if you're not absolutely amazed.You gotta see it to believe it! I have an Oculus Go and an Oculus Quest. You don't really NEED both but they're very different in terms of their use. Buy this one at least and then, once you are convinced, buy the Oculus Go for the casual VRing experience.
review_title: How do you write a review for a product that leaves you speechless?

one_reviews_text: I bought it on day one, and showed it to everyone in the office. Everyone loved it and many are considering buying it. This is the product that could drive mass VR adoption. The only potential downside is the lack of killer apps like the legend of zelda or mario did for the switch.However, with games like beat saber, robo recall, orbus, dead and buried, I expect you to die, there are plenty of great experiences on here you can play for a long time. But nothing with the long run time and triple A quality of a first party nintendo game. This is written in may 2019, potentially other games could come to the quest and change that, for instance storm lands could.
review_title: Extremely convenient, everyone I have shown it to loves it

one_reviews_text: The pentile matrix of the Quest despite its 1600p resolution caused uncomfortably apparent SDE for me. I noticed it more than the $200 Oculus Go.  I understand for most people this is not critical as most hmd's suffer this, but I don't expect a downgrade in SDE when I intend to upgrade.  Yes it has deeper blacks, but I'm not playing those dark games, and the dark grey of other headsets never bothered me. Switching to the HP reverb was the solution for my specific use cases.Note: for most people, the Quest or Rift S is a better unit all things considered for gaming only. But I privilege screen over everything else. And since the Reverb thus far can do everything reasonably well, not perfectly but satisfactorily, and has a fantastic screen compared to the others, I'm now set.

Too heavy. The thing kept wanting to slide down my face unless I tightened it to the point of it hurting my face. With or without the glasses spacer, it lets light in which causes odd halo effects.Quality is not significantly better than the Rift that I already have. In a dim room or a room shaded on one side, the tracking can get very shaky. I'd rather just have sensor bars and a steady view.Screen door effect is fairly strong. Focus blurs as the unit slides down the face, so considering the weight of the unit I found myself holding it up with my hand just t o get a steady image.Nice try, Facebook, but the hype doesn't meet the product in my hands. Maybe VR needs time to grow, or maybe I need a higher end unit.
review_title: Too heavy, not enough improvement over Rift

one_reviews_text: Absolutely amazing and fun device for all ages! Rated four stars because of the slightly "fuzzy" imagery. However, I suspect/hope this will be improved to a crisper image with future generations of the device. This is also something to be used with caution for those that get motion sickness as easily as I do. There are only a a few games/apps that I can enjoy without triggering a headache. I highly recommend adjusting the setting for less likelihood of motion problems, but some games just have to be avoided altogether. Lastly, the device is heavy and can become uncomfortable to wear on the forehead, cheekbones, and neck after awhile. Hopefully, they will also become lighter weight in the future. All in all, though, our family loves this and there's something fun for all of us to enjoy...from games to meditations and everything in between!

Problem 1: I got my oculus a couple days ago new. everything was working just fine. i set it up and put in the batteries that CAME WITH the oculus quest. i played for a day and it was amazing. The next day i was playing and the right controller stopped working. i thought it wasn’t that big of a deal and just took them out and put them back in. The controller didn’t work still. so i took them out again and noticed the batteries were LEAKING OUT. i was really worried. i went and got new batteries and put them in, didn’t work. so i tried cleaning the controller out with rubbing alcohol, didn’t work. i wasn’t paying $70 for a new one so i was going to message oculus about my problem. but couldn’t find anything to message them on. then i tried to find there number but couldn’t find that either. i found something about submitting a ticket to them, then wait 1-2 days to see if they would respond. i gave my controller a couple hours to rest and would come back to it later. i came back and it didn’t work. so i cleaned it out again and let it sit for a couple minutes. then i was about to submit my ticket but i put the battery back in and it worked. i let it sit for a while then i came back and started playing. It’s been 2 days and it’s been working fine. whenever i take the batteries out and put them back in it won’t work sometimes so i’ll just try again and it will be fine. i’m still very upset about this and i’m sorry for other customers with this problem.Problem 2: this isn’t a big problem but i’d like the put it out there. whenever i try to cast my oculus to my phone it never works. it’s only worked once by casting through my oculus to my phone. but it doesn’t work now. then i’ve tried casting through my phone and it says something will pop up on the oculus but i get nothing. i hope i can fix this problem.other than that the oculus is an amazing device and i love it. i would give it 5 stars if i didn’t have those problems though.

This thing is a blast. You really can’t get an impression of what it’s like from YouTube videos. Really a game changer!Only two minor issues: the lenses are blurred at the sides, but fortunately the “sweet spot” is sizable enough that it isn’t an issue. Just something to expect before you buy. Also, my eye-width slider only goes down to 59, but tends to stay at around 60. Supposed to bottom-out at 58.Strap a battery pack on the back with some velcro tape and it adds substantial playtime before needing to plug it into a wall, plus it acts as a counter balance!

Ok, I would like to start of by saying this is a good product, it is a good vr headset. However, it really annoyed me that Oculus decided to sell a prototype headset for ~$400 and release a better, cheaper version, maybe a year later, with little warning. Again, this thing is a good product, I’m just really pissed off. The negatives of this product are same with most other consoles, freezing, crashing, occasional bugs, but there are some worse things. A couple months ago mine had a software update and it caused it to black screen, everything went black and I couldn’t do anything with the headset, so I had to factory reset the thing, and occasionally  when I tried  to launch games the headset just shut off, these problems have smoothed out and are less of a problem recently. All in all, just buy the newer cheaper, better one if you getting a quest. A dick move from Oculus.

I have a vr ready pc, but I have never used a vr headset before. I was picking between this and the rift s because the quest seems like a lot of fun. I was worried about performance issues, framerates, and the refresh rate of the screen. None of these were an issue. Framerates was great, the Hertz of the screen is really nice, and I have not experienced performance issues. If you have never ever experienced vr, you have a vr ready pc, you travel, and you are picking between this and the rift s, go with the quest. Expect around 2-3 hours of play time with games like job simulator, superhot, and beatsaber.
review_title: Nothing I expected, but in a good way.

one_reviews_text: Beware though, this version will not run VR chat very well.Still, for starting out with VR it is a nice entry point.It's important to note that unless you already have an Oculus account predating 2021 you will be forced to link your Facebook profile to the headset. The same applies to Oculus quest 2 which is a better purchase rn if you don't mind the intrusive FB login.
review_title: I like it, it doesn't run everything as well as I'd wish but I recommend it

one_reviews_text: It's unclear why so many Amazon stores are allowed to buy up the world's inventory at retail then sell for $130 more. If this were an essential item during a global disaster, this would be price-gouging. Why can't they buy wholesale and sell at the retail price? This business model will not last as I will pre-order whenever possible. That being said,  Michael's had the earliest delivery promise under Amazon Prime and no extra charge for 2 day shipping, which has been slipping due to Covid-19.  I was shocked that Michael's shipped it the day of the order (Saturday) and it arrived Monday. I'm so happy to have this now when most other inventory is gone. Maybe the extra week or two of use was worth the extra hundred. It's a fantastic product. The tracking within a playspace is what makes this mind-blowing beyond other VR. It will remember the map you created. You can walk from room to room physically while moving in the virtual world. I like to put furniture where the virtual furniture is and take a seat when needed. The headset is front heavy and hurts my head and face. I had to find the best balance and also used a scarf as a headband. The experience is worth it, but don't play too long. Take breaks. Adjust the pressure on your face frequently. You will get used to it.
review_title: Mind blowing VR experience. Pre-order or buy at retail when possible. Price-gouging is rampant.

one_reviews_text: This is probably one of the best value VR headsets on the market. It's important to recognize that Oculus released an Oculus Link cable(basically a high quality USB-C), which allows games from the PC to be played without the limitation of the Oculus Quest store while still retaining the portability. The battery can last for a few hours, but you will want to charge it pretty often. The controllers don't burn through batter that quickly, and it's intuitive to use. I haven't had any frame issues or the screen door effect, and it fits with glasses well too. It's lightweight and there can be no cords involved, making the VR experience much more liberating and enjoyable.

I own the Oculus Go and the Oculus Quest. I picked up the Quest because of the better resolution, hoping to view videos shot on my Insta360 EVO camera. I assumed that the apps available in the Oculus Go and Quest store would be the same. I was wrong.The app to view video directly from the EVO is available for the Go but not for the Quest. Apparently the Go is considered an entry-level device by Oculus - made for watching videos and playing some light games - and the Quest is built for more hardcore VR gaming. There are other gaps in the apps available on the store as well, but for my purposes this one was the most annoying.I understand that there can be hardware limitations on the Go, but the Quest is their flagship product - anything that runs on the Go will run in the Quest. Not offering the same apps that run on the Go and trying to pigeonhole users into different categories is short-sighted on Oculus’s part.Other than that, the Quest is well built, the graphics and sound are excellent, and the interface is well executed. If you’re buying the Quest or the Go for a specific purpose, make sure the apps you want to run are available on the device you choose.
review_title: The Oculus Quest and the Go stores don’t carry the same apps.

one_reviews_text: I ordered this for a Santa gift for my kids. Product arrived quickly. Box was in great condition. Batteries came with the product so you could use the game and remotes right away. I will say I was very amazed with how realistic this is. You really feel like you are in the Games! You also can sync this up to your phone and watch what the player is seeing. It makes it more interesting.A couple downsides to it: 1. One of the batteries was bad or exploded as when you opened the remote backing, it was sticky and there was the white powdery substance that you see from bad batteries. It is all in the remote. It has not affected the use but for the money spent, I was a little upset. 2. You can’t create more than one profile on this. I set this up prior to Christmas morning, and set it up under me. I found out when the kids wanted to play, that they aren’t able to have their own profile. As far as I can tell, if you play a game and leave off somewhere, it’s going to pick right back up where it was left off when someone else plays.Overall, I’m very satisfied with this product. It def gets you moving and provides some exercise. It has been a good device for me and the kids to do stuff together.

The little dome on the mountainside atmosphere that you are in while accessing the menu is worth the price right off the bat. I didn't want to give my son (whom this was a bday gift for) a turn on it. I loved it. Games can be pricey, but comes with the territory I imagine. I have a feeling this is going to be a fun and wonderful investment. My only complaint is the fact that upon opening the box, I discovered that there was absolutely NO paperwork included. Nothing. No user manual. No quick reference guide, no warranty card. Nothing. It is my fault for not checking if it was included. I assumed it would be, given it is a gaming device, but assuming is notorious for incorrect outcomes. All in all, I believe we will get years of enjoyment from this fun gadget.

he played it two days and then his nose started bleeding like someone beat the crap out of him.  We thought maybe a fluke thing then he played it again and it started happening playing the game i mean blood pouring out of his nose.  He said his eyes and head hurt for days after.  he could not see straight too. he was completely discombobulated.  He plays all kinds of games on many platforms with no issues.  maybe they have some bugs to work out cuz i have seen reports online of the same things happening to other people and kids
review_title: Extreme Bloody Noses like my 9yr old got beat by a bat in his face

one_reviews_text: This thing is amazing i own all of Oculus Vr headsets and this is the ONE !Easy. No computer or phone needed.You fire this puppy outline your pla area then your off to the racies in a matter of seconds.This product it going to change the face of video gaming.Be a part of the future !Its great exercise ! Its fun , its affordable.its comfortable ... it hits all the boxes !THE best vr ive ever experienced i played in my backyard i ran all over the place lol ...while o dont recommend it its possible with QUEST. .Do yourself a favor and you you one for yourself or your kids... you will not regret it. .and if you do...amazon has a good return policy. But you wont use it  . You will be in love with this... its my favorite gadget ever . Im so happy everyone can experience Quality Virtual reality at such an affordable price .If your new to vr or a veteran and you love questThen come and Join us in the Oculus Quest Facebook group!  There help of you need it
review_title: Best VR headset on the market

one_reviews_text: The Quest is a very impressive machine and actually feels like VR is ready to really take off. The ability to setup anywhere is great especially sticking it in a bag and heading to a friends house. As the software updates more features become available like pass through+ and soon finger tracking without controllers. There are tons of pros but using it I have found downsides that are by no means make it a dealbreaker.Cons:- Needing a smartphone to set up the quest even if you only need it once why not just eliminate that step all together.- The way the headset tracks the controllers is the four cameras on the corners on the front side of the unit. There aren’t any on the side so it will lose tracking which for some things makes it frustrating-The touch controllers would have been nice to just have rechargeable batteries instead of AA batteries. I would have probably bought a base station for it if this were the case and I’d definitely recommend getting some rechargeable AA’s.-Not being able to stream the image to any smart TV or computer is annoying. I understand it works if you pick up a chromecast TV attachment and it can stream to smart phones. Like I said, just seems annoying since just about everyone has a smart tv but not a chromecast it’s just one more useless thing to buy.- The visor part that your head rests on is cloth based and it absorbs all sweat and will feel drenched after strenuous activity on Beat Saber, won’t be much passing around the headset then.Pros:- If you have a decent computer and a good home network you can have a untethered PCVR and it works brilliantly, google it there’s multiple ways to accomplish this even for free.- Oculus/Facebook is relentlessly updating the software to add incredible featuresThere are cons that I went into detail about I feel like a lot of people will run into them. The pros which I only listed a few of tons more, by far outweigh the cons I’d recommend anyone to try out VR with the Quest.

First off this is a great product really entertaining for friends and family it becomes the life of the party and has endless hours of play time to give. that being said getting into the PC aspect of it. there is some limitations with this product. since there are no sensors (outside the ones built into the headset) given with said product. a lot of occulus Rift games played through link can appear really clunky slow and not fun to play. Gorn, Blade And Sorcery are good examples. two handed weapons are impossible to use because your tracking goes bunk any time you move out of the angle. Gorn isnt terrible but B&S was very apparent. even single handed combat in B&S was a chore and really not solid or smooth at all. now is this really a deal breaker? not really it plays games like walking dead saints and sinners pretty decently and smoothly. its a great headset and since the Rift has been sold out for ages and hardly comes back into stock this is a good alternative IMO. shooter games run great like Pavlov and you'll be able to access any VR game but take that with a grain of salt because you wont get the best tracking possible without room sensors. i believe you can purchase and link to the headset but you'd have to look for guides. if you want the best of the best for your PC you might want to spend the extra money to get an index or Vive but its up to you. if you are only going to be playing melee combat games with intensive tracking id do some more research to see if this is best for you. if you are casual maybe play some VRchat or TWD some shooters id go for it. it is kind of a steep price range though if you will only be using it on PC id just wait until you can get your hands on the Rift. or go with another headset. if you plan on playing it with friends in the living room or with family this is definitely the headset for you
review_title: Fun but has some problems if you plan to use for PC as well

one_reviews_text: After the first day, I feel like there is already so much to do in this realm of virtual space! There is not much you can't do, provided this industry keeps growing! You will definitely entertain friends and family by letting them put it on and let them experience this wizardry for themselves. The only issue I have had with it is getting a little motion sickness from trying to move with the control sticks rather than teleportation or just walking around. There are not many games that make you move with the control sticks, so that is good.Your guardian space , the space in real life that you make so that you don't bump into things, is really neat! You can peek our and see the real world in black and white with your headset on...no need to take it off! I played about 2.5 hours straight, and at that point, it does feel a little heavy, but I will make sure to take breaks more often in the future. I like testing the limits of things (even if I try to catch a frisbee above my head and smash my hand into the ceiling...yes I am a tall person!)I hope whoever reads this review understand just how much fund you can have in a non-real place. There is so much to do already, with more to come! You can hang out and watch movies with your friends and talk like they are right there. I think this will be the next step with social encounters. Anyways, get yourself one, and have a blast! You won't be sorry!
review_title: Virtual Reality is the great escape!

one_reviews_text: The Quest is a really great headset. The only real downside is that the graphics and refresh rates are lower than what you would find in PC headsets, but it is by no means unplayable and doesn't ruin the experience at all. The wireless capabilities are nice if you want to bring it to other people's houses or if you just don't want to deal with wires getting in your way. I have tried the Rift S and it definitely has better graphics quality compared to the Quest but the benefits of the Quest outweigh that negative. As for the storage, the 64 GB is plenty and especially with the option of PC linking, I see no reason to go for the pricier 128 GB. Overall, it's an amazing headset that is well worth it.

I've been interested in VR since the very beginning, but, as a younger person just barely out of college, I never had (and still don't have) the means to afford $800+ setups. I finally decided to treat myself and grab the quest, and man, I am absolutely blown away.As soon as I put this thing on my head, I was smiling like an idiot. As my first vr experience, having only seen it through YouTube videos, the simple joy of feeling totally immersed and interacting with things around me was mind blowing. I couldn't help but pass it over to my girlfriend who was watching, and my dad a few minutes later, and they all had the same reactions: big, goofy grins.And that's what makes this device in particular so special.
