Out of all the VR setups, this one has to be the most social. With the quest, you don't need to have someone follow you to your bedroom where your pc is, or worse, lug the pc somewhere else. Just take the headset off and pass it around. It's so simple and fun.As someone who has never used VR before, the graphics in most games I've played look great. You can tell they've been toned back in some places, but honestly, the games are too fun to care. If you're coming from a pc, you'll probably see a graphical downgrade, but this device isn't meant as an upgrade. It's an alternative.Recently, oculus just announced the icing on the cake, making the Quest possibly the most versatile VR headset around. Soon, they'll be rolling out Quest Link - if you already have a gaming pc, you can connect (via their premium cable, but still...) to a pc and play full, pc oculus games. Not only that, but in an update, they are rolling out hand tracking. No need for controllers at all. Just your hands. Pretty cool, and I had no clue when I bought this. Now it's essentially the Nintendo switch of VR. Best of both worlds.I'll finish by saying this: if you have been interested in vr, but don't see yourself getting a gaming pc and $800 headset, then this is the device for you. Full stop, best bang for your buck. Just get it.

I got the 128 GB version from Amazon.Pros:The guardian system is cool and I DID NOT GET ANY MOTION SICKNESS with the 6 degrees of freedom (6DOF) that comes with this front-facing cameras guardian system. However, it's probably related to programs that took advantage of the 6DOF.Vadar Immortal would best summarize as YOU FEEL LIKE YOU ARE THERE! It's only episode 1 but it's just incredible!.All the games I tried were interesting and fun. It's much bigger then what you see in the pictures. The pictures just show the frontal view. You feel the presence and the movie theater screen looks like iMax. Network videos and pictures ran well. 3D videos also work. Some of the games involve significant physical effort.Cons:The headset is front heavy. You really feel the weight when watching videos but not so much when playing games.Facebook/Oculus should consider making an improved version of "Oculus Quest Standard Facial Interface" as an aftermarket optional accessory to help dissipate the weight of the headset especially at the areas underneath the eyes. That'll drastically improve the user experience.Screen door effect is noticeable during video watching.Video quality is not that sharp especially in slow gaming environments when you start focusing on the details.Summary:Incredible technology with tremendous fun factor! The feeling of presence and lack of motion sickness with programs that take advantage of the 6DOF are amazing!

Purchased this just in time for Christmas, and oh man I think it was a mistake...it’s just too much fun! Haha! My son is addicted to the boxing games on here and can break some serious sweat while playing. My brother loves the beat saber game. My nephews both play Super Hot and Vader Immortal. We are planning on getting a second one for the household so we can do some local multiplayer stuff! The headset is made of great quality. It’s comfortable out of the box, but I can see why they make so many other accessories for it. I don’t know whether the ease of use or the family time we enjoy while playing it is the best thing about it. I guess you’ll have to try it for yourself and see what it does for you! Enjoy! We have the 64gb version.

Arrived very quickly and in perfect-looking condition. Quality box too, all wires new, all glass covered, etc., as if it were brand new and not a refurbished at all. However, just refused to work- got to a certain point and would go no further. I could not tell you why. Neither could any amount of O support.Sometimes you just get a dud. I’m not sure it’s anything to do with their refurbishment because you can’t test for every configuration.

This is my third VR headset after PSVR and Windows Mixed Reality. I’ve had the Quest for a week now and it’s getting heavy use. It’s been called the “Nintendo Switch” of VR and I think that title is deserved. My wife wasn’t very interested in the VR before, but the excellent games and experiences for the Quest have won her over.

Just gave it 4 stars as I haven't actually played with it enough to see what all it can do.The item is really amazing in the fact that it's SO different and really fun.The hand controls to pick up items takes a bit of practice and getting use to. The head piece fits nice and if a person wears glasses it can be adjusted to accommodate your eyeglasses without damaging them so that's a BIG plus. The roller coaster ride through the dinosaur jungle made me quesy but that's just me.My husband loved it and the boxing game and got a good work out! Lol..Iam excited to watch some television shows in my virtual living room. All in all I can see many many fun evenings sharing with friends and family and getting to know more about this item and buying various games! This item is going to be a blast.I just danced with an alien a few minutes ago! Buy it! You won't regret it!

My God. I ripped my hair out for a week trying to figure out how to get Oculus Link (still beta) working. Now that it's working tho, WOW. I have a gen 1 rift, that I'll be giving to my roommate, as this headset does it all.This replaced my plug-in rift, and doubles as a mobile VR system. Couldn't be any happier.Advice for those just setting up Oculus link.Get all the latest drivers/firmware for your graphics card and quest. Make sure it's all installed.Make sure you have the best USB cables you can get your mitts on (along with ports on your PC that can supply the correct amperages)Turn off the Nvidia screen capture thing (can't remember what it's called, but it's in your get force experience)Quest link has been running flawlessly on my Alienware m17r5 laptop.Again. Quest is pretty neat. Couldn't be happier.

So, I own the Vive, and thought this would be a good supplement for bringing to friends' houses to show them VR, or to have something for the living room.  For those instances, it's fantastic... if you don't have a PC VR setup to know what you're missing, it's really hard not to love the Quest.  If you have a 5' x 5' space and a computer capable of running the Rift S though, get that, it's so much better.  Still, for those with deeper pockets, this might be perfect as a supplement, or to do things like play beat saber in a different room in your house.  I had to decide between one or the other, and having a PC capable of running the Rift S, I just felt like I was giving up too much with the Quest.
review_title: Great intro to VR, but not if you have space and the rig for PCVR.

one_reviews_text: Was thinking about getting into the VR world. I have a pretty beefy gaming pc in my basement, but I didnt want to have to hang out down there every time I wanted a friend or the wife to play beatsaber. Read that the quest is going to support tethering to the pc, but can also be used completely stand alone which is the best of both worlds. The only downside is the 72hz refresh rate, but based on comments by Carmack that it can technically support up to 90hz, I am expecting the modding community to figure that out at some point, or have Oculus officially update that. Seriously great purchase and well worth the price of admission. We bought a second one for the wife 1 day after getting mine.
review_title: This is what the future of VR is to me

one_reviews_text: The one I got has some sort of defect in the upper right lens, makes it blurrier than the rest of the screen. Also I had a software glitch that seemed to desync the headset, library and other options wouldn't load, had to factory reset.As a note oculus should really include free games to start you off, now that they bought beatsaber they should include it free, sell song packages to make $.

I have a very strong stomach, but this thing has given me the worst motion sickness/ nausea followed by headaches every time I use it.  One of my kids and my wife have the same problem. the focus is right, the placement on the head as well, just how we react to it.  only 1 of my kids is able to use it for a period longer than 20-30 mts.  really strange.  now as far as the functionality of this thing, its pretty impressive, too bad it is so hard to use it for longer that 10 mts without wanting to puke.
review_title: Beware, Severe motion sickness is possible.

one_reviews_text: The good:I love my headset, its by far the most complete VR hardware and software package on the market (of it's time) and has amazing performance for being a mobile VR headset. Wireless VR via Virtual Desktop is shockingly actually really usable and allows me to play Half Life Alex while my PC is across the house.The bad:I had to stop using my headset last year due to the fan geometry in the headset drying out my eyes and the skin around my eyes. I think it's due to the fan in the back of the headset sucking air from around the eye pieces and blowing it out the front of the headset. It's great since it keeps the graphics processor cool and the lenses  free of fog, but since the only real opening is next to the nose, the air is sucked in around the nose piece, hits the users eyes, and then flows into the headset. This strips moisture off the users eyes and means I can only use it for 30 minutes max on dry days during the winter. I would just ask the hardware engineers working on these headsets to consider users in dry climates and add vents around the headset to avoid air having to enter next to the nose piece.-Thanks!Colin

For the most part, we are quarantine because of Covid, and for my health concerns my son is not out playing like he should be.  I wanted to buy him something to make up for his sacrifices.  I'm so glad I did.  He got it Saturday and is actually participating in team sports that require some light physical activity.  He's also interacting with other kids.  I tried them on and they are amazing.  I wasn't expecting them to be so good.Some warning though, older kids and young adults who have never grown up, swear when bad things happens.  Every once in awhile, they'll drop an "F" bomb. but I can hear everything that is said.
review_title: My son is having a great time.

one_reviews_text: Its great to have Parents, and grand parents who arn't into technology try one of these headsets just to be blown away with how far we have gotten in tech. But however I did not find myself using it daily or nearly as much as I thought I would, but its great for parties.  My ONLY complaint is how much every game is on the oculous store opposed to the steam VR store, you can use this headset for PC VR games outside the oculous store but you would have to buy Oculous Link or a alternative which will put you 30-80 dollars in the hole ontop of this. Which have some problems of its own. But its a great way to show how far we have come in Virtual Reality. Another Almost Perfect
review_title: Awesome to show people who never experienced full motion 3D VR before

one_reviews_text: I bought this knowing the link to Facebook. I also knew that I could use it without logging into Facebook.  Now, I get this popup telling me to log into Facebook since Facebook officially bought Oculus.  No.  Just, no.Games are Ok.  I do have issues with some things. like reloading a pistol.  But, it is mostly fun.  I mostly just do the experiences. Visit places in 3D, go to concerts, and my fav, learn how to make angel wings.  Lots of fun stuff.If you are like me, and hate Facebook, you might want to skip the Oculus brand.

Stay away from Oculus headsets until they get their quality control up to par. I've owned 4 Oculus headsets, starting with the Go. Every one of them has had issues.The Go (from Walmart) arrived with a dead pixel, so I sent it back. I liked the technology, though, so I decided to upgrade to the Quest on the next go around.My first Quest (from Amazon) arrived with a swath of darkened pixels at the top of the left eye. It was very disorienting, so I set that headset back. They were out of stock, so I had to accept a refund instead of a replacement.About a month later, I ordered my second Quest (from Walmart). It arrived with a frozen/dead green pixel, popping sound issues (or no sound at all), and would randomly freeze and crash. I was busy, so I didn't thoroughly test this headset. When I realized there were issues, I had missed the return window by 1 day.So I sent that headset in to Oculus for repairs. The RMA process was easy enough, but what I got back was another faulty unity (directly from Oculus). This one arrived with sound issues, and recently, the tracking has started to malfunction.What are the odds that all 4 units that I've owned would have issues? They obviously have some serious quality control problems. These headsets are not worth what they're charging for them. Not at this failure rate. I'd stay away from Oculus until they get their stuff together (if they ever do).

This is a great system, our family had so much fun with it. HOWEVER...I have to only give it 1 star based completely on customer service. The only way to contact them is email, and every email takes 2-5 business days to respond. Some responses are maddening, like...."when you gave us your address, you left out the zip code" even when the zip code was encluded. That took 10 days total in response time. We have had a broken unit because it fell off my son's head while playing a game and hit the floor. It is December and has been broken since September.  I guess I can take it up with my credit card possibly(???) Don't buy it because of the lack of customer service, it isn't worth the headache

The Oculus Quest is amazing! NO WIRES! Many say it is uncomfortable and I can agree but everything else that comes in the package makes up for its faults. The Oculus Quest can play many games and looks AMAZING with its OLED display with the 1440x1600 display! Though the refresh rate is lower than other headsets, it is not noticeable at all. Tracking is insane especially since it has no external sensors. Finally the setup, THE SETUP IS SO EASY! Takes less than 5 minutes to set up and you can begin playing. All the other times after the first, you just put the headset on and you're in a whole different reality. YOU WILL NOT REGRET BUYING THIS!
review_title: This is the most amazing thing and will be a big part of the future's technology!

one_reviews_text: VR is a wonderful technology, and saving up to try this beauty was well worth it.The option to play this with or without a PC has been great. The controllers take a bit of getting used to, but after a few days, you'll get the grasp of it quite easily. Honestly, I can't find any complaints. It's just such a good headset.Just remember games purchased on Oculus will not be purchased on Steam. You will need to either purchase it on the Oculus store, on Steam, or both (if you want the best of both worlds for some reason). Besides that, a wonderful purchase overall.
review_title: One Of My Most Favorite Purchases

one_reviews_text: Headset is very cool and pretty much exactly what I was expecting until about a week after use the right controller malfunctioned and one of the buttons seems to be "stuck" so it won't trigger correctly in the UI.I contacted Oculus support online who ran me through 45 min of questions and troubleshooting only to tell me that I would need to wait 5 days for their "escalation team" to review and decide if I was eligible for an RMA. Needless to say, I'm pretty unimpressed with this level of customer support and am trying to decide whether to replace through Amazon since it's so soon after purchase or just return altogether if this is how product support works over at Oculus.
review_title: Fun while it works - support for defective controller is lacking

one_reviews_text: This VR device is amazing.... not because of it's quality, but because of it's PORTABILITY-TO-QUALITY ratio.  It's 85% as good as tethered VR Headsets that cost more than twice as much.  And that's a good deal.  However, you get gouged in the Oculus store when buying games.  Games that are on SteamVR for other headsets that go for $15 will cost $25 on here.  But, if you can afford it, this is an amazing deal!!!!  I own 5 VR headsets (including a Vive pro) and I use this one more than any of the others.
review_title: Truly AMAZING VR device; but expensive games

one_reviews_text: This review comes from someone who has tried a bunch of VR headsets and owned a PCVR - Oculus Rift. I was a sceptic about it but wanted to see what the wireless freedom got me compared to PCVR. I will be getting a second one for multiplayer and getting rid of my original Rift.This is a game changer. If you are considering it, go for it. Everyone I have introduced this to in the last week has said they are buying one. The ease of use and wireless really out way any of the (small) cons. The quality of games is much better than I anticipated. My 11 Year old son and 5 Year old daughter use it like crazy. You put it on and within seconds you are in VR and launching whatever game/app you want. Oculus knocked it out of the park with this one.I added a battery pack to it to extend playtime. It charges while playing and we got about 5 hours total out of it while we had a bunch of people over sharing it.

I don't even know where to begin. This Virtual Reality Headset is top of the line. Anybody looking for more freedom in virtual reality will enjoy the guardian boundary (similar to Steam's Virtual reality boundary). The tracking has gotten much better in the past update bringing tracking to be more reliable and accurate. The lower refresh rate (in comparison to other headsets) does not decrease the immersion you will enter. I've gone hours at a time playing vr simply because I was so immersed and lost track of time. Games like Beat Saber will not have issues tracking as long as your hands aren't behind your back for too long.Some cons:1. The slightly smaller game library may put off some people, but many game developers are introducing their games to sideloading through sidequest.2. Oculus has been denying many developers from their store library for some reason. Games like Pavlov VR were denied resulting in them being forced to use sidequestPros:1. Incredibly immersive, and fun2. PC VR streaming is possible after jumping through a few very small hoops3. Ease of use. This headset can easily be moved from one place to another and set up within 30 seconds.4. Great way to spend time with family and friends. Although you will have to purchase (if not already owned) a Google Chromecast 3rd gen or newer.

I am surprised at the quality of the standalone VR experience.  The real bonus to this device is that you can connect to a gaming PC and use like an Oculus Rift S. And.. if you have a little technical know how you can get that feature working wirelessly! Mind blown! I would definitely say that as of 4/2020 this is the best bang for your buck for VR. It's not going to give you the visuals of a Valve Index but it almost does and for $600 less and has the standalone feature! If you are looking to get into VR this is the way to go right now.
review_title: Best VR bang for the buck for 2020

one_reviews_text: This thing is wild.  My kids saved up their money to buy it.  I don't tell my kids what to spend their money on, but I was pretty sure this would be a waste.  Not so...  Not at all.  It's wildly entertaining.  It's stand alone so it knly needs a wifi connection.  It comes with a ton of demos so you can try things out (pretty in depth) so you can find what kinds of games you like (puzzle, shooter, Rollercoaster) and the games are pretty inexpensive.  My kids have enjoyed the crap out of this thing.
review_title: Absolutely worth the money.  You gotta see this.

one_reviews_text: Ok so let me explain .... I don't know much about head sets .. my friend let me use his and and it had no problems .. this one in the other hand kinda wants me to restart it a few times it kinda freeze's now idk if my friend just got lucky or if I'm unlucky but I gave it a 4 for that reason now when it is working it works good .. idk I kinda hope it was just having a hickup during the setup process

You can sideload a ton of additional apps and even stream PC VR games to the headset! I wasn't expecting this functionality when purchasing, but it works great if you have a good PC and network capable of handling the data (5ghz AC router recommended)I got Skyrim VR, Space Pirate Trainer, Google Earth and Rez Infinite working via PC streaming. The apps available in the Quest store are good as well, though may be lower fidelity than the PC version. I'd personally recommend Beat Saber, Superhot and Vader Immortal

Minus the way Facebook scumbagged the games forcing you to only be able to play games from their store, even going so far as making Virtual Desktop remove the ability to stream games specifically off of Steam. The headset itself is great, but the downside you may find is the games are smaller scales of the original. They left that out entirely before launch as well. Those factors aside the headset is still wonderful at what it does. You can play anywhere and my kids absolutely LOVE their game time. Some titles are cross play from the Rift, some, not all. Also more reason to purchase from the Oculus store. I will check if titles are cross play before I purchase them. Sometimes it requires a little hunting since they havent quite thought ahead to put that in an easy to find spot every time. Half rambling probably but I do highly recommend for the kids or yourself if you don't have a decent PC for a Rift.

I am female, 60 years old and have had so much fun with the Oculus Quest!! My son is stationed approximately 6,000 miles away. He has a Quest as well. We have played paintball in rec room and a few other games. Most awesome experience ever! I talk to him, his avatar even smiles when he smiles! Wow, technology! I am petite so my only complaint is the general fit of the headset. Other than that, fantastic and so much fun...even for an older person like myself.

Absolute Garbage! I have nothing good to say about the Oculus Quest all in one VR headset. From the moment I received this, it was a headache. The headache didn't go away until I sent it back. No, wait, it's still there. Caused by just the thought of it.I'll start this rant with its weight. It weights 1.5 POUNDS! Way too much for anyone's comfort. You the consumer will have to spend at least an additional $150 dollars to make it comfortable enough to wear for just a short period of time. Then, the odor! Something in its materials just absolutely stinks. That alone made me want to puke.The software is nothing more than a means for Facebook/Oculus to gather information about you, or any person whom uses the headset, to tailor their ads and slap you in the face with it. Its buggy, it lags, its choppy. My list of negative adjectives goes on for days.MAKE NOTE OF THIS: If you are a Simmer, ie: you play simulation games such as Digital Combat Simulator or Microsoft Flight Simulator, this is not the VR headset for you. STAY AWAY! DO NOT PURCHASE THIS HEADSET! The effort, work and software that MUST be downloaded/sideloaded to get the headset to work in those environments is monumental. Definitely not a "plug and play" device.Lastly Facebook/Oculus, DO NOT reply to MY review with your corporate "contact our customer service/support, we'll be happy to help you". It will be nothing more than confirmation that you manufactured a (add your own expletive here) product that serves your purpose and not those of your customers.

Followed the rebirth of VR from 2012 (duck tape prototype, Dk1 etc.) yet never pulled the trigger on buying a headset until now. The portibility and convenience of just being able to throw it on my head and transport myself to other worlds instantly is amazing. I am 42, have kids and have very little time to game. The half hour I get just to therapeuticly pop the quest on my face is...well...theraputic. Wander is my favorite app. Moss, Super hot and Space pirate also help me forget (my) stressful world for a while.
review_title: Easy, transporting, theraputic. Love my Quest.

one_reviews_text: I love how Oculus Quest is an all in one device without PC, i've always wanted to be able to port my VR headset everywhere.I was an original owner of the OG vive and still love it, but now i can bring a more portable headset without having to lug around 2 base stations, 2 controllers, a bunch of wires, and a laptop/PC for its use.The cost is like purchasing a console, i see no downsides except that i have to repurchase games that I want to share when porting it around.
review_title: Love how its a all in one device

one_reviews_text: Hello, i have that great device, but I'm not happy coz they ignored only Quest for some -% summer discuss. I have only one VR devise and Oculus just not add some sales for my own device. Now i don't want to buy any apps from the store coz they just ignore my device and i don't want to buy the game for Rift and again for Quest! This is the same game, why i should buy it two times? Also, not a lot of games for Quest and price is near 30$ and without any sales!+Two stars only for the great and stable Quest device, -three is for greedy marketing.
review_title: Oculus just ignore Quest on summer sales and expensive apps..

one_reviews_text: I experienced VR the first time a couple of years ago, but the system required a high powered computer to run it. The Oculus Quest is a stand alone VR headset, operates on its own, no other equipment needed. The VR experience is very good, although I'm a relative newby, so I'm not really an expert. Lots of games/apps are available as demo downloads and you get a real good idea whether or not you want to spend the money on the full version. A little spendy, but a huge jump up from the Oculus Go, from what I've read. Go for it!

My son has thoroughly enjoyed his Oculus Quest since mid-August of 2020.  Games have been fun, overall VR experience is very good.  However.  The headset lost video mid-March and customer service is abhorrent.  No phone number to contact, emails go days before a response is received.  We have determined that the unit needs replacement, however I'm unable to receive any response from Oculus on my issue.

I don't think I've ever purchased an electronic gaming gadget that I've enjoyed as much as I had the Quest.  The quality of the display is unreal.  The sound is outstanding.  It takes a little getting used to wearing it, but that actually happens pretty quick.  As for learning how to use the controllers and playing the games that comes very fast.  I've found myself running the battery down a couple of times playing games while sitting, but that's actually a good thing, it makes me take a break from it.

I bought the very first Samsung Gear VR years ago for use with the Galaxy Note 5 and was amazed then at the technology. I hated the lack of controllers at the time and the screendoor effect which ruined the visual aesthetic when watching Netflix or any video content.Cut to many years later and I decided out of curiosity how much VR technology has evolved. I'm really pleased with the Oculus Quest. The software feels much more polished and smoother. More immersive which is the main point of VR, and I absolutely love the controllers.The screendoor effect is still there and noticeable but definitely improved upon. Watching Netflix or 4K video content is actually enjoyable now. People have complained about the weight and lack of comfort while wearing the Quest but I find it okay. Took a little while to adjust the velcro straps but I am able to wear for a couple of hours without any real discomfort. I guess this will be an issue for some and not for others.Apps wise there are some good offerings on there at launch but very little free content. Expect to pay between $9.99 to $24.99 but there are a few free trials to help decide whether a game or app is right for you. The battery does roughly last as long as the advertised 2 to 3 hours depending on your usage. Gaming burns through the battery a lot quicker obviously. I like the long charging cable which let's you continue to play while charging. There is also an adapter if you wear glasses included in the box.The software requests that you mark out your playing area and does so with the camera sensors. This is genius and stops you from walking into walls or furniture. It also highlights where you have placed the controllers and its then easy to pick them up. The controllers feel ergonomic and intuitive. It takes a little while to get used to the button mapping but you'll be picking up objects in no time.Looking forward to playing with the Quest more over the coming weeks and excited to see what upcoming games and apps will become available.In short, this wont be for everyone and maybe a little too gimmicky and expensive for the very casual VR fan, but this finally feels like how VR was originally intended and is a great experience.

One of the coolest things I’ve played with in my life. Personally I have a computer and I rarely use it in mobile mode. I am a very big VRchat fan and have always wanted to play with my friends in vr. It really has changed my life and is absolutely one of the best purchases I’ve made.In a quick summary of the product -Fun as just a standalone headset and am impressed by what it can do by itself, but I find it A lot more fun with the link. If I go to my friends house I’ll bring my computer with me to run it. Just because I want the little extra kick of seeing people’s avatars in VRChat WHICH  is all I play. I’ve played a few other free titles on the quest alone and they are pretty fun
review_title: With or without link, it’s still hours of fun!

one_reviews_text: Teaching yoga for a decade I can see some great uses for this device. The gaming is un-real, graphics unbelievable, the most inter-active real life. The free apps are well worth downloading. Beware start with easy, the rollercoaster parks made me get an upset stomach the first time around. Chat rooms are easy to go in and out. Language issues can be a problem. You talk to people all around the world. Any you-tube that has a VR label watch them. You will not be disappointed. The price for the app games are reasonable priced. You have in your library forever. Chat rooms have some really interested people that have a lot of knowledge about computers. Worth every penny!.  T.D.

I bought a quest on release day in 2019. It’s awesome. Recently started getting black screen of death and I’m sick of factory resets. I can’t use quest two because I have a man size ipd. I ordered twice more off this seller here and both times received quest 2’s. Not sure why they’re advertising quest 1 and I keep receiving quest 2. Seller said it’s coming from Amazon direct so take it up with them. Decided to not waste my time and I ordered a 128 gb used off Marcari. Hopefully it’s good to go.

This product failed after several months of use.  The company provides no means of contact besides a customer support email address.  Response to inquiries is typically no response or "check back later."  Customer support instructed us to return it for repair after several attempts to reset and update software. Item was replaced with a unit which was defective on arrival.  We were given a return label to ship back the second unit.  The return was apparently lost in shipment.  The companies response was "check back later."  This has continued for going on two months. I contacted UPS and was told the shipment was lost, but I have no recourse since Oculus is their customer. I contacted Oculus with the information and Oculus' response for the past several weeks has been "check back later.  The company apparently has no interest in making this right.  In the mean time, my son has been without his vr headset for 6 months of the year he has owned it!
review_title: Do not purchased. Defective product, terrible product support.

one_reviews_text: We've had fun taking turns playing games while casting to the TV.  A friend of mine has the HTC Vive, and honestly I couldn't tell the difference in how it looked in-game.  Admittedly the games in the Oculus store are less graphic intensive than the ones on Steam.  As an entry level VR setup, it's totally worth the money, and the 64GB has been more than enough for us so far.  With the latest updates (and the use of a USB-C to USB-C cable and a computer that meets the specs) you can use the Quest as a Rift, so it's really two in one!

Oculus has done a fantastic job of providing a totally new experience at a reasonable cost. The device is intuitive and exciting to use. Even the tutorial on using the controls is a fun experience in a virtual world ranging from launching throwing paper airplanes to launching hand held rockets to controlling a blimp through virtual remote controls. Whether you want to learn Tai Chi in an interactive session or box a virtual opponent or playing an addictive light sabre game, this device brings it all. I bought the 64GB device and have not found any limitations.

I am in love. I was nervous thinking this was going to be a close second to the phone "VR" sets. So far from it. This was a Christmas present for my son and I cant stop playing it, except to write this. Easy to set up and get right to it. Connecting it to Steam was a bit of a challenge but there is an additional purchase that allows you to mirror your computer on to the Oculus BUT we needed to purchase the additional cord to do that; that is the only draw back. Other than that it is amazing, awesome, and I'm going to get one for myself.

These are a lot of fun. If you are familiar with how cumbersome VR headsets used to be, what with all the cables and weight, so these (and Quest 2) are a breath of fresh air. They are fast enough for the types of games that run on them. Just make sure you have a lot of room around you, otherwise you might damage the controllers and/or your arms and legs.

I’ve been using my Quest daily for almost a week now and I am completely blown away by what Oculus has achieved here. Everything worked flawlessly roughy out of the box (tracking, setup, sound, etc.) The graphics have wowed me despite this being a mobile chipset and the sensation of presence is extraordinary. Comfort could be improved but this is mainly due to the weight of the device. Battery lasts a satisfyingly long time and it can still be played while charging if necessary. Watching the Quest blow the minds of friends and family is really rewarding too!

I love this headset. I haven’t tried any others so can’t give a comparison. But I can say that I’m completely satisfied with what this headset has to offer. Being cordless is key- I don’t think I would be happy using one with a cord now that I’ve experienced the freedom. It’s also super user friendly. I play this for around 30 minutes every day which is perfect for me. I have found the headset to be uncomfortable- but I’m sure that is just a necessary feature when you have a stand-alone device like this.

I've been waiting to get this for a while. Yes, the games are fun. But for me, it's the videos. Since I'm home so much from the pandemic, it's nice to just pop this on and take a trip to the beach. Plus my friend has one so we can play games together and do rec room, and get on a call via the headset while in it. The visual quality is a lot better than I anticipated as well.Yes, it could be a little lighter, but they are working on that. And, I get a little motion sick in some videos, but I have motion sickness in general. Nothing too bad though, it's barely noticeable unless I play for a while.Definitely one of my best buys of 2020 (not including toilet paper and sanitizer :p)

This new Oculus Quest is nothing short of amazing.  This is my first vr experience and i am glad i waited for this unit to be developed.  It is completely wireless and does not require a pc.  Set up was in minutes and after the update it ran flawless out of the box.  The demo is amazing.  This is a must buy for VR or gamers alike.  Tried to buy a second unit for multiplayer and it is sold out.

Bought this for my teenager.  I love playing on it too when I can get it away from him. :o)Seems the Oculus is continually adding new games and updates.  I was a little worried about this when we first purchased as to if I was spending a lot of money on something that didn't have a ton of games like xbox or playstation does but it looks like Oculus is working on getting there!The even better thing about it is that it is giving my kid some exercise and movement while playing a game vs. just sitting down with a controller and looking at a TV screen.
review_title: Hefty Price but it is AWESOME!

one_reviews_text: Im a game developer and this was the best VR hardware I have used. The cable-less factor is a huge relief. It’s worth the compromise in performance. Also the resolution and frame rate are satisfactory but I believe in the future clarity and blurriness from hardware limitations will eventually be significantly better. Ideally a retina quality high resolution display with no optical magnification for pixels would be great but I doubt it’s possible without a tether and high end gpu anytime soon.
review_title: Best VR because of no cables

one_reviews_text: Amazing simply amazing I am not a true gammer okay mostly on iPad now days but man is this system awesome. No hookup to a computer if tethering to a console true free play in a virtual environment. My 10 almost 11 year old lived it plays by herself and my 5 year old plays with assistance (not move too much without guidence)Fun for the whole family games are not very expensive through Oculus app would recommend for a while family may pick up one more when side by side games come more available

Bought this for my boyfriends birthday and it was my mistake that I didn’t pay attention to which model it was but the newer model with more GB is less money, I could have waited and spent 200 on the newest model that has WAY more GB. Don’t waste your money on an older model, I wasted over $400 on this POS

I'm 42 and grew up on gaming devices like Atari, NES, Playstation, got a Switch a couple years ago, etc. As I've gotten older, I've gotten away from playing video games often. I've had the Quest now for close to a month and my son and I are having a blast with it. I would recommend watching some YouTube videos on certain games if you're hesitant on what to buy. But it is such a good time. Definitely recommended for places with plenty of room to move around. I have a small play area, but have managed to make it work. It is pricey. But it was money well spent for me 👍

Yes, the resolution might be low, yes, the graphic aren’t good compared to the PC-powered VR headsets. But damn is everything else is so close to perfection. Most of the people giving low scores are people that have already experienced VR with powerful PC’s connected to them that cost thousands of dollars, so it’s not really a fair comparison. If this is how far untethered VR has come in just a few years, I can’t wait to see what it will be like in the next 5-10 years. Congratulation Oculus and Facebook for this giant leap forward for virtual reality.
review_title: This is it! The real beginning of mass-consumer VR

one_reviews_text: Its great, and the Oculus LINK (beta) makes this the headset over the Rift S to have. Just really hate that the Quest store is seperate from the Rift S store and SteamVR... But with the link cable, I can play Rift and SteamVR games no problem! Oculus needs to include the cable with this headset... paying extra for it is really lame.Controllers are good, but the battery covers keep sliding off. Tracking will fail if you play at night (or during the day) in a dark room, so you have to have plenty of light for the inside-out cameras to properly track things.

I had a rift, sold and bought this. I just built a GREAT VR PC. I prefer all my games on quest due to no tethering cable.  I only use Oculus link for games not available for quest, or high graphic games (stormlands, asgards wrath, etc) Downside: very little games go on sale outside of Christmas sales.  Plan on paying full price for most games.
review_title: Now with Oculus link it's a no brainier.

one_reviews_text: Prior to buying this I had little experience using a VR headset but really wanted to get into them. A friend suggested getting this one as a start into the VR world. It has been great! The versatility of the quest is awesome. The one downside is that there are pc VR games I would like to play but as of now I haven't been able to because you can only play what is on the quest store. However, if you side load games and other content, it makes the quest so much better. I have not tested out the new link capabilities that allow PC VR games to be played. Overall if you are wanting to get into VR and don't have a super nice computer to run the rift or other headsets, the quest is for you!

Ive been really hesitant to buy a VR head set I thought the corded versions would be really awkward and I was unsure about this new wireless version because I knew some of the games wouldn't be available. The game selection isn't spectacular but there are a few really good games like Beatsaber and the new Vader Immortal that are very good.If you are on the fence because of game selection I would definitely say its worth keeping your eye on this because the wireless on this headset is REALLY nice.

Battery shipped with Oculus quest leaked in the controller which now does not work. Support says they will have someone contact me instead of just sending a new one. Kids are beyond disappointed as it was their xmas present which now they have to wait a week or two at best to use. Support was horrible about this and would not overnight a new controller so I'm returning. Update, right controller battery is also leaking. Oculus has no phone number so you have to wait until they contact you. Imagine the disappointment for what could be a simple fix e.g. overnight a controller.  We are now on day 3 with no contact from Oculus and the support chat team is effectively unable to do anything except reference the ticket. Again, no phone number to call.

I'm in my late 40's and feel like a kid again.  I'll never buy a tv game console again.  A lot of good arcade style content, "relaxing" VR content, and shooter games.  Game prices are much more reasonable compared to consoles (likely because they are downloaded).  My only complaint is the head strap.  It gives me a headache.  I'll be looking into an alternative, like a welding headgear mod.

Its Christmas day and we unwrapped it, packaging was excellent, both for quality and presentation. I set it up within minutes, which was very easy. We have been playing for about an hour exploring its feature as we are totally new to VR. Initial impressions barring unfamiliarity are that its amazing. The experience is immersive and honesty I'm in to it way more than I thought I would be. Youtube VR was great as well as several other free games and apps we've tried so far. Controller tracking is spot on and they are fairly intuitive to use, headset is comfortable but there is a slight gap by the bridge of the nose where light bleeds through. I haven't fully adjusted it for size as it was exitedly being passed between 3 different people. I have yet to connect it to our PC with the included link cable to test that out but again initial experience so far is genuinely a complete win. Totally satisfied

Got this as a reward for my kids for doing a great job at school. I waited for the VR tech  to get better and I think this is the best so far. The fact that it is a stand alone item with the need for a PC was a huge plus for me. I am happy for what its worth.  The graphics are very good and the sound is a nice touch - would like an option for a bluetooth headphones - there is - but you need to go into Developer's Mode, not too convenient. Multiple player options would be a nice touch too - maybe in the future. But overall I really like this.
review_title: The kids and myself love it!

one_reviews_text: I probably would have just given this VR a 4 star rating but we had a problem with the charging cord. (Due to our own fault my son damaged it.) when I contacted customer service they went out of there way to make it right even when I explained the situation. They were very polite and resolved our issue quickly. I place very high value on companies with excellent customer service and was pleased with with how they responded.The VR itself is pretty awesome and my son spends hours playing on it. Definitely worth every penny. I did my research on VR before purchasing this unit It seemed like the best option and without cords or wires to get tangled in perfect for a 12-year-old kid. Only have a few games beat saber is my favorite. I would definitely recommend this to anybody who is looking for a VR.
review_title: Great VR, excellent customer service 5 out of 5

one_reviews_text: Such an excellent system that was purchased in August of 2019. Out of the box the system worked great however some little system glitches caused a clicking audio sound which was eventually fixed during october's update. This platform is exciting because of all the recent announcement in regards to finger tracking which will be available in 2020 and cross compatibility with oculus rift games starting in November.

i've been following vr headsets since the dev 1 kit. I've played with different ones over the years at work. I recently tried psvr and was not impressed. I did not know the quest existed till i was doing some research. pros:-no wires!-super easy to setup-tracking is amazing-guardian is super cool, switching into the gray mode makes it a lot safer than early headsets where you were blind.-no additional tracking cameras-hand controllers are intuitive and comfortable-games are reasonably priced.-immersion is incrediblecons with caveat:-graphics are a bit cartoonish, but, the immersion is so good that it doesn't matter.I'm very happy with my purchase.

I had a very good experience with VR. This was a remarkable upgrade from gear VR that I had in past.Pros:Good Sense of presence in VR gamesThe games feel real enough although they are running on a mobile processor.Excellent controller tracking.Good build qualityGood battery life and good roomscale trackingCons:Screendoor effect is quite reduced as compared to first gen rift/vive but its still there.The colors dont look as crisp as they look even on a 720p TV.VR movies dont look as good as VR games even the highest resolution ones.Movie watching experience was not good due to weight of the headset and also due to not good enough picture quality for the 1080p movies.I get mild headache when watching VR movies or 2d movies. Surprisingly I dont get any headache while playing VR games like beat sabre or space pirates.Costly VR gamesThis thing is not a replacement for your HD/4K TVs or gaming monitors. It is good for a couple of hours /day or week experience
review_title: Good sense of presence in VR games

one_reviews_text: The oculus quest is a fine piece of equipment for its time.I like the concept of drawing the available area to walk in VR and the headset warning you visually when you're about to cross that boundary. The VR immersion is very good as long as you can actually walk to reach your objective, but immersion breaks a little when you have to teleport to a place further away. The field of view is advertised to be around 90 degrees, however in practice it is a bit less, because the headset is a bit finicky to adjust such that the picture in front of you is not blurry, and even with the best adjustment edges are still blurry. Additionally, pixel density on the screen is not high enough, so that one can clearly see all the pixels. They would have to increase pixel density 10 times to make it barely acceptable, and 100 times to make it decent. This is why I rate it 4 stars instead of 5. Nevertheless, if you imagine that you are looking at the VR world through glasses that have been touched a lot by fatty fingers which makes the image blurry, and the glasses have a fine black grid built in that make the picture pixelated, your brain will be able to extrapolate what the actual experience not mangled by the glasses should look like and you will be able to enjoy the VR experience a lot nevertheless.
review_title: Huge pixels and blurriness barely spoil this awesome experience

one_reviews_text: My first ever VR experience, and let me tell you, it's super fun, it feels so real, but my only complain is the battery life.. it lasts about 2-3 hours depending on what you do on it, either gaming, videos etc... I'd say videos will last longer but if you're gaming non stop, expect 2 hrs . I love it, my girlfriend wears glasses and it also supports it as well, she gamed so hard and nearly fell lol! That's how real it felt, 9.5 if the battery life was longer I'd rate 10, I highly recommend this , always clean the lenses after use as once it's damaged its irreversible.

I'm 78 years old and had never used VR before and was pleasantly surprised by the wide variety of interesting 360 degree content and its realism. I'm way past "shoot-em-up" games but I'm enjoying Bowling, Tennis, Ping Pong, Golf, visits to various cities around the world, Outer Space, climbing Mount Everest, etc., as well as Beat Saver and Racquet NX. My only disappointment so far has been Google Earth. While fascinating to use at a distance, when you get down to street level I expected to see a 360 degree photo of the streets being viewed but, instead, found what appeared to be painted cardboard mockups of each building. I don't think they are, that would have required an enormous effort, but that is what they look like. The headset is as advertised. Very good.

Product is fine. Works well, amazes people in my family, even those non-gamers. However, Oculus actively preventing game developers from offering discounts really pisses me off. While I do not expect a sale like Steam sales, but at the very least, allowing developers to offer discounts will be reasonable. However, Oculus wants to milk early users as much as they can, and they prevent any discounts on any games on the Oculus Quest. My Quest has been lying dormant for a few weeks due to the lack of discounts on games. Yes, I am price-sensitive on games and would appreciate some form of sales/discounts from time to time as the costs of the full price games will add up over time, considering the short length of the games plus this is not my only gaming system. Therefore, I can only give up to 3 stars at this time due to the attitude of Oculus.

This is Magnificent the creator the designer this is insane I love it Everyone should have one anybody I recommended are buying one so let me know how do I get paid from the Refferal’s ..?????$$$$$peopleNOW WHAT I DINT LIKE IS IT STOPPED WORKING 6 weeks after I got it and I HAD PROBLEMS GETTING IT REPLACED after less than 30 hours on it and I bought 350$ worth of games so they refunded me the money for the system SENSE THEY DIDNT HAVE ENOUGH TO REPLACE IT .. so I have to wait to get it again

Like the title says, my just stopped working.  It turns on, recognizes the controllers but that is it.  Just a black screen after that, I have restart and recharged several times and I assume it is just broken.  I am quite upset as I would've like to use it during this quarantine.  The returns are only within 1 month so not sure what to do here.
review_title: Worked great for a few months than just stopped working

one_reviews_text: So much fun! Been waiting for something like this. It’s going to get better in the future but it is darn good now. Room scale means you can really work up a sweat. I clocked in at 120-130 bpm playing games like Pistol Whip or Creed. Some games are more mellow. Some games fail to live up to a promise of entertaining game play (drunken bar fight made me laugh more thinking about playing it but was a disappointment). Games are affordable. If you play less than 2 hours you can get a full refund. So, if you’ve been holding out to try VR when it is affordable, supported, and accurate this is it. Jump in!
review_title: Get off the couch and play!

one_reviews_text: After owning a VR headset that use the phone as a hardware, I decided to give my son the Oculus Quest as a birthday present. He just turned 13.This is amazing, I will strongly recommend it.Easy to setup, and you can start playing almost right away.The only cons is that almost all the games are expensive so the initial cost is just the tip of the iceberg.But still, I really recommend it.

Is the screen and tracking as good as the Index, probably not, But the index isn't wireless and to me that is the biggest game changer in VR to this point, Cables suck. Have a second PSVR because my cat decided to chew through my first one's cable, Another good reason not to have a cable, lol. And with the ability to stream wireless from your Desktop computer there just isn't any other VR out there at the moment that I would want. Half Life Alyx wireless next up!
review_title: Only VR to buy right now.

one_reviews_text: If you've got $400 for a VR headset, but dont have a $1500 desktop to plug into, this is the way to goThe games library is a little small, and games are relatively expensive for how short they are, but there are new ones being added all the time as well as some really great renditions of triple A VR titles.Overall, you probably wont play this every day, or even every week. But it is an experience that for a (substantial) amount of money, is really no-contest to traditional gaming
review_title: Few games, but a fun experience

one_reviews_text: I love this little VR unit and I hope they make it lighter in the future. On the first day of opening the Quest, everything worked wonderfully. A few hours later and one battery recharge I noticed static and breaking of the sound in the right speaker like it had been blown out. I was super disappointed and tried another game and the same thing. I plugged in some headphones and it worked perfectly. I went back to the built-in speaker and the same issue. About 30 minutes later I started another game and everything was magically fixed! I went back to the other games where I heard the staic and distortion and it was also magically not there! My only guess is there is a loose connection somewhere in the headset.
review_title: A lot of fun, but I had some audio issues.

one_reviews_text: At my age things don't excite me that much anymore. All the ordinary game machines seem pretty boring to me.Thought I would give this VR a try and this opens up a whole new game playing experience. I haven't had this much fun since the first Atari game machine 40 years ago. It's like walking into your own little world of adventure. I would like to buy another for my wife but see no way of sharing accounts or games. I'm to cheap to buy them all a second time, unless I'm missing something?.

I feel I was cheated out of my purchase.  I bought in 2019.  I was not told that I have to give away my personal info to Facebook to use this very expensive toy  I couldn’t even sell it for $50 after Facebook took it over.  Wasted over $400 for nothing.  Beware
review_title: Would not have bought if I had been told I had to have a Facebook account.  .

one_reviews_text: (Edit: Changed title to a fun little one, as Facebook missed the opportunity for a great slogan for the Oculus Quest)I received my Quest on launch day.Here is the most important that you need to know:+The controllers are tracked pretty well+Battery is pretty good+Guardian system is really useful+Includes spacer for frames, for the visually impaired :)-You might have to repurchase some games that you've already purchased for rift-The room needs to have some form of lighting, otherwise the controllers will not track.I really cannot think of much negative to an overall positive system. I really do have hopes this device gives everyone a good chance to experience what Virtual Reality is like, without indulging in an expensive computer, with an already expensive headset.
review_title: Are you ready to go on a quest?

one_reviews_text: The only reason I bought the quest is because it's currently one of the few VR headsets that can boast true wireless pcvr gaming but this is coming at a cost. Build quality is awful and the controllers are made of cheap plastic that's easy to break and you will likely experience controller drift within the first few months/weeks (get that customer service line ready and expect a lot of bulls**t) also the headset frequently bugs out and losses the environment so you constantly have to retrace your playspace (entirely a software issue and one that actually was introduced in the last few months). I hate the oculus itself, the company behind it, and the company behind oculus and the only reason this thing exists is because nobody else has bothered to make a wireless headset yet.
review_title: Absolutely abysmal software and build quality

one_reviews_text: I was set to send it back from lack of games, and not the kind I was use to (COD type of games). However, I was impress with the amount of new games and VR Videos was flowing out. I love the price of the games and the return policy is more than fair. I took a chance on a few games and it was a lot of fun. I am keeping it because of the steady flow of new games/videos. CON? I would say that the graphics aren't 4k, but it is still very good for a stand alone. Great product. Very happy. Keeping it.

Ok, right out of the box, I had too factory reset this thing 3 times......... It wouldn't let me install any games, only what was included on the device, clicking on settings brings up 0 menus...... trouble shot everything And um yeeeeaa..... nothing, Overall bad experience, I really wanted this too work I waited for this thing to restock so I have another on back order.....again.... Let's see how that goes.

I have always been enthusiastic about the applications of VR, but do not have a good gaming PC set-up. The quest is a great headset providing the capability in experiencing virtual reality on a budget. Still has 6 DOF and many other great features including the ability to use it with your PC for better performance. Although not much is sacrificed in terms of performance since games through the store have been ported over directly for the quest. All in all I love it and have been able to introduce 5 people to VR over the weekend, all who had a great experience.Cons: slightly front heavy. Battery only lasts for 2-3 hours.Solution: Mount an external battery to the back of the headset. This will act as a counter weight and provide longer sessions.Seller Specific: Product was ordered through Endear direct. They sent me the wrong order and immediately realized and sent a RMA. Incorrect product was recieved on Saturday and mailed back the same day. The correct product was received the following day approximately 24 hours later. Great seller.
review_title: Phenomenal headset. Great to introduce people into VR with the easy portability.

one_reviews_text: This is a good product for newcomer of VR player like me. Wireless experience is essential for VR gaming and cinema, though the resolution is not so great as blur is very common on most of the apps. The battery is another concern for hardcore user like me, 1 hour of PokerVR or 2 hours of BeatSaber for maximum, it depends on the apps you play.Despite the aforementioned problems, Oculus is walking towards the right direction for future development of VR, it would be a dreaming gear for introducing new guys to VR if only there is better resolution and battery duration.
review_title: This is a good product for newcomer of VR player like me.

one_reviews_text: The Oculus Quest is a fantastic device that nearly nails the VR experience. The controller tracking and head tracking are nearly flawless. The graphics, although not what you'll get with a high-end PC, hold up surprisingly well and don't negatively impact the experience for most games. The resolution, one the the most important metrics for immersion, is impressively high for a stand-alone device. Exploring 3D spaces untethered from a computer provides a level of freedom and immersion you can't get on a traditional VR headset. It's hard to express how good this product is for the price. Buy it, show it to your friends, and fall in love with virtual reality. You will not be disappointed.
review_title: Oculus Quest - VR for the masses

one_reviews_text: I received the unit Today May 21st.  I played on the psvr in the past but never liked the wires.  I get to play SuperHot and Robo Recall on the Quest.  It is great to be able to run around the room.  The setup process was easy.The unit is a bit heavy in the front but I got used to it very quickly.  The controllers feel very comfortable and I was able to grab stuff in VR very quickly.

Step in to the future of gaming. Not much money for a whole lot of fun. The whole family can enjoy it. There is something for everyone. We had a blast playing with this on the weekends. Its well made and self contained for you can take it anywhere or use in any room.  You dont need a ton of room . I have a 6 by 6 area and have no issue playing more games.

Plus side: No cables. That's really great and a huge sense of freedom.Cons: The focal distance is NOT adjustable. If your natural focus length is not the average that they build this device for (mine is about 3 mm out) then using this is guaranteed to cause a headache very quickly.Even if the focal distance is perfect for you, the resolution and refresh rate is very low compared to a wired headset. Which is okay for an entry level product.Just don't expect a gamer to be impressed.
review_title: Good to introduce someone to VR, but not for Gamers.

one_reviews_text: I own the original oculus rift with four sensors and touch controllers. After buying the Oculus quest I almost never use my rift anymore. I don't have to deal with wires or sensors anymore and it's fantastic. Only issue I have is the weight and comfort which could be a little better.

I was having fun with it for 2 and a half months then the right controller kept spinning out of control. The customer supports only suggestion was that I wrap a rubber band around it and if that doesn't work ask other users what to do. First of all nothing 3 months old should need rubber bands wrapped around it to hold it together or get it to work properly.  second, what kind of customer support is telling you to essentially go ask people that don't get paid to do your job for you. At the end she said "this tends to happen with beat saber and other games/apps where a swift motion is made". Those are the games that they are most heavily promoting( beat saber, Vader immortal 1-3) $400 is alot of money for something to work less than 3 months
review_title: My controller lasted less than 3 months and customer support is horrible

one_reviews_text: It is amazing. No wires. I think it looks better then the psvr maybe not as detailed but definitely clearer. It has a lot of great games available right away. It has only been a few weeks and we have two more.The roomscale set up easy and amazing been playing in my garage with so much room. Been walking around in superhot. I have played almost all launch titles. By buying and testing them out then returning the one i didn’t care for. All of them play pretty good accept boxvr something felt off in that. The tracking is pretty good it gets lost behind your back if you move to slow in some games, or move it to close to your own face. I have not had any problems with the vr slipping off of my face. Now the controllers are awesome love the joysticks the tracking in most games picking up and throwing things feels great. I did have battery case open on me one time in beat saber but other than that they are awesome.  Now the things that stink short battery life on the headset mostly 2 hrs. Then the controllers they take two aa batteries. So you have too buy those every once and a while. The speakers on it are ok I like my head phones better but they add a wire to get choked by. Some games cost a lot wait for sales I hope.Great games to get if you only want to spend 100 more bucksBeat saber 29.99Superhot  24.99 I thinkVader  9.99Creed  29.99

If you are a basic Vr user and you do not expect to competitively play, then this system is for you. If you already own the PSVR you will notice that the tracking for the oculus quest is EXTREMELY subpar in comparison. I am almost top ten in EVERY beat saber song in PSVR and found that I cannot come close to my scores due to lag and tracking issues.Next, the controllers. If you move too fast or grip too hard the magnetic backing will easily come off. I also found myself hitting the “home” button anytime things get too crazy in game.Again, if you want to max out the capabilities of a system this NOT the system for you. If you are looking to share time with friends and family and to simply enjoy Vr, the. This system is for you!
review_title: Bad tracking and Bad controller engineering.

one_reviews_text: Just do yourself a favor and buy this absolutely mind blowing system. Every single time I put this thing on I am so happy I made the purchase. This is worth every penny. The capability and the way they are constantly updating this system has me sold for life. Throw your old gaming console out the window. Your in the game with the amazing system.

I was an original video kid back in the 80s, loved my arcade games. I also always like the new and different. One time we went to an arcade in the 90s and they had this VR experience, you stood in a ring and it was very basic graphics but it was new and exciting. Then we heard no more of VR until recently. My last game system was a dreamcast so I didn't know what to expect....... I am hooked. The immersive experience of it it amazing. Only thing I could want is more game selection but I'm sure that will come in time

Fantastic.  this is better than my life.  I can live in the space station or a nice little mountain dome and there isn't any COVID or anything else.  Life is good in VR.  I work out more in VR.  Saber beat is killer.  I watch Prime shows in a movie theater that is better than my living room (even though it is my living room .... not sure how that works).  this is making life better.

I’m an avid PC gamer with a mid-grade PC that is able to run all of the killer games (Alyx, WD:S&S, Asgard’s Wrath) using Oculus Link on the Quest but love having the option of playing on the Quest standalone. I can’t go back to regular PC games after experiencing VR on the Quest. The technology has advanced enough that it’s time to make the jump to VR people, especially at this price point!

I used it for months and just recently I build a pc that can play vr games so I can now use oculus link. Oculus wont stop supporting this thing for a long time, i have already got 2-3 full updates that include features like hand tracking naively supported. This headset is unmatched in the stand alone market and it is a perfect choice for anyone getting into vr. I am starting to become addicted.

Major motion sickness and total fail on comfort this thing is torture to wear all the weight is on the cheek bones I'm 170 5'9 and a hour in this thing is awfull I'm sorry but how do smart people design such an uncomfortable pos even the straps cut off blood flow to my scalp you guys got everything wrong in this aspect some components could have been placed in the back for better weight distribution and the goggles allow light around the nose total emerson killer you should have taken inspiration from snowboarding goggles and distributed weight evenly over the skull so much fail I'm totaly let down

I am a child of the 80's and remember the day vividly when my parents purchased an Atari. I was so excited! Purchasing the Occulus Quest brought that feeling all over again. And I'm middle aged....and a "girl".  I have never been much of a gamer but I am in the therapy world ( Rehab/Pediatrics) and I see so many amazing uses for the Quest with Autism, CP , chronic pain and Stroke population .  I even did a presentation at work and let all my fellow employees try it. I use it at home for research and relaxation ( Wander/ Ocean Rift/ National Geographic) or exercise ( Beat Saber) and creativity (Tilt Brush).  I cannot wait for more apps to come out.  Very easy to set up. Allow yourself time to adjust. Any initial vertigo went away for me over time. Your brain adapts to the virtual world. You won't regret your purchase.
review_title: Middle-age mom loves the Occulus Quest

one_reviews_text: The Quest, with its amazing sense of immersion, portability, long battery life, solid build, is the beginning of a true  fundamental, mass-market shift in how we consume entertainment.  It's like being around in 1900 when the world only had radio and still photos, and someone came up to you and said, "oh my gosh, I just saw this thing, it was a picture but it was moving."  You wouldn't have known at that moment that everything was about to change.  We're at one of those moments now.  Plus, it's just cool and fun as all get out.  Buy one.  In a year everyone will have them.
review_title: Time to buy a VR headset

one_reviews_text: In my opinion, the quest is the best all-around VR headset currently available. It has a very good library of native applications and with the introduction of oculus link and also makes the full rift library available as well. It is the perfect headset if you want to do VR development. Not only do you have access to probably the most popular VR headset but also you have the ability to use the PC for development.
review_title: Offers the best of both worlds.

one_reviews_text: My 37 year old son came over so excited for me to try his new system. He is a true gamer! Not me...but he wanted me to try. Knowing I’m not...ok he was so right to be excited. This is the best purchase in years. I don’t play games. But it has wonderful places for me to have fun with. In unimaginable worlds. This company was solid. Dependable.

The Quest is absolutely amazing! I’m only docking a star because this particular vendor didn’t have the product marked as “used”. I’m still extremely happy with the product - I wouldn’t have even known it was used if the previous owner hadn’t forgotten to remove their account from the headset - lol. Needless to say, it arrived in excellent condition. Removing the previous account was very easy to do - I just had to do a “factory reset” which took just a moment. You can find out how to do that on Oculus’s website.
review_title: The Oculus Quest is perfect but I didn’t know I was buying a used product

one_reviews_text: Oculus has made a great step forward in the development of AR/VR technology. The quest delivers great user experience with surprisingly good graphics for a wireless headset that doesn't rely on a gaming PC. Set up is easy and fast. The games and apps I've tried so far have been a lot of fun. I think future development will go far beyond entertainment and lead to some really good teaching/training apps. Definitely worth the price.
review_title: LOTS OF FUN, BIG STEP FORWARD IN VR DEVELOPMENT AND A GREAT PRICE!

one_reviews_text: The product itself is very good.  it is nice not to have any wires tied to you.  You do not need to buy a gaming computer to get the experience.  They do have a cable that is you could connect to a high powered laptop to play games that are not made for the quest.  I have not tried that yet.  Most games that that I have brought have been 1 to 3 GB.  So take that into account as to which Quest you buy.

VR is so underrated. It's a great cardio workout with BeatSaber and a great mental workout with SuperHot. I cannot recommend it enough. The cordless and no PC requirement is a dream. The controllers are odd to get used to, and the only modification I would make is to make the battery case closure more solid than a little magnet. It's easy to slip off as it sits right under the heel of your hand.

It worked for 2 weeks but then I put it down for a few days and when I picked it back up to ply again my screen just stayed black but I could hear the audio, upon researching I found this is not uncommon. Still working on a resolution for this.
review_title: Worked for 2 weeks then hit a bump in the road

one_reviews_text: I bought this for my 9 year old and he loves it! I had an issue when I forgot my password to the app. Resetting it causes you to have to re-pair the headset but its touchy. Took me a little while to get it working again. Also, the batteries in the hand controls only lasted about 4 hours. Make sure you have replacements close by. My brand new batteries have lasted longer than what came in the box so I'm guessing they were just cheap batteries. In the grand scheme of things, not a big deal. If you can afford the VR, you can afford AA batteries. The phone app is easy to use. Games are more expensive than I expected but my son really enjoys them and they seem to take a while to play so he gets his money's worth.

As someone that has always been interested in virtual reality, this finally convinced me to take the leap. While I had a computer that could support VR before, I did not want to do that because my computer is upstairs and it would be difficult to take with me when visiting family. The all in one set up from the Quest makes it mobile and I can play anywhere in the house. It is not as powerful as the rift, so the game selection is a little bit more limited, but many of the main titles are available, including Beat Saber (the main reason I wanted VR).

AMAZING!!!!! I bought another one because my boys love it just as much! If your a sports fan....boxing,baseball,  football basketball etc.  this is a must own! The facial interface is very, very uncomfortable and prohibited extended use but we ordered an AMVR facial interface and it helps tremendously! The battery life could be better to but if your play or watching something that doesn't require you to move around we just keep it plugged in while we are wearing it. There is also a battery pack that I seen people using when they are not near any power source and they say it extends the battery for 2 to 4 hours doubling the usage time.
review_title: We love this device and it's so AMAZING!

one_reviews_text: Good product essentially. I'll have had three total now. One for me, then that one replaced due to my damaging it, and then one for my wife. My only real complaint is they made the lenses out of plastic. Not just any plastic, but stick soft plastic that if you blow dust across it it'll scratch.  Probably not that bad, but they do scratch VERY easily.

This is my teens favorite gaming system, even more than PS4.  He likes it most because he can play with friends that don't have the quest but are playing on their PS4.  They can see him on their tv and he can see them on his quest.  Nice to see it still getting this much use 8 months later still.  The controllers are still holding up too.  Our Nintendo Switch controllers were already replaced by this time.
review_title: 8 months later and it is still his video favorite

one_reviews_text: Delivered on time and is super fun but the right controller constantly loses tracking no matter what we do to troubleshoot it just doesnt work correctly which makes it pretty much unusable and oculus doesnt have any spare controllers for sale on their website.
review_title: Great headset, controller tracking is horrid.

one_reviews_text: I regret purchasing this. I am a huge fan of vr. I also believe that privacy is a right. Facebook lied about their comitment to keep Oculus separate, and unfortunatly after facebook's decision to reqire a facebook account to use the quest, I can no longer use this or any other Oculus device. Do not buy unless you like being lied to!

First off, love this headset.Pros: portability, full mobility, more than surprisingly solid tracking of both position and controllers. This headset has a surprisingly similar feel to the PC version than to a mobile headset. Reasonable battery life and solid frame rate.Cons: Slightly more front heavy than I'm used to compared to other headsets, this disappears after awhile. In low light you can occasionally lose tracking, but it's highly uncommon. No current way to know your exact IPD adjustment, so some guesswork required.

I just received the quest and am NOT a gamer or computer person, but this is great so far. Easy to set up and use. This is my COVID survival kit! Considering what I'm not spending on our summer vacation and going out to eat this is worth the price for our family.

Received the item yesterday, and already had to submit a customer ticket.  It consistently states "something went wrong, please try again later", with a button to click "ok".  But clicking on the"ok" is not working.  I turned the machine off, and then states, "power off", and that the controller is not connected.  After only 30 minutes, I tried to use new batteries and that has not helped.  Not sure if I am going to keep this product, as that is quite annoying to have issues in one day.
review_title: Already having to submit a customer ticket

one_reviews_text: It’s nice, it’s great for kids the biggest drawback is Facebook creating its own marketplace/shop for this version. Tons of great VR games out there but hardly any games available even after owning for nearly 6 months, still nothing of quality released. If they allow steam integration somehow I think this would have been great. Great hardware, not a lot of software
review_title: Great for kids, not so much adults

one_reviews_text: I've only had this Oculus Quest for two weeks. As you can see in the pictures there is a blur in the center of the eye pieces. One picture depicts camera off and one on. I can't seem to get a straight answer from Oculus if this is a flaw in my VR set. When I view items that are suppose to be in 4k, it's far from it. For the most part I love the Quest but I need answers as to the blur.

Couldn't be happier with how this turned out. The battery life is quite impressive and the controllers are easily the best VR controllers out there, they feel so ergonomic and tailored for any application in the medium. The external speakers are also quite good and a nice forethought. Only complaints could be the controllers run on AA batteries and you have to sell your soul to Zuckerberg to utilize the service but otherwise this is definitely going to move the VR medium forward!

This is the first actual vr headset I've ever purchased but wow it's amazing. I love my quest it's the best.game related device I've bought in years. It's only really down side is the battery life is not that great but might be because I switch between apps so who but overall it's amazing. Also you can watch YouTube videos as if you had your own personal movie theater. I hope Amazon video comes to the quest so I can watch movies on it even thou the quest supports Netflix. Definitely buy this if you can.

This is the first virtual reality headset that captivated me enough to buy it . I played the first DK1 when it came out and saw the potential but it was too early .
