Screen door effect was way too bothersome . Now this is a standalone headset running on a cellphone processor and can provide amazing VR experiences? I’m in . The screen is great quality and they are releasing a feature soon to be able to connect to a gaming pc to run games from there. Honestly the best VR experiences for the price . Definitely not a valve index but at a 3rd of the price it destroys it in value for your money.
review_title: Get ready for the world of VR

one_reviews_text: its a great headset im happy with my purchase. Its mind blowing how you can walk inside the game when you walk in real life. But the biggest flaw in this headset id say is how UNCOMFORTABLE it is. its hurting my nose SO BAD that I feel like its torturing my face. the pain is unbearable especially that I have a thin face so im guessing having some cheeks will help reducing the pressure on the nose lol. So although the pain is huge even after I take it off, I will still keep it since its a good headset.
review_title: Great headset with a big flaw

one_reviews_text: Impressive system. I had the Steam Vive before and Quest has better visuals without the wires! Room setup is easy but the most impressive is the sound. It feels like you have an expensive surround sound headset on, pretty amazing! Connects right into your home wifi to download games.Worth the money!

Play it all the time!!! Bought it awhile back and the fa my enjoys it. After a long day of reality it is nice to escape. Whether it be shooting zombies, slicing cubes, going on a fantasy adventure, defeating the supernatural, dancing with robots, or whatever. You will love this machine and the great graphics and it is wireless!!!

I rarely write reviews.. This things is worth the time though. I am absolutely blown away by the  immersion and quality this VR headset provides. This product should not exist, let alone at this price point.So much fun, and more than that, it’s an experience, an amazing one..Buy this.. You will NOT be disappointed. Worth every penny.

Having 6DOF untethered is awesome! I own an Oculus Rift as well, and being able to have a similar experience without the cable, sensors, PC, etc is a great upgrade.  The guardian system works great, you can see through the cameras (so it's kind of AR) to define the space.  The quality of the graphics is very good, I didn't notice diference with the Rift.My only complain is that as of now there are not many apps, but to be fair, today is only the first day :)

Managed to place the order when the quest was in huge demand and finally got the order after nearly 3 weeks of waiting. Guess the virus is putting a huge strain on manufacturing and logistics. Noticed that there is a dead pixel on the left eye. I really don't want to return it now and wait for an eternity to get a replacement, moreover it's hardly visible except in dark loading screens.The quest is a pretty great VR product that can operate as a standalone headset and can also be tethered to a gaming pc for some serious VR stuff. Wish it didn't have those 72Hz screen else this would be a sure shot winner in the VR arena.
review_title: Pretty great VR Experience for a decent price

one_reviews_text: I got this for my son for xmas,  it was on back order so we just got it last week, and can I just say, totally worth the wait!!  He (20 yrs old), loves it!  The game it comes with is a lot of fun and we already bought another game for it.  The games are reasonably priced ($30 or so).  I even love playing with it, and I am definitely NOT a gamer person.  I recommend this 100%.

I grew up playing the original NES and was fanatic about video games up until the Xbox 360. I got older, responsibilities mounted, and I had lost interest. I still kept up with the tech, but honestly I was mostly interested in the academics of it. I tried an HTC vive at a fun center and was impressed enough to go out and buy a VR headset. The team at Oculus nailed it; I mean, they absolutely nailed it. The games are incredibly immersive, and there are many educational apps as well. I feel like a kid again. I’m building a new computer so that I can take advantage of the higher graphics and games exclusive to the oculus rift (by using the oculus link cable). It is shocking that you can get this kind of tech for $400.

The Quest is to VR as the iPhone was to smartphones. The fact that it runs VR games with 6 degrees of freedom, stays cool, isn't heavy, doesn't make any noise, and is fully self-contained is an absolute marvel.The display is higher resolution than previous generation, PC headsets. The built in speakers are phenomenal, and the operating system and entire ecosystem just works. Hands down the best VR experience to date.
review_title: From the perspective of a VR Programmer, this is the best VR experience on the market.

one_reviews_text: No tethered headset can compare to the pure freedom the Quest offers. Simply turn it on and jump back in wherever you left off. VR was never about graphics, it's about the freedom to immerse yourself in another world. It's about the freedom to play games that are physically impossible. It's about the freedom to watch Netflix on an IMAX size screen. They are squeezing more out of this processor than I thought possible. The games Oculus allow into the store have a high bar to jump and I agree with their "only the best" approach.Obviously you can't compare the Quest's computing power to a gaming PC, but who wants to turn one on, let alone be tethered to it! Nevertheless, the screen is excellent and you can only marvel that they are squeezing so much out of the same processor as the Samsung S8. I think when historians look back, the Quest will be seen as the first real VR headset.Freedom and immersion to explore world we can only imagine. That's what we always wanted from VR. Quest delivers.

Really cool product. Oculus is constantly upgrading the technology to the Quest (versus time for a new platform). Most of the content I have tried so far is awe inspiring. Use Link to get higher res stuff with a high end gaming laptop. Action games will turn you into a Jedi and wear you out physically as well.

WOW!! The Oculus Quest changes everything.  I've never been big on game consoles or computer games mainly because of the ridiculous controls and nature of most of those games.  VR and specially the Quest has brought such a compelling experience that I look forward to playing every day and sweating it out on several games.  This is way more than just a game console, it's an EXPERIENCE console.  Worth every penny, get it!!
review_title: Not a game console.  It's an EXPERIENCE console!

one_reviews_text: Changed policy Facebook account will soon be required to play. They made promises early on this would never happen!

Great quality and fits very well. The thing is pure fun and makes you feel like you are I the future. Well worth the money I wouldn’t buy any other gaming system this one is the best value for the money.
review_title: Best gaming system for the money

one_reviews_text: I received this last night and played it for six hours. It is amazing. It did indeed come the same day I ordered it which was awesome. I repeatedly found myself just sort of shaking my head in disbelief that I was actually experiencing this in my own home. The only minor complaint I would have is with the field of vision which is somewhat like looking at things through goggles, but it really is a minor thing considering how incredible this thing is to play. You can even watch Netflix on a huge ten foot screen. Definitely recommend.

This is about good a time as ever to submit a review for Oculus' wireless VR headset. I absolutely love this thing. I purchased this Janurary 29th, and in just one month I lost 20 pounds from over 120 hours of workouts in various apps such as Beat Saber and Super Hot. This being said, I believe a hardware issue has developed. It seems that after an brief time of playing, both controllers lose their tracking and float in space. It makes playing certain games rather difficult and frustrating. I heard Oculus support was rather not up to standard, and I have tried many different solutions to try and fix the issue. From a consumer standpoint the product is amazing, if the hardware remains operable.

Honestly one of the best purchases I’ve made. Not only is the system light weight, smooth running, and incredibly immersive, the games are pretty cheap! I’ve played the hottest on the quest, from super hot and pistol whip, to Vader Immortal chapter one, and throughout all of my games it has run smooth with little to no errors. The only complaint I have is that due to the system limits, the games don’t have very good graphics and are very short. I definitely recommend buying this if you aren’t in the mood to spend like $700 more for a pc+rift system. Very good for gamers that want to experience vr, but not starve to death as a result lol. 10/10 recommend buying

Headset works fine so far, but it had already been used out of the box. When I put on the headset, it was already logged in on somebody else's account and had to factory reset it.Kind of disappointing since the item was supposed to be new, but no significant problems so far; will update as necessary.

I've been waiting 20 years for VR to go mainstream.  This might be the device.  IMHO, the Quest is the perfect balance of video/audio quality, usability, portability and cost.  I especially love that it's inside-out which makes it ultra portable, easily allowing my workmates to try it out.  I wish I got royalties.  ;-)  Overall, I think it's a great value.  Fun games, easy to setup and use.  And casting to a TV allows us to share in the experience.

I was pleasantly surprised how immersive the headset is. The audio is great and it fits to my face/head well. I've had it now from r roughly a month and have had lots of fun with it so far. Oculus Link is also pretty sweet and the reason I bought this headset over the Rift S. I had to troubleshoot some issues on my computer but once I got that sorted out it has also worked very well. I spend more time not on PC though as being untethered has been really cool.

I’ve had a Rift for about 2 years now, so I wasn’t expecting to be floored by this product. Well, it’s a triumph of engineering. It runs flawlessly in every game/experience I’ve tried and while it obviously lacks the power of a PC and won’t have some of the bigger games available, it’s still the future of this tech. The freedom of movement, ease of use, and overall experience is amazing. If you were on the fence about VR before, this is the time to get in. Even if you already own another HMD, this device is a must buy.

My son got this for his bday. I have to admit I was completely blown away by this headset. Built really well and super cool. The whole family has had a blast with these. I highly recommend this VR system. Gotta love the all in one feature, no pc no gaming console. Just turn on and enjoy.

Crazy fun.  Absolutely you should get this.Gets you off your couch and moving too.I was sweating like a dog boxing in Creed and the Beat Sabre is awesome. It comes with free stuff and demos but....Expect to pay another 45 on day one.  You are going to want more.

The headset for the price is really good, when you consider how much getting a VR headset with a computer costs this is almost a no brainer. I got the 64GB version and I was a little worried about space issues but thus far most games have been 2 gigs or under so I have plenty of space for games and movies.  The freedom to move without wires is another huge plus, I really recommend this headset!

i dident like feeling a vertigo after i played it  like my equallibriam was off the rest of the daybeen gaming 45 years must be my age has all to do with thatglad i boughht it  all was perfect  i sold it two weeks later  i dident like having the option to entera differnt world  like it bugged me to play or not to play  i will try vr agian and buy agian in 5 yearsim on a buy try and sell  with no disipointments
review_title: Im glad i tried it but...

one_reviews_text: My son actually bought this, he paid me back for the purchase, he loves loves loves it! He is 17, and plays most days even months after buying it. I also had turns and it was a lot of fun. Some games are more exhausting than others, of course, so potentially it’s also exercise.

Given the current processing power of embedded cpu, there're still considerable limitations on graphics. And you probably noticed it from youtube reviews or in game footage. So if you are ok with what you see, other than this, there's no much you can dislike in this product.The physics of the interaction with a world strike you as amazing right from the getting to know introduction.The audio experience is on a very high level, considering you don't wear headphones, but only have small speakers, which you event don't see.Overall the experience is very impressive, but I still find a graphics a bottleneck that doesn't justify purchasing VR gaming set today. I'd wait a little more still.For me, it's really
review_title: Maybe you should still wait a little

one_reviews_text: The controllers froze midair after three month play. After numerous emails trouble shooting back and forth, nothing worked. Then they asked my address, product ID etc, I thought they would like for me to send back. Then no emails after that. They only thing that is for sure is they don’t have customer service call center. Are you serious? After more 10 days, still nothing.
review_title: Worst ever customer support by Oculus

one_reviews_text: Quick and simple to setup, great games at a good price, its the perfect introducción to VR, the freedom of playing with no wires is awesome and with great tracking and motion prediction, and with oculus link i was able to play great games like Half Life: Alyx, Boneworks, Pavlov, etc.
review_title: Great audio, great traking, Oculus link.

one_reviews_text: If you have never experienced VR before this is the perfect introduction. the quality of the craftsmanship and the range of games will draw you into the emerging world of VR. If you are worried about motion sickness the games and apps are rated to give you a comfort level in order to build up you VR "legs".  You can start of with something like Wander which essentially drops you into Google street view so you can be on the Mattehorn while sitting on your couch. Then you can work your way up to more fully immersive and vertigo inducing games such as Climb where you are a rock climber actually climbing virtual mountains and the drop is stomach wrenchingly  realistic.I highly recommend this to anyone even remotely interested in VR

Didnt work...i had to tell my 10 year old who i promised an oculus quest, if she brought her grades up(which she did) that it doesnt work and hopefully the replacement will.  Didnt respond to anything...wouldnt even charge.

Facebook has just the thing.  This thing puts you in a different world and pretty much a better one because it makes you work mentally and physically for everything.  That is a great thing and this is a lifechanging and perhaps worldchanging device.  It really does suck you out of current reality and into another one without external chemicals.  Not bad.

Well received by the teenage / college age crowd. Many hours spent on these.  Many others have used it - lots of positive feedback. As a parent I like the feature where the device learns the room so the user doesn't beat up the walls or fall over a chair.Plus - it is absolutely HILARIOUS watching people play games with this thing on!

This feels revolutionary first time I used it I was so flustered it’s just incredible to see how far technology has come.Draw back the quest lacks processing power to run high end games but they are making a way to connect the quest to your laptop or computer to run them soon.I don’t recommend it for kids cause the stuff is delicate in the sense that it’s all hard plastic and not very reinforced like the controllers so if they drop something will likely become damaged.Keep a mental note that all the tables you see are fake don’t try to lean on one 😂Edit: the games aren’t diverse and because the quest doesn’t have a way to connect to a pc yet it’s enjoyment is heavily limited.

This headset is amazing, yes it has slightly lower graphics but i found that it’s pretty unnoticeable when your in an immersive experience such as the plank or beat saber. All in all this is a no brained and a must buy, great to get friends in the headset and watch them freak out, I do recommend looking for disposable face masks if your going to have multiple people use it, I bought a pack of 100 for $25 and keeps my headset clean.

Old school gamer and this is my first time trying VR I've been completely blown away at the immersion. I bought the quest because I didn't want to invest thousands into upgrading my pc and buy a headset not knowing if I'll even like it. I'm completely happy playing the quest I had no clue how good VR is. Watching youtube vids does not do the experience justice it really is incredible...
review_title: Quest is awesome VR gaming can't wait for more games...

one_reviews_text: Wow - what can I say that hasn't been said?  I'm 59, male.  I have an Xbox that I seldom used.  The Quest is so different.  Use it to explore places you've been too, or never been to.  Watch a movie from Amazon Prime or Netflix.  Play the games, which are getting better.  I am happy with my purchase!

This headset is a game changer. The Oculus quest brings all of the fun and joy of VR and takes it to a new level. Unencumbered by wires, you're able to freely play in your VR world without breaking immersion due to a cord getting in the way. This affordable alternative to the Rift or Vive is where everyone should start with VR. 1000% recommend!

Great great product. I have also the rift CV1 and this headset (also now that it can be connected to the PC) is the best.Super fun, every game feels like a work out, good resolution (compared to the CV1). I'm very pleased with the purchase.

I don't own any other gaming systems because I have never really liked video games I bought this because I liked the interaction between reality and the game it is extremely easy to use extremely fun to use and I highly recommend it especially for the price point and there's the ability to watch TV and movies and it and it makes you feel like you're an an imax theater

I own a PSVR and a quest and I can tell you that quest is not comfy but it's more convenient to use due to :1) stand-alone (you don't need a PC/console to run it) and2) no wire is needed.Saying that expect to get a VR face (just google how it will leave marks on your face) due to the flaw of the design. This can be overcome by adding weight (like it doesn't need more weight) or using vive deluxe audio strap ($100). Saying all that I still love my quest and hope the future release overcome this issue.PS: if you got one you might want to get AMVR grip for controllers
review_title: Yes fun but it's not comfort

one_reviews_text: surprised by how better than I thought it is,after updating and restart the quest it fixed all bugs.fast response with head and controllers movement,I have it for a week now and Im very satisfied.unfortunately link doesnt work for 1050ti gpu laptops for now.it was kind of heavy on the cheeckbones at start but after adjustments and counterweight it was ok for long play sessions.9/10

Returned after using for a few hours as I could sense the addictive power of this technology. I have no doubt that VR is the opioid of the future. People will crave their their virtual world just like addicts crave painkillers today. Young and old will spend endless hours detached from reality, isolated from each other. Governments and society will eventually realize that a technology-induced dopamine kick is no different than chemically-induced one. Efforts to regulate will be too little too late, as VR will have permeated every facet of our lives and Oculus (Facebook) will have monopolized people's virtual identities.

I liked it, until Facebook LATER announced that you must have a Facebook account in the future to access the device. I don’t trust in Facebook’s privacy, and I don’t want a Facebook account.What BS to do to buyers AFTER they already purchased it, beyond the return date.
review_title: Great device, but NOW requires a Facebook account

one_reviews_text: Love everything about it.i like that my son  has to get up to play the game and move oround olot instead of sitting down in a chair.he gets olot of exercise while playing with this because it requires you to move your body olot.he is very sweaty when he is done playing.my son is a baseball player and runs track.he loves the games special effects and that he has to move olot to used it.good fun and exercise.special effects are awesome and very realistic.worth every penny I spend on it.my son loves it and so do I.
review_title: This device is great for kids that are not bi active or do not exercise at all.

one_reviews_text: The oculus quest is a very good VR experience.Playing games like robo recall and beat saber is a ton of fun.On the downside, the quest come with a very basic rubber head strap that is not very comfortable.The device is front heavy, if you attached a counter weight on the back like a power bank it will improve the comfort a lot.Overall it's a great buy, be prepared to do some mods to improve it.
review_title: Very good VR experience, some modifications needed.

one_reviews_text: Truly the next step in VR.  Can be worn on its own and played anywhere, or tethered to a gaming PC so you can play more demanding games.  Sadly, if you already have a VR library, you have to repurchase your games for this device.  The screen has a low refresh rate, which led to motion sickness for me (though it might not for you).  If you are wanting to get into VR, I cannot think of a better device.  But if you already have a gaming PC with an established VR library (and don't feel like buying all your games a second time), the Rift S is an excellent alternative.

The overall quality of the materials are great. This is designed to last. Nothing flimsy about it at all. But that is nothing compared to the quality of the image. I expected good image quality and was blown away by what I am getting. This experience is way better than I expected. Glad I waited to get into VR until the Quest came out.

I'm still learning but enjoying these things!  I was introduced to them by my brother-in-law and was excited to get mine.  Games are nice, but I'm enjoying the video and 3D immersion.  For those who like beat rhythm games, checkout moonrider for some awesome free gaming!

Very glad I bought mine before the holidays. Nearly no complaints as developement tools are easily available for future game makers. Downside is now Facebook(Oculus owner) is making certain social features unavailable unless you add a facebook account. My personal information has been mishandled for the last time by facebook and if this is setting the standard for oculus I don't look forward to the future.
review_title: Stop trying to make Facebook accounts happen.

one_reviews_text: Not as comfortable as the Playstation VR headset by far. I had to purchase extra padding for the straps but it was a cheap fix. I feel like Oculus offers more and better content than the PS4 though and I love that it is wireless. Battery life on the controllers is pretty good - one AA battery per controller and I went about 3 weeks before having to replace one.

This set is almost perfect. It gives you pretty decent VR graphics on the go. It is comfortable to use for extended periods of time and the battery lasts for around 2 to 3 hours on a full charge.My only complaint is that the tracking of the controllers can be a little iffy when playing a game like Beat Saber. But I think it is a small issue for the freedom you get from the headset.

Amazing! A personal movie theater, mobile desktop, and gaming console! Virtual reality isn't the future but it's definitely going to be in it in a major way. This thing is the best entry into VR anyone can imagine. I got my son one and went broke getting myself one, lol. Quest 5 stars, homelessness 2.5 stars, but only if you get two, it's a steal.

This unit really sets the way future VR would work.  The lack of wires is what make it so popular.  The problem right now are the price and the length of the games.  The games usually runs for around $30 and usually last less than a few hours of game play.  Hope game price would be cheaper once the hype dies down a bit.
review_title: Good product but games are short and expensive

one_reviews_text: Had an amazing first watch experience but after 30 minutes of playing it becomes very very discomforting for the face increasing weight on the head and pulling on the skin. I wouldn't recommend for those wearing glasses because of its binocular support only you would barely see anything.

Owned a Vive, and the tracking here is just as good, which is surprising given it's inside-out, Great headset, which also doubles as a Rift replacement using the link cable (haven't tested that yet though). Only downside is that the battery life isn't great, but VR uses a lot of processing power so to be expected. Good line up of games also. Get it with Vader immortal deal if possible.
review_title: Great All in One VR Headset

one_reviews_text: I love it, played over 200 hours total and its great, a few minor issues I had with it solved with a bit more money.1. Super front heavy - nothing a sweatband streched over the head cant solve, and there are many very affordable solutions and others more expensive and more comfortable.2. The built-in face cover is terrible, no way around that, it hurts the skin and absorbs sweat way too much which makes it very unhygienic, the solution for me was a different face cover from "vrcover" which is a kind of leather cover, much softer and nicer on the skin and absobs zero sweat wich makes it very easy to clean.Other than that its fantastic and if you're willing to spend some time on learning how to sideload which is quite easy now, you can do a lot of great things with this!
review_title: Absolutely fantastic, 2 minor issues easily fixable that should have been included

one_reviews_text: Vr 360 videos r so blurry,  even with 100mbps connection. Only good for vr games. Total waste of money
Es el equipo de realidad virtual que ofrece la mejor inmersion dentro del juego, libertad y sin límites. Realmente único, auténtico, cómodo. Lo recomiendo 100000%

The Oculus Quest is hands down THE BEST investment I’ve made in a long time! I’m 52 y/o and hadn’t exercised regularly in 30 years, but I enjoy the Quest (and Beat saber) so much that I play twice a day everyday.  I’ve lost 20 lbs., and have really improved my stamina and reflexes!  My only issue is that it starts weighing on my forehead and/or cheekbones after a while.

I was pairing the Quest with the Oculus App and all of a sudden the Quest started updating itself and I can no longer pair it again with the App, not until I switch it off for more than 15mins. (switch off and turn it back on immediately did not work)I thought everything is ready since I can finally pair it with the Oculus App but here come with the Wifi issue. The Quest keeps dropping out (and unpair with the App) and cannot search for any networks so I am pretty sure it is not about weak wifi signal as I saw nothing on the Quest. Googled it and saw quite a lot of people having the same issue. I have already submitted a support ticket to Oculus and I hope they could return a new device to me and bear the shipping cost. (FYI: I am in Hong Kong)

My first videogame was Doom on a PC with 1 Meg of RAM.  Ever since then I've known what I really wanted:  a videogame that I could actually step into and experience.  And the Quest does it.  Wirelessly!  It is not yet the Holodeck on the Enterprise, but it is a glorious beginning.  I'm glad I'm getting in on the ground floor.
review_title: The VR I've been waiting for

one_reviews_text: Someday.  Soon.  We will all laugh at how huge and heavy the headset is.  It leaves big red marks on your skin - known as VR FACE in our house.  It's huge fun.  Chose the quest over the rift so we could use alone and with pc. Occulus link is still a tiny bit buggy but works well 90% of the time.
review_title: Get the Quest & Use Occulus Link for PC.  Best of both worlds.

one_reviews_text: Support is non existent if you have a hardware problem. left screen stopped working and I opened a ticket. I got a canned response after 2 days saying they understand i have some eye discomfort. Yeah, no. I need a hardware RMA. I will update if I get it RMAed.UPDATE: RMA processed and new unit is here today. Updating to 4 star Jul 21st ticket opened August 14th refurb unit received.

Let me tell you a story- The day I got this product I started playing like crazy and at 3:00am I was having a boxing match and while giving upper cut my hand went inside the ceiling and the ceiling came off with little blood in my hands. So the product is outstanding but be really aware about your surroundings, including ceiling 😜

LOVE my oculus quest!!! amazing graphics, great clarity, all in all a wonderful system with a wide variety of games for literally anyone and everyone. the ONLY downside for me personally, would be that i just have to take frequent breaks because sometimes the light gives me little headaches, but that could just be me!!! totally worth every penny and everyone in my family loves it!! even the parents!!

Coming from a rift cv1, this is an improvement in almost every way. If you are a longtime vr fan, or if you have never tried anything vr before I recommend this headset to anyone. Also if you don't find it very comfortable I recommend looking up how to do the frankenquest mod as it improves comfort 10 fold. Also if you want to experience your pcvr games oculus link is coming in November which will allow you to connect the quest to your pc to play those games.

My son purchased this with money he earned. We had been to a few VR facilities and like the experience. Once we got this the whole family takes turns playing with them and everyone else watches. Its funny to watch people using it. The battery lasts a long time and connects very easily.

Next big step in VR, i am really enjoying it being completely wireless. Brings you much more into the experience. Resolution is really good for what this can do but FOV is a bit limited. Peripherals tend to get a little fuzzy and can give you a headache if you are not focusing on things directly in front of you.

Oculus lied and said you would never need a Facebook account. They force you to agree to new terms of service or brick your device! You have no choice but to follow the will of Mark Zuckerberg. Avoid like the plague.

Oculus just did it. They made the best VR headset.While the Oculus Quest doesn't feature the latest and greatest hardware ever for VR gaming, it does provide an amazing experience of headless standalone VR gaming that works EVERYWHERE untethered.The new anticipated Oculus Link option would close the loop and provide it all: Great gaming experience when you're on the go, unattached to your home PC, and extreme processing power when you get back home and connected to your powerful PC.I must say the headset just feel natural, everything works so smooth and so much fun to play.Very much recommended ! worth every dollar.
review_title: This product is just too amazing

one_reviews_text: I own the 64 GB one the other one is 500 but id say the 64 GB is fine for 400ProsBatteries IncludedThe headset is easy for most ages / sizes to fit onConsI don't recommend playing without the charger plugged in cause the battery even full can drain kinda fast for meyou have to pay for most games not much free gamesu will need to replace batteriesit doesn't come with a lens cleaner for the LensU can get sweatythis is all I have to say so far with a few hours of using it so I don't know all the pros / cons but its still worth it I guess cause u don't need a fancy gaming computer for most of the other vr headsets
review_title: Id say its worth the price

one_reviews_text: This is the future.I know that PCVR has better graphics. I know that my PSVR for the most part does too. But that doesn't matter right now. What matters is that there is now a VR device that provides unbelievable experiences without being tethered to another device. Without the need of a 500$ PC or a 300$ console attached to it.Between the technology - the 6DoF, the tracking, the controllers - and the games - Robo Recall, Beat Saber, etc. - this is a fantastic entry point for those interested in VR. And it's great for those who are looking for a way to get their VR fix without being tied down to their PC or console.I buy a lot of tech, and this is one of the few times I've said after using something - This is the future.

This was my first introduction to VR. If you have never experienced VR before your mind will be blown. PERIOD.Getting the fit on the head right is some work. There's some great YouTube videos showing you how to properly do it. Watch them.Good luck if you play one of the horror games. I love horror movies, but living it and watching it are NOT the same thing. Maybe wear a diaper.
review_title: I like it, just be wary of horror games.

one_reviews_text: My boys love the VR but setting it up with a payment method was a nightmare. We set up each vr (we bought 2) with our kids names and emails. When we went to purchase a new game it wouldn’t accept my card because the account wasn’t under my name. We had to reset the goggles and when we did that lost the 3 free Vader immortal games. I had to buy them at that point because my son was destroyed that it was gone. It was extremely frustrating.
review_title: Set up the goggles with email and card holder that belong to the same person!!

one_reviews_text: We loved it so much we brought it to a family gathering, and let others try it, and my Dad loved it so much he had my Mom buy it for him for Christmas! Graphics are amazing, I love that there are no cords! We can leave the ipad it's tethered to at home and still play on it at my Mom's house. Great buy! Such a great great buy!

We love the Quest. I grew up playing computer games but when I got married 11 years ago and had kids, that kind of stopped. But we got the Quest and even my wife--who doesn't usually like video games-- loves it. This thing really hits all the sweet spots for the size and price. All of the compromises they made are totally worth it.

As far as vr headsets go, I have to say this is currently the best by far. The ability to not have a computer and cables alone is worth it. Not to mention the fact of price or stock fit. The headset is great for someone getting into vr that doesn't want the burden of needing a new computer or for someone that doesn't want to have to setup lighthouses. I wholeheartedly recommend this to anyone and everyone. Plus, if you still want to use it with your pc you can thanks to the oculus link update! The only thing I recommend getting with this headset is a power bank if you plan on using it for more than 2 hours at a time, but in all honesty I feel like 2 hours is a good session that you can have a break after.
I found it to not be as easy to use as it was advertised and was not as user friendly as I hoped. Guess I need one more user friendly Or simpler.

While my PC can render games with much higher fidelity - I'm simply having *more* fun with Quest.I can bring it with me to work, on vacation, play in any room in the house - and it's only a matter of popping the headset on.No drivers, no recalibrating sensors, no quirky OS updates. This is the Nintendo Switch of VR
review_title: Absolutely insane - I'm selling my Oculus Rift (PC VR)

one_reviews_text: I thought I’d use this to play games. Instead, I mostly use this as my own personal IMAX theatre, to watch videos on YouTube, Prime Video, and Netflix.Sit in a swiveling chair, and the YouTube 360 videos are great analog fun. But YouTube 2D videos somehow seem more satisfying from the browser app than in the YouTube VR app.Watching Nirvana perform live on such a large screen was a revelation.

Split in controller ring. Less than a year old. Find out it was a design flaw. Contacted oculus and they said it’s not their problem cause I bought it from a “retailer” (amazon). So buy direct and not from amazon.

This system will blow your mind.The system can be taken anywhere and you’re able to create invisible fences which allow you to not run into TVs or furniture l.Graphics are good, immersion is great.Highly recommend.
I've been using this mostly for Beat Saber and Boxing VR. I'm ready for a larger variety of games including more multiplayer games but what it has is acceptable for now.

I tried VR a few times in the past but the need to be tethered to a computer with cables was always a bit of a deal breaker for me.  The quest is amazing with the level of performance is can fit into a  standalone headset! Full freedom of movement, take it with you anywhere, pick it up and be playing something 30 seconds later. These are are the things that make it appealing and approachable now. I love it and so do my wife and kids. Well worth the price of adminision compared to an Xbox or PS4.
review_title: If you have been waiting to jump into VR. Now is the time

one_reviews_text: A true step up from the traiditonal VR headset, the wireless / PC less feature makes a huge difference. Now anyone can enjoy VR without worrying about buying a $500 GPU, and taking all the sensors and their PC with them every they go. just strap on and play.One of The most impressive things was that, when you set your play zone, the headset keeps recognizes the area based on the camera feed, so next time when you put it on, the play zone is automatically set.
review_title: a big improvement to existing VR

one_reviews_text: I was skeptical at first when I heard that this thing had no wired connection to a PC. I figured itd be like last cordless phone headsets I had tried in the past. Basically, underwhelming and bleh. Boy was I totally wrong. This thing is awesome. It's like having PC VR anywhere anytime. No wires or computer required. Definitely took me by surprise that VR could be this awesome without being tethered to a computer. Anyways, definitely would buy again, without a doubt.
review_title: Skeptical at first, but this thing is amazing.

one_reviews_text: Perfect VR headset. Works mobile, I can bring it to school, a friends house, etc. with no hassle. No cameras or sensors to set up, all in one headset. The hand tracking feature is amazing and I hope to see more games on this system soon. Highly recommended over PC connected VR Headsets. Extremely comfortable and the graphics are extremely well for the weight and ram. The memory is perfect since most games are under a GB anyway, and you can just uninstall unused games. Definitely the best VR experience I've had.

I had to return mine because it had a weird permanent glare in the lens, almost like a stain. It wasn’t very strong and obvious but it still irritated me. On the other hand, the screen was okayish for gaming but not so much for videos. The videos were grainy and since you see “god rays” around white text on the dark background it was hard to watch with subtitles. I’m giving it 4 because overall they made it possible to have a decent standalone VR experience and the tracking was great (anyone who played with older VR sets would agree). So overall I think it will not replace your game console or TV but it’s still good to have it and start experiencing this new technology.
review_title: Will not replace anything but it’s good to have it

one_reviews_text: I had my quest  in less than a month and it started to develop stuck/dead  Pixels I got a refund to get another one . The new one had  permanent scratches and defects on the plastic ! The rubber was coming off the front cameras so I just got a refund . The console is probably the best  virtual reality headset on the market  But there’s  too many technical issues !

A definite win for Oculus, they really knew what they were doing with the Quest. The controls, the graphics, the roomscale, everything is absolutely great. The only nitpick I have is the headset itself which is a little front heavy, meaning at times the headset may dig into your cheekbones and push against your forehead which will leave some marks and some soreness after playing for a while. The setup was quick and easy and I got right into playing within 10 minutes. If you've been looking for a VR headset and don't want to worry about the hassle of getting it setup, the Quest is the one for you. No regrets on purchasing.

I purchased a quest to try out the wireless experience for VR, and I already own a Oculus rift CV1 from 2016.  Considering this is about half as much as I paid for my original rift, and that this doesn't need a computer, I cant recommend it enough.  The only downside is the graphics quality.  The graphics are impressive considering they are running on mobile hardware, but they dont really compare to an expensive gaming PC, but that shouldn't be a surprise.  The tracking quality is probably better than my rift, and is similar to the HTC vive, from my experience.
review_title: I cant belive how well this works.

one_reviews_text: Not happy with casting to iphone. Will only do it intermittently and will boot me off regularly. Has tracking issues with fast paced movements (Beat Saber Expert/+). Speakers blew after 1 hour and had major static mixed with sound. (Rattling). Rebooted and it went away but indicative of something bad.
review_title: Has flaws that I can’t overlook.

one_reviews_text: Oculus Quest offers the VR experience everyone has been waiting for. While it sacrifices graphical fidelity in some parts, what it gets back in trade is an unrivaled level of freedom in VR gaming. The headset has a battery life of roughly 2 to 2 1/2 hours, which is pretty convenient because average gaming sessions in VR do not normally last that long. After owning this headset for about two months, I can easily that I am very satisfied with this product as my very first investment into VR gaming.
review_title: Wireless VR Gaming Is Worth It

one_reviews_text: This headset is so good, its crazy. They've managed to pack a crazy amount of tech into such a small package, and it works so well. Its able to run all the killer apps and then some. SUPERHOT in particular is virtually identical to its P.C. counterpart. And the tracking is near flawless. If you already own a PSVR I would strongly recommend picking up a Quest. Also, you can do custom songs on beat saber. Also the lack of a cable makes every experience so much more immersive. 7/5, would recommend.

I just got my quest an hour ago and I'm in love with it. Other than the fact that the headstraps are a pain to get right, everything is just great.Update: I've had this headset for 3 months now, and it changed my life. I now attract double the women that I used to before getting the headset (yes, I can make these claims because 2×0=0) ;)The problem I had with comfort when I first got it was easily solved with a headstrap from a random mobile vr headset I had laying around. I'm sure there are better, more expensive ways.. But this worked fine for me.

So far, so good. My two boys have had nonstop fun with this. I thought this was a awful lot of money to spend but they pooled their Christmas and birthday money and even I have to admit, it’s pretty cool. Also, there is some amount of movement involved with the games so that’s a nice change of pace from regular video games.

Ridiculous that a $400 gaming system can not have multiple users set up!!I let my son do the research and supported his purchase based on the high rating, but would not recommend it if this is an important feature!!!
review_title: Overpriced for a device that cannot have multiple users!!

one_reviews_text: Nada que decir respecto al producto. Es tal como lo describen en el sitio del fabricante y como lo señalan las reseñas.Hay un amplio catálogo de juegos y aplicaciones muy interesantes. Existe mucho material bastante inmersivo para tener buenas experiencias VR.Es cómoda cuando se ajusta bien y el adaptador para los que usamos lentes es suficiente.El envío fue rápido y llegó antes de la fecha estipulada.No es 100% necesaria una cuenta Facebook para su uso.
Seems really cool and will update my review, however my box did not come with a charger, it’s ok cause I have my switch charger which seems to do the trick, but having its own charger would be nice

This is my first step in VR. After having it for over a month, I can say It is the perfect entry point for people who don’t have a powerful gaming pc/laptop or a ps4 for psvr. Since it’s a self contained unit, it’s perfect to take with you to show your friends and family whenever and wherever. Setup is easy and self explanatory, but you’ll probably need a teen or adult to assist children. The only draw backs that I’ve come across are the WiFi has trouble staying connected from time to time, the tracking can be slightly inaccurate at times, and its heavier than you’d think on your head.

The wirelessness is freeing, the headset a bit heavy but not awefully so.  The controllers run out of power pretty quickly and the hand gestures don't work well. Other than that it's a truly amazing experience for those unfamiliar with VR.
review_title: A good step in the road for amazing VR

one_reviews_text: Games are about $10-$40 ( 1-3 gigabytes ) and it comes with a few free app which are mostly geared towards either in person parties or socializing online.As for the hardware it’s sturdy and well build but I’d highly recommend buying some rechargeable lithium ion AA batteries for the controllers.10/10 would buy again.

I recently got a Quest have have fallen in love with VR gaming. I'm excited to see what games come out in the future for it as the current selection is a bit limited. All in all it's ruined conventional gaming for me. The only problem I have with it is the battery life, but I guess that forces me to take a break otherwise I would never stop gaming.

This has become my favorite piece of technology. If you modify the straps, get a back up battery and get some good over ear headphones its a very good experience. This offers more options than any other headset, with a bit of technical knowledge and a good pc you get more options for gaming with this headset than with any other. Side quests games, virtual desktop for regular pc vr games, portability, and functionality for stand alone gaming anywhere. This is the future.

I'M ACTUALLY RETURNING MY OCULUS QUEST VR HEADSET,NOT FOR A BAD REASON,BUT FOR A GOOD ONE. 64 GB IS NOT ENOUGH ,I REALLY LIKE THE OCULUS QUEST I'M GETTING THE 128 GB INSTEAD I HAVE STOP CONSOL GAMING ,JUST OCULUS!!! THE GAMES ARE GREAT ON THE QUEST

I had Oculus Go before. Quest is a huge upgrade and the user experience on Quest is much more advanced.The only complaint is the weight balance of the headset is not very well. Luckily the front heavy problem of the headset can be solved by 3rd party strap or adding additional weight at the back. I still hope Oculus can provide official accessories to solve the problem.
review_title: Better than I thought! Highly recommended!

one_reviews_text: So many fun experiences. Virtual desktop is better than oculus link in everyday use. No wires!! It's cool. 64gb is more than enough if you're here to game. 128gb good for videos and stuff cause as movie is between 10-20gb in vr.
review_title: Games are pricy but the fun is real

one_reviews_text: I work at a desk all day and needed something that would get me moving - find jogging boring and the gym overwhelming. Love Saber Beats!! Haven't tried any apps yet. It's a fun way to get more movement in my schedule. I haven't used it sitting down.

This is the future platform where all VR device innovations will be based upon.This technology has evolved to what gaming should be like in VR as well as navigatingthrough various programs the way we do on our PCs. This is an amazing piece of work locked into this headset. I look forward in seeing how this device continues to evolve for the future.Great product.
review_title: Oculus Quest is the Ultimate VR HeadSet on the Market today

one_reviews_text: Amazing virtual reality system. Does a great job locating and registering the controllers during fast movement. Some of the games can definitely cause motion sickness if you are sensitive to it. Worth the money to give friends and family an unique experience. Remember, most of the games will cost extra.

I adjusted the eye pieces constantly but the images are still blurry. I have come to the conclusion that VR is just not there yet. Sure, it’s fun to use but don’t expect the images to be as crisp as your 4K TV, it’s more like 720p with an antenna.
Product is great! ridiculous the seller and everyone else that is selling this product are just freaking scalping everyone!  Product is 5 stars though if I could I would give the seller a negative 5.

It a cool device that can keep you playing for hours but the I wish the controllers can be charged except for using batteriesUpdate- gets boring so I stopped  using it so it just there collecting dust but I might give a chance some day
review_title: Pretty good but don’t like buying batteries all the time

one_reviews_text: I got it for my sons 15th birthday. He loves his games. He downloaded a roller coaster and wow! I felt like I was really on it. My son has gotten more exercise with this than all summer! Very easy to get motion sick tho

Got this for my daughter.  She loves it, and uses it for her exercise - with Beats Saber and Pistol Whip being some of her favorite apps.  It has an impressive level of graphics for a fully self-contained VR system.  The future is here and will only get better!
review_title: Great VR experience without any cords!

one_reviews_text: Absolutely amazing. Iv been using it for months and it is such an fun cool form of gaming. The only thing I did not like as much is there is a decently limited selection of games considering how long it has been out which is disappointing, but it is still 100% worth it.

Definitivamente , quedé muy sorprendido, más allá de las expectativas, a los que nunca hemos tenido un equipo de realidad virtual, es asombroso.Recomendable un cien por ciento, no se van a arrepentir, ademas , tampoco se sufre de vértigo ( mareos ) , como me pasó en algunos juegos de ps4 por ejemplo.

This was the absolute best gift! I got it for my husband for Christmas and he was so surprised and happy I was able to get one! He plays it often! Only downside is it hurts your head after a while, but that is expected since it has all of the hardware in the headset.
review_title: Lived up to the hype for us

one_reviews_text: Very fun and rapidly increasing gaming content. Would recommend to anyone who wants to get into vr. Owned for 6 months and never had an issue. Obviously the rift will have better graphics but the portability and independence from a pc make this the best all around vr system in my opinion. Image quality was great. There are some scenes or games where the quality could be picked on but it was only noticeable if you were putting effort into LOOKING to for flaws
review_title: Very nice headset. Arguably the best all around

one_reviews_text: Birthday gift for my son.  Having a lot of fun with it.  So immersive that it can be a bit scary with some of the games!  I like that the games are fairly inexpensive when compared to, say, the Switch.  The "casting to a phone or pad" is a great feature to see what's going on and to help inexperienced people learn a game.Be prepared for a little motion sickness or vertigo sometimes.  For me, sometimes the mix of moving in the game, but standing still in a room can get my head aching.

Make sure to buy a link cable if you have a VR Ready PC.  This is probably my favorite buy of the year, I use it practically everyday, and if you are on the fence about buying this just take the plunge.  The quest is so much more than a gaming system, its hard to explain but everything in VR just feels more interactive and personal.  Want a big screen TV? The Quest can stream media and make you feel like you are at the cinema.  You can even watch media in a cinema setting with your friends in VR with an app, it's awesome.  The gaming is great; there is a bit of getting used to when it comes to motion sickness but it goes away with time.

Gave this to my kids for Christmas - brand new devices and it doesn't even work. Won't charge. Waste of $400 if they won't fix. Contacted customer support today. Will update review if they take care of the problem otherwise it's going to get returned.
review_title: Doesn't charge out of the box - brand new device won't charge

one_reviews_text: Great system for the money. I would recommend for anyone starting out or a veteran VR player ready to go wireless. No separate computer required and totally wireless. While a more high priced system with a tied in high storage and processor computer could give better graphics and more storage this system works and looks as good if not better than some higher priced systems. A great starting point for anyone ready to delve into the VR world.

Highly convenient when used as a stand-alone, just put it on and play!We’re only 7 days in and 3rd party PCVR streaming options such as ALVR are working impressively well (admittedly with the need for tweaking & optimising wifi connection between PC and headset). This almost makes wired sets like the Rift S redundant. Sure, latency will never be as low as wired, but visual quality with tweaked settings is breathtaking.I’ve found a good setup for ALVR is to have a dedicated wifi router (no other devices connected) next to my PC set to 5GHz with 80 MHz channel width (on a empty channel), then start a “mobile hotspot” from the PC and connect directly to that with the headset.
review_title: Awesome by itself, add 3rd party wireless PCVR and it might be the best HMD out right now

one_reviews_text: This unit was a Christmas present for my 13 year old, but I can’t get it away from the adults!  I can only say the virtual optics are stunning.  You do not have to put a phone in it, it is cordless, and there are hours of downloadable content available.  This is a cant miss upgrade for your gaming enthusiast.
review_title: Stunning immersion into wireless VR, with excellent build quality.

one_reviews_text: It is a fantastic product for when you want to play vr without having a computer or PlayStation and or tv near you. It can connect to a tv using a from cast or connect to your phone through the app, not the best vr headset for multiple Peale as you’ll have to keep adjusting the head strap to fit different heads.  It has the ability to side load apps and modify current ones which ads more capability. Doesn’t have the most power, so running some games may cause it to slow but handles all games on it well.
review_title: Very fun and good for the price.

one_reviews_text: Great exercise, two sets working trouble free for a year with daily use. Battery compartment on hand controls could have better cover. Get you a recharger and some double a rechargeables. many more uses found. One kid does home school on unit, youtube and more.
Stopped charging after 2 months!!! :/// I think mine was probably faulty because other ppl have left such good reviews! My $400 down the drain!! Can you please send a replacement?
review_title: Stopped charging! Can you please send a replacement?

one_reviews_text: This is a game changer . Bought for my daughters birthday and it is still going strong. She loves it. So many things you can do. Play games, watch Netflix. Just amazing !!! Worth every penny .

Absolutely terrible product. I've completely wasted my whole Christmas tying to set up this piece of garbage. After hours of loading and having to look up how to do factory resets because it kept crashing I was finally able to set it up, but the screen always goes black after rebooting. Worst of all their is absolutely no customer service at all to contact. Just an email you can contact that says they will contact you in two days. I would strongly discourage anyone from buying this product or any Oculus product if they are going to sell garbage and refuse to offer any form of help.

A true all-in-one vr headset. I gave 4 stars for it.I buy Quest so that I don’t have to pay extra money for building a gaming pc and doing exercise while gaming. I have no regrets for buying this.But there are few things about the Quest.1) The front headset is too heavy when I put it on. My face and cheekbones got sore. Therefore, I made a counterweight to solve the problem.2) I have to dry out the facial interface after taking off the headset (I sweat a lot while playing beat saber). The facial interface is made of sponge like material. I wonder if it would be better to put a leather/water proof cover on it.
review_title: Overall it good, just little flaws

one_reviews_text: It's the best independent VR headset in the market right now, there is nothing close to the quality and price right now.I'm a really VR fan, but I don't have time for preparing and maintaining computers just for VR, so, I wanted a device like this, the Oculus Quest, independent, no wired, good graphics, good battery, good FOV, small SDE, 6 DOF, hand controllers, etc., and it's better than I thought it was going to be, good a really nice games/apps.You'll enjoy VR with this headset.
review_title: Just the better independent VR headset in the market, period.

one_reviews_text: Setting it up was so easy. Amazing really came through in time for Christmas with their shipping! Back ordered for over a month ours came on Christmas Eve. Our Christmas day! (When we celebrate it) it’s defiantly the best present ever.

This device is pure magic, and I cannot understand how it can even exist as a standalone device. Yes - the graphics are ok, and for long session it's not so comfortable and the integrated Audio Speaker is meh...But for 400$ you get to take virtual worlds with you on the go.*THIS* is the future and it is amazing.It takes roughly 20 seconds to define a playspace and start playing - anywhere (as long as its not outside in the sun).Tracking is great for the most part, and Oculus are pushing update after update with sweet new features.In short - buy it, it's pure fun.
review_title: You can play Beat Saber ANYWHERE!

one_reviews_text: Great VR product. QC seems to be an issue with dead pixels in the display
Loved this thing all these years but now I'm getting the dreaded no hdmi connection warning so I believe my cable went out and there is no replacement cable to buy so now it's collecting dust

Works amazingly. My husband said it was the best gift I ever gave him, except for our daughter lol. We’ve had it for months with no problems. My four year old daughter even plays with it and loves it. Highly recommend the Oculus!

This is a revolution. The headset which brings VR in mass-market. Whomever you are — buy it and enjoy it.There is only one thing which I had a problem with — charging. My unit turning on/off sometimes by its own. Oculus agreed for replacement, however, I cannot send them back my original unit, so I will have to live with that issue.Otherwise — this is gamechanger and it is a great value
review_title: Revolution in VR — Available for everyone

one_reviews_text: Am I the only one with sun damage to my oculus even though it has not been near the sun? I have not had my oculus a year yet and there are already issues. After Contacting Oculus that's what I was told, but have yet to be helped.

Dont get me wrong the Oculus quest is an amazing console for its price. Theres nothing like it. But thats what it is, a console, and if your not willing to constantly spend money for games on that console, then you can get bored of the games you do have. Other than that, the quest itself is amazing.

I am constantly hindered by bugs in the oculus HMI. I am sick and tired of being unable to access anything because my device refuses to access the internet, or open an app, etc. not only that, but being forced to integrate Facebook into my Oculus account is a huge turnoff. I will be waiting for an alternative VR experience before I upgrade. Oculus is not worth it
Untethered VR allows for different and more immersive experiences than a headset that requires a cable/gaming PC. I believe Oculus is on the right track with wireless, standalone technology.

I love that this product takes up so little space and gives me a high intensity workout with beat saber!!  Everyday I can get a quick workout in and I don’t have to worry about weather or time!!  And it is truly the first workout I can’t wait to do!

Great product, smooth experience, great tracking of both head and controllers.Wire-free VR is fun and liberating.Graphics quality is borderline, due to the weak 835 processor, but I knew that before I ordered it. Luckily, it doesn't ruin the immersion, and many of the games are really cool (but sometimes a little too short and/or expensive).Quest is currently in a category of its own. There is no other affordable standalone wire-free VR headset in the market. It the best (and only) choice for entry to VR.
review_title: Amazing product. A must for anyone interested in VR

one_reviews_text: Super fun but hames can get boring. Aslo be prepared to buy alot of games. They go for $10-$30. If your friends want to watch you have to buy a Google Cast for your tv which is $30.
This was a great Christmas gift. I have loved playing in VR. It was expensive though, and you have to buy the games which are also pretty expensive. That part wasn’t that fun.
review_title: Expensive but still a great Christmas gift

one_reviews_text: Very convenient. I felt comfortable wearing this with glasses, weight is light and no dizziness after playing hours of Robo recall. Could even watch movie with this on.

The oculus quest provides the a VR that was, until recently, only seen in science fiction.  The experiences you can have with this head set are beyond describable.  I have had previous experience using an HTC vive at the local vr arcade.  The experience is very comparable.  Some of the high end graphic games don't look as great in the quest but most of the games look almost the same  AND you're not tripping on chords.  The headset is a little heavy and adjusting the straps takes getting used to but overall the quest blew all my expectations out of the water.  It is truly an amazing piece of technology.

Oculus Quest is, needless to say, AWESOME!!!  I’ve tried Apollo 11 Quest and VRChat apps as well as watching PlutoTV.  Apollo 11 was an extraordinary experience well worth the $9.99.  VRChat was really cool as well and it’s free.  Needless to say, I highly recommend the Oculus Quest and actually I recommend getting the 128GB version which I regret not doing.  I’m looking forward to trying the Star Wars VR app Vader Immortal: Episode I.

Don't buy Oculus. Their hardware only works half the time, losing tracking every minute when playing game. And they are forcing people to move to facebook so they have even more info on people.If you want to play VR, get a Valve Index. It might be 4 times the price but at least it will work. And steam always has deals.
I love it new updates for the link came out and it looks good feels good if you were deciding between the rift s & the Oculus Quest. BUY the QUEST it's a no-brainer

I like the VR a lot. Most the graphic make you feel like you are really there. But my wife and I can not wear it for more than 5-10 minutes before getting a bad headache and feeling nauseous. Going to be sending it back.
review_title: Good graphics/ bad headaches and nausea

one_reviews_text: Wow! What a fun and great product.  I got this for my wife and secretly I tried it out. It's fun! The games are great. They run about 8$ to about 20$ . They are somewhat short as well.  But I would say get this right now!
It's awesome.  I feel like I am finally living in 2019 Utopian Technology (!) versus the 1934 Conald Trump dystopia.  It's super cool, totally portable, and resolution is good (but not great).

After reading and watching a lot of reviews for the Oculus Quest I decided to splurge. This was my first VR headset and I'm super impressed. The games are fun and look great. It has been a blast to bring to parties.

It's got everything: standalone VR, computer-connected VR, etc.And, with a bit of tweaking, you can also watch movies, stream movies online (Plex), play SteamVR games (via SideQuest/VirtualDesktop/ALVR), and so much more...There's just two more things I'd want now, first, when connected to a PC, I'd like the lower half to be a pass through, to see my keyboard and mouse, and the upper half, all screen; and the other one: I want to be able to play movies from a USB drive, especially 3D movies, because those take WAAY too much space to fit in with everything.
review_title: It's the No.1 item to have right now

one_reviews_text: This product is way way better than I expected. I thought the graphics would be completely terrible, but they aren't. I thought the tracking wouldn't be that good, but it is pretty fantastic. I would say the biggest cons are 1. heavy on the face, but you can mitigate that by attaching a battery brick to the back of the headset. 2. the audio is good, but missing a bit of bass, and everyone around you can hear it. But you can get headphones, like the mantis ones for PSVR or use any 3.5mm headphones.

Removed three stars because the headset starts flickering and rendered unusable. And support took 2 weeks to respond. Even then they did not support the country when I am from so I needed to have a US residential address to send and receive in order to have support. What a waste of my time and money. At least let me ship straight from my country.

It's very convenient but super heavy and uncomfortable to wear. My head hurts after a few mins of wear time. It also doesn't quite sit/focus properly if you wear glasses. Highly recommend that you guys try it out in store first.
review_title: Great product but uncomfortable to wear

one_reviews_text: I don’t normally write reviews, but this thing is just so awesome that I had to. This headset is like the Nintendo Switch of VR right now. It doesn’t need a computer or wires, and it is completely standalone. The only drawback to this, is that the graphics aren’t as good as an oculus rift, or any other big setup VR headset. However, that is a given if you’re going to get a stand-alone, and I was prepared for that. If graphics aren’t what you care about in video games, 100% get this headset, because you will have so much fun.

This is an awful lot of money to spend on something that works for just 3 weeks. The right controller doesn't work anymore rendering the whole unit worthless. The support website does nothing and there are tons of other people with the same problem. I would give it zero stars if I could. It's very disappointing that a company can't stand by its product for even a month and offers a 1 year warranty that does not get honored.

Excellent product. Only reason for 4 stars is that Quest 2 is out now - screen quality and value-for-money of Quest 2 is a step above the original Quest. Quest 1 is a still a great product if you can get it at a good price though.

I was so excited for my first VR headset! As soon as I open the box, I could smell the off-gassing. Just putting on the headset for 15 minutes gives me a headache. The smell is absolutely terrible! I'm going to put in the garage and see if after a day or so the smell goes away. Or I'll have to return it :( it's such a bad chemical smell it worries me!!!

So far we love our Oculus Quest but need to practice a lot more.  I was supposed to get 3 free games (I ordered before Jan 31) but I don’t recall what the name of the games were.  Is there somewhere I can find these free games?
First VR set I’ve owned or played and I think my kids think I bought it for them. Easy to set up and start playing right out the box.

My son bought this with his own money and it was a great purchase! We've had it a day and even my husband tried it out. He was amazed and as excited as a little kid and he doesn't even like video games. It's an awesome device for the price.
I have not touched my PSVR since I got this thing. The sound and video quality is pretty amazing considering the price of the unit. I love playing without having a cord tethering you to something.
review_title: This is what I’ve been waiting for

one_reviews_text: Well built, seems pretty durable against drops, and whacking a controller on a table.  Hand controls eat AA batteries like candy, but it sure is fun.Not exactly a cheap gift, and the download games are a bit pricy too.
Ordered a oculus quest on April 28th. I really recommend the oculus quest. It is way higher quality then the PSVR. And it also has beat saber, it’s definitely the best game on the Oculus.
Honestly it's cool but it's way more of a novelty still at this point. There is a real lack of games still and they need a lot of improvement. Still a couple years away from being worth it

Surpassed all of my expectations. My wife can beat saber wordlessly and I can Oculus link into my complete VR pc library. And it just keeps getting better. For $400 and no base stations I am beyond satisfied.
review_title: On the go, or tethered Quest delivers.

one_reviews_text: The system is amazing the only problem is mine started shutting off while I was playing, the screen would just get all bright and a loud squeezing noise. Occulus replaced it right away but didn't let me know it was shipped to me so I just happened to find a $400 item at my side door , I was a little upset about that.
review_title: Great system mine just was defective

one_reviews_text: Way way way too expensive for what you get. The playstation oculus is 1/4 the cost and is much better
There was no code to link the device so it was a very expensive paperweight. Returned it the same day
review_title: Didn't work at all plus the quest 2 is half the price

one_reviews_text: I have had my quest for a couple of months now and I love it! I have no complaints about it other than the fact I don't have more time to play it.

I received the Quest and couldn't be happier.  The headset was back ordered but I ended up receiving it a few days ahead of the expected ship date, so that was a welcome surprise.  I have used PC based headsets before, including the original Oculus Rift, and was surprised to see that the Quest is able to provide a very similar experience, and is vastly improved in some ares, due to the versatility of not having to be attached to a PC.

Have had had it 2 weeks now and it’s so much fun. Am impressed with live events, it’s almost like being there. Never have tried VR before til now and I can say that this is everything I expected and more. Obviously it’s the beginning of this tech, but am excited of the what’s to come in the next years. Don’t hesitate to buy, order ASAP as availability is low.

Quality control is not good. My unit had shuttering issue and the next days go completely dark on me.Returned and receive a supposedly new unit. Apparently a returned unit with no wrapping , no protective film on lense, a battery inside the controller. Quite disappointed actually.If it’s working it is fun.

I love my psvr but being so tall I often have tracking issues when using the move controllers.I am fairly tall so the  so I often had tracking issues with the PSVR move controllers and camera. I purchased the Quest in hopes that tracking would work better for me. I am happy to say that it works much better and I have yet to have any game breaking tracking issues with it.The loss of the one star is simply for the small library of games at this point.
review_title: Tracking for tall people  ismuch better than on the PSVR.

one_reviews_text: Its wonderful. Fully wireless and portable VR system. I brought this into the office one day, and we took over a conference room to play around with it. All of my co-workers loved it, and many of them were VR first-timers. I now take this thing to all my family and friend get-togethers. I also use it to experiment with VR game development. Again, the portability of this thing means I can quickly add a feature/level to my game, then take it over to my friends to have them test it out.

Won't be able to process a lot without a stronger chip or without casting directly to it, but for the built in/ports - this does a fantastic job. No wires is a dream, only wish it was Li-Ion controllers instead of AA Alkaline.
review_title: A Phone Processor, but runs fine

one_reviews_text: The Oculus Quest that I received is a used product.The box is broken, the wrapping material is missing, the surface have been scratched, the controller was used with battery inserted, that is supposed to be contained inside the accessory box separately. The covering plastic sheets on the lenses have been removed.AND YOU WON'T GET THE "VADER IMMORTAL" AS WELL, SINCE THE DEVICE WAS ACTIVATED.Contacted to Oculus support, waiting for refund from Amazon(which I live outside US, Oculus Support can't help with that).

Awesome unit! Had an original oculus rift a couple years ago. Got tired of hooking up and un-hooking the sensors and being tethered in my small space. I use the quest in my living room which is much larger and it is a blast!

This headset is amazing.  It really shows off the future of a VR world.  While the games and graphics may be a little primitive this devices is a truly immersive experience.  Makes me want to dedicate a whole large empty room just to be able to fully enjoy all it has to offer.  Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.
review_title: Glimpse into what is to come

one_reviews_text: I am really impressed with this device.  Setup and training were really simple. Beat Sabre is totally addictive. Games are around $25 a piece, a bit pricey, but a lot less than Nintndo Switch games.
review_title: Easy to setup and fun to play with

one_reviews_text: my son's right hand controller broke out of nowhere...he didn't hit anything, it just broke at the seam...frustrating for such an expensive equipment

First thing you’ll notice is the care they put into the packaging. The box it comes with is sturdy enough to last you a long time. I’ve been using my to trasport it around perfectly. This thing is amazing. The resolution is greater than the original HTC vive and the wireless freedom is amazing. Graphically I was really impressed. Some optimized games look almost identical to the HTC vive and games like Rec room run really well. My only gripe is that there are a few bugs to be delt with on games that have been ported over but this VR experience is absolutely worth 399. You won’t be disappointed.
Coming from a rift I can still give it a 5. It's lighter for sure which surprised me. The graphics I could tell right away was much worse. But no cables or cameras to deal with makes it worth it.
Fantastic virtual reality portable system! Whole family loves it. Would highly recommend! Games are reasonably priced as well to add on.

This thing is great. While yes there is light leakage at the nose I found it actually is helpful when you want to check your phone without removing your headset...or figure out which cat you stepped on. Ooops

For $400 only one user per device,  I get single user device, like its a headset - kinda hard to share at one time- but give me a break . So only one user profile at a time.  This is the kind plan that makes me want to cancel my FB.
review_title: single user - are you kidding me

one_reviews_text: I could not complete the set up process. I think I need a newer iPhone to make it work. I have iPhone 6s, it not compatible i guess

Awesome VR experience and even better with ALVR for playing Steam VR. The setup is super easy and this can go anyway. I was worried about losing out on the PC performance, but with ALVR, I can run SteamVR games and still have the wireless experience and freedom of the Quest. It really is an awesome piece of tech.
review_title: Awesome VR experience and even better with ALVR for playing Steam VR

one_reviews_text: This thing is such a blast. My daughter and I fight over who gets to use it. The games are great and getting better, the controls are spot on and the features rock. If your thinking about buying this just stop waiting and do it, you won't regret it.
This is the most incredible Virtual Reality headset!  I love the Beat Saber game and love the 360 YouTube videos!!!  Im not a gamer - Im a grandma and you do get a workout playing this!!!  Amazing!
review_title: I never thought I would do this.....

one_reviews_text: A legit VR experience.  This is how it should've been..I think this device will finally make VR viable for mainstream use.

VR is really here. As my first VR headset, the Oculus Quest, blew my mind with the experience and the amount of fun it provides us with. For a standalone VR headset it's worth the money because it gives you the freedom to move without worrying about wires, and the performance is really good too. So far so good! I love my new acquisition.
review_title: Awesome VR headset! Worth the money!

one_reviews_text: I just got this a week ago, and I can say my expectations were blown away by the Virtual Reality environments the Quest provides through numerous apps.  If this is how VR now, I can't even imagine what it would be like in just 10 years. Obviously gave 5 stars, and have already shared with family and friends. Everyone who has tried it was completely taken aback by the VR environment and the degrees of freedom.You just have to try it out for any explanation to be given proper justice.
review_title: Welcome to the world of VR

one_reviews_text: We charged up the device and dialed it in expecting to do some really great gaming, but it stopped working after a couple of hours use.  Hunk of junk, immersive video to door stop in less than a day.  Sent it back for a refund and will not buy another.
review_title: It didn't last a day before it broke.

one_reviews_text: Absolutely OUTSTANDING!! I am an old gamer and I have owned every platform since Sega and Nintendo all the way to Xbox 1.Oculus quest is the most mind blowing fun experience of all!

Bought as a Christmas gift for my son. He loves the device. So device is 5 stars. However, Oculus Customer Support is an endless loop. Online support chats disconnect and online support requests are not responded to in their stated 48 hour timeframe. 0 Starts for Oculus Customer Support - that gets me to the 2 star average. If you do not have a question for the support center or a problem with you device which needs support ---- this VR device is awesome.
review_title: Support from Oculus for this device is lacking

one_reviews_text: I really enjoyed my quest.my computer isn't strong enough for PCVR, so the quest is great for me.I tried also my friend's Rift s, and out of the two I would recommend the quest, even for pcvr :the option for portability is nice,you cap paly pcvr games, WITH NO CABLES at all, (using virtual desktop for example).overall great product, but buy the quest 2 instead. 100$ cheaper, and better.
