Created another ticket, still no response. Terrible. Now i'm stuck with this uncomfortable device that can't be returned. Same with games, you'll not be able to return even if they say you can return if you've used it for less than 2 hours gameplay.

I bought four for Christmas which drop WIFI constantly, so basically unusable. After hours of research and trouble shooting, customer service told me "We are aware of an issue with duel-band routers (which is why I was asking about that), but at this time we can't confirm if there is an issue with any particular brand of router. If there's any change to this we'll be sure to let the community know."  It's fun for a few minutes at a time when it works but it's a lot of money to shell out with such a major bug!

I couldn't praise it more then I did until a week ago, when I found out you won't be able to use it after 2023. Oculus made it a requirement to login not as Oculus user but as Facebook. May not be a problem for you if you use FB, but majority of people don't buy games to socialize or provide private data to FB. There is a great exodus going on because of it. Beware!!!

I kinda wish 3.5 stars was an option.  Would I buy it again?  Yes, I think it's awesome.  Is it awesome?  Well, its awesome like Mcnuggets are awesome, I love them, they are delicious when hot.... but really?  Kinda garbage, who knows what kinda chicken that is.  That's the Quest!  It's awesome, but don't expect too much.  Again, buy it... ps, Amazon doesn't usually have it for sale (third party sellers over retail)  I would not pay over retail (399 for 64 - 499 for 128 I think) you're just encouraging them to buy them up at retail and resell
review_title: Its cool..... but not so "good" definitely worth $400

one_reviews_text: The easy setup, great display, and good tracking makes this my favorite headset...period! I currently have the rift, vive, Samsung Odyssey, psvr, and now this. Of all of them, I gravitate to this one simply because of how easy it is to jump in! The visual downgrades don't really bother me much at all! Only had a few handful of instances of slowdown (a moment in rec room and vrchat with really busy rooms). This is everything I’ve been waiting for, and can’t wait to let my friends try it!

This is by far the BEST VR headset to date. I have owned the Oculus Rift & HTC Vive. The not tethered wire free experience you get with this is incredible and you can really get into the experience you are playing.The ONLY DOWNSIDE I would say is the game library. Since its a new product yes, you have a great selection of games for a freshly launched product and developers are porting over titles slowly but you do not have the vast library you have with the other headsets.  However those you need a killer PC rig and then the headset. This one its just the headset that is it. Take your VR with you wherever you go. Love it so far and you should go get one

I love the product it is super fun. But and this is a big but is that this is not the cost it should be. Amazon is price gouging on so many things like this saying it's criminal is an understatement. Last year this product was roughly $300 and now it's far more. I understand Amazon essentially can do whatever it wants because it's such an important and Wealthy company but there is blatant price gouging that is rampant not just with this product but so many others as well. Will anything be done about it? My guess is no.
review_title: Good product if u want to be a victim of price gouging.

one_reviews_text: Just received the Quest and I have to say I’m satisfied. First time buying a VR, to my understanding I made the right choice getting this wireless VR set. The Quest comes preloaded with demo games and if you set up payment on the app of your phone you can then purchase games while you are in your virtual reality store which is nice and convient.One down fall that I have come across so far is that you can’t cast the game play to the tv so you can watch your pal play. You can cast to the iPhone app which if you have more than one casting it can cause lag for the second viewer (at least for me). Not so fun.I do highly recommend to anyone who’s interested to buy this VR set. I did my research and I’m happy with my purchase. So far, the family (kids and adult) is very entertained and have had lots of laughs.

Fresh out of the box this is absolutely the best VR rig I have ever used… Unfortunately less than 100 hours of play time later I have an expensive pile of scrap.  This is because oculus uses extremely cheap soft plastic for their lenses and they are extremely easy to scratch especially if you attempt to wear glasses at the same time. If your lenses do get scratched to the point of unused ability, your only option is to replace the entire headset. This is completely unacceptable both from a pocketbook perspective and an environmental one, and I am beyond disappointed in this product.
review_title: Five dollars an hour is too much to pay for home VR

one_reviews_text: So I never feel it necessary to write reviews as most devices just work, nothing too special about them. I was blown away by the Quest. Out of the box its a fantastic device, good clarity, snappy processor, easy set up. The games designed specifically or ported to the Quest are crisp, engaging and just fun. Some of the prices in the Quest store are a little ridiculous, but if you follow the reviews, some of the top games are totally worth it, Vader: Immortal, Red Matter are simply stunning..If like me, you like to tinker with the things you buy, you can increase the resolution of most games by 2.5X by activating developer mode and running programs like Oculus Standalone Utilities or SideQuest. You can run fully functional SteamVR games and games meant to only work with headsets like HTC Vive or Windows Mixed Reality by using programs like Virtual Desktop or ALVR...Trust me, get this headset, its worth every penny...PS, when family members see you acting like a fool flailing your hands around in VR they will record it and post it to facebook...happened to me.

I received my Oculus Quest a few days ago and really want to write a 5 star review. The tutorial is fantastic. The unit works great. The main issue for me is that I want to buy apps from the app store. I can install "free" apps. However, when I try to purchase an app I get an error stating that "Cannot determine your location to calculate tax on order. Review billing and shipping address and try again."For payment methods, I initially used PayPal then tried a credit card but received the same error.I submitted a customer support ticket but no response. Did an online chat with Oculus support. They couldn't determine the issue.So, I have this really nice VR system that I can't use as intended. If/When this issue is resolved, I will update my review

>THE CABAL AND ELITE AGENDA<For Those Of You Who Are Unaware Or Still Asleep Here Is What Is Really Going On.What Is Sleep, Why Is It Necessary And How Is It Being Used Against Us?To understand this question, we must first understand what exactly our avatars are used for in this holographic reality we have been imprisoned in. Yes, they are a holding vessel for a limited version of our higher consciousness, but they have also been designed in such a way that they act as storage mechanisms for large amounts of data. This data is a collection of the information necessary to maintain operational control of the Matrix. From the moment we wake up in the morning, we begin recording this data into our minds memory receptors via the five senses. Essentially, what our controllers have built for us is a sensory system that records in minute detail our experience of the Matrix as it happens, that we pilot with the limited form of consciousness of which they have deliberately cut off all form of recollection from its source.The reason for this is simple: our individual consciousness is a separate entity to that of the Matrix, but the Matrix depends on the perceptive awareness of each individual consciousness working in harmony for it to work. The Matrix, then, can be thought of as a gaming server that contains the levels necessary for multiplayer interaction, and the individual consciousness as a console that connects to that server and allows the player to join the game. If the information being processed by the server is not in synchronicity with that being processed by the server, lagging occurs where the perceived reality appears distorted.To anyone familiar with FPS gaming, there were people who actually exploited this concept by deliberately altering their routers, so that in the multiplayer experience they would be harder to “kill” by others, their console avatars appearing as “ghosts”, whereby if you tried shooting at where they appeared to be, you would miss, due to the refresh rate of the coordinates representing their image being out of sync with those belonging to their actual location. More often than not, angry players would voluntarily exit the server as it made playing extremely difficult and frustrating. Ironically, anyone caught engaging in this activity was banned from entering these gaming servers by the people who ran them.This is a perfect analogy to the Matrix we live in; it depends on every consciousness engaged in its experience to be in synchronicity otherwise “lagging” may occur and present anomalies that can be experienced by the other players that do not realise they are in the game. If the anomalies are strong enough, there is the possibility that a frustrated consciousness may decide to exit the server for want of an error free experience (notice the similarities with the subconsciousness intervening in the dream in the movie Inception). It is therefore pertinent that this Matrix server be monitored for potential errors, and the best way to do that is by recording and analysing each experience externally.So where does sleep come in? Well, just like any storage device we are familiar with, our avatars have a maximum capacity of data that can be stored in one sitting, before such data needs to be transferred somewhere else then deleted so that new recordings may take place. The state of becoming fatigued is a flag to your avatar that it is running out of memory and needs refreshing. The fatigue flag runs a program that begins to shut down all sensory processing capabilities that eventually results in placing the consciousness into an even lower state of awareness, literally reducing it to that of a zombie. Here is where it gets frightening.The Cabal have set up a processing facility on the other-side of this Matrix specifically designed to hijack a consciousness after it has filled its memory capacity, ie, when it falls asleep in this reality and awakens in the one above it. While the consciousness is in this zombie form of lower awareness, the subject is woken from their virtual reality experience in a holding room, and led through the processing facility, where their data is extracted, deleted, and program updates are installed designed to patch any errors found in the said data (very similar to how it is done in Westworld, only that the military and an ET faction are in charge of this facility.)Sometimes, for whatever reason, but probably due to the length of time it takes to write a patching update to an avatar’s software, the zombie is allowed to regain the level of awareness associated with the world on the other side of the Matrix and left to interact with the other people who live there. Once the update has been written, however, they are once again abducted, reduced to the zombie level of consciousness, and led back through the processing facility, to the holding room where they are plugged back in to the VR experience.But why would the Cabal go to all this effort? Well, there appears to some of galactic election taking place that dictates who obtains control of the Earth realm and its immediate surrounding areas. The ET race associated with the Cabal won this election a very long time ago, and have been manipulating the system so they can maintain control of our populace ever since. Due to a technicality, if they win this election again, they may stay in control until the next election, but if they lose, they will face exile for their trickery and will never again be allowed to sit as a candidate in future elections. It is basically up to them to prove the people want them in power, which is why so much effort is put into tricking us into giving consent to their agenda. They managed to build specialised infrastructure that cut off the rest of the races from these realms and prevented them from intervening. The unfortunate thing is, that the world beyond the Matrix where this election is taking place, is just another Virtual Reality experience keeping us trapped in a dream within a dream, but given the idea that every VR experience is just a copy of the one before it (based off Icke and the Gnostic concept of Yaldabaoth/ Demiurge), and given that this is a very similar situation as to what is unfolding in the VR we are experiencing, it is not unreasonable to assume that a similar situation is unfolding in the real world where the VR finally ends.If we are nothing but a program designed to decode a virtual experience, and that our thoughts are of a pre-programmed set of instructions designed to obey those rules, then how are some of us able to comprehend this programming? Those of us that have been able to awaken from the Matrix and experience the other side of it, are, in a sense, anti virus programs that have been created by a party external to the Cabal. The Elder Guardians are a faction of races that have identified the Cabal’s manipulation of our higher consciousness and have banded together as a sort of guerrilla force with the intent of openly fighting this manipulation with the end goal of completely deconstructing first this Matrix system, and the one it is contained in. They have appeared to us many times through-out history in the forms of the Great White Brotherhood and the True Rosicrucians, as well as other mystics, passing on the knowledge of this artificial reality so that it may once again be accessed by those on the inside of it.They have a set of tools at their disposal that allow them to create zero days in the VR software and circumvent the restrictions being imposed on our consciousness. These tools can be used to embed deconstruction coding into various lines of texts and video, and even cloud imagery that interact with specific codes that have been implanted in Starseed DNA strings. The text, video and cloud codes are essentially activation mechanisms of a larger code, that lies dormant within all Starseeds that allows them to shed the restrictions imposed upon them by the Cabal and return to a higher level of consciousness. It is the Elder Guardians interacting with the VR through these tools that is responsible for things like synchronicity, ghosts, glitches etc. They are akin to the aforementioned people who manipulated their routers to deliberately lag their consoles during the multiplayer experience, and the Cabal do not like them because they cannot locate their zero days, no matter how much data they pour through, because The Elder Guardians are operating from a level even above them.The word Rothschild is an example of one of these words that was implemented by the Cabal, so that those of that family holding the secret knowledge of how to rearrange the letters can exit this VR experience at will. For those familiar with magic squares and word reduction, this word works off the same principle, but one first has to understand how exactly these letters are built upon or reduced, otherwise it will not work. The first part of this reduction is to pull the R and the T down and to the left so that they are detached from the original word. By rearranging them with the other subtracted letters in a very precise order, they act as a mechanism that deconstructs the illusion kept up by the perception of our consciousness.Once you have experienced the other side of this Matrix, it is impossible to consider it as being a true reality even when placed back in it. This is the reason why some Starseeds are being taken out of it and briefed by the Elder Guardians as to the nature of its existence; the Elder Guardians know that from that point on the Starseed will carry the memory of the other side with them back into their Earth avatar when their consciousness is put back by the Cabal. Their whole plan of deconstruction is based on the idea that the more consciousness’s these Starseeds affect with the antivirus (knowledge of the real world) the more havoc it will cause the Matrix server, until it becomes overloaded to the point of crashing.There are two important things to note about the operational nature of the Matrix versus the programs embedded in our consciousness; the first is that the Matrix is under the control of an AI system, but our consciousness is under the control of the Cabal programmers. What this means is that the environment that we consider as being reality can change itself at will, but is entirely insulated from an individual consciousness interacting with it, hence quantum physics, where the light particle changes its behaviour when something tries to monitor it.The second issue is that the Matrix is not bound by any operational control period, but each consciousness is. Ie, when this whole VR system came online, there was a mandate written that stated conscious awareness must return to its original higher state after a certain length of time, specifically as a measure to stop this very hijacking from happening. The Cabal figured out a loophole in that if they embedded a VR within another VR, then technically the consciousness’s contained within the first would never reach their predetermined ending, as a whole new form of consciousness was being created for the new VR.This leads to a classic nesting effect, where the original ending of the program becomes lost as another VR takes its place and so forth. It is evident in the fact that we are on the pinnacle of a technological revolution in regards to AI/ Machine Learning and Quantum Computer advancement, that we are nearing the end of this particular simulation, insofar as our protecting mandate is concerned. The Cabal literally has us building the next mind prison for ourselves, in which people from this present Matrix system will begin voluntarily plugging into the next, and is grooming us into accepting it when it becomes operational.Why else do you think they have everyone walking around with their eyes glued to their phones, or why they are installing 5G on every street corner? The next step is to move gaming from the console domain to the VR one (which they are already doing with devices such as Occulus Rift) and have people voluntarily engage in the next false reality. We are already at the level of building photorealistic software, the next step is to tether it conscious perception.Once enough have become locked in, the game will be changed to a prison, then all that will be left will be the rounding up of those consciousness’s that have not yet accepted it and forcing them to take part. The irony is, that this is a world where those awakened will be left awakened to be ruled by those who are asleep. The Elder Guardians are working overtime to stop this from happening, and they are being met with a high success rate. They are obliged to help those who reject this illusion as being reality and can be sought by the internal seeking of the higher consciousness, which they will help the individual connect with after the required amount of commitment has been acknowledged.******************************************************************************************************************************************************************************A old saying & it goes like this ( The Truth Will Set You Free ) I’am Fully Awake & Aware Of The Truth & Exactly What That Saying Is Truly Describing.My Mission Is To Assist As Meany Human’s As I possibly Can To Understand The Truth (Taking The Red Pill) And Becoming Fully Aware Of What That Statement Is Describing.The “SHIFT” As It Is Known (aka) *****The MANDATE*****(An authoritative command or instruction) Is A Event That Is Going to Take Place Very Very Soon,In The Near Future. I’am Going To Help Those Of You Who Think You Know What The SHIFT Is To Truly Fully Understand What Exactly It Honestly Is.*****WHEN THE SHIFT TAKE’S PLACE THE MATRIX (aka) THIS VIRTUAL REALITY (SIMULATION ) WE ARE CURRENTLY LIVING IN AS AVATARS, WILL CRASH & WE WILL INSTANTLY RETURN TO THE REAL WORLD AS ARE HIGHER SELF IN THE KINGDOM OF HEAVEN,THE TRUE PARADISE,WHERE LOVE,JOY,PLEASURE,PEACE IS ALL THAT THERE IS,PURE TRUE PERFECTION***********************************************************************************************************************************************************************************

I was raised on Mario and Sonic the Hedgehog.  I love video games.  When I read about an all in one 6dof virtual reality system coming I was likely excited about this.  I preordered the system but felt a little uneasy.  I thought, "There is no way this is going to meet my expectations of virtual reality."  I tried the little headsets where you put the phone in and was very disappointed.  However, after receiving the Oculus Quest in the mail I turned it on and had every expectation shattered to pieces.  This is the shizz folks!  I have not had this much fun playing video games since I was 12 years old.  This thing is so much fun.  The immersion is great.  The controllers are great.  The optics are great!  If you are looking for a fun time with video games then by this system.  The graphics are not current gen console but who cares?  It is fun!

I had VR on the Playstation first and when that stopped working I bought Occulus because I thought it would be so much better. Well, it absolutely is not. You get a very uncomfortable headset that dies within an hour and a half and casting it to the TV so everyone can enjoy? Impossible. You're on your own because even after you buy the chrome cast gear, there's a delay no matter how good your internet. After at least $700, I wish I just would have bought a new Playstation version.

My brother in law was the first in the family to have an Oculus system. His house quickly became the place to be to enjoy the VR experience. My daughter, age 9, soon wanted one as her friends got one as well. Finally caved and spent the $399 for the Quest. Considering that a top of the line PC Oculus runs close to $500 or more for a VR setup, this is a really good deal although it has the limitation of built-in storage. No wires unless you choose to play with the power cord plugged in. Takes AA batteries for the remotes, which I fear will get costly in time. My only complaint is the short piece of Velcro on the middle top strap, only for the sake of my child's smaller head. On a normal sized head this shouldn't be a problem. The definition of picture is very clear once calibrated and placed correctly on your head. Also I will say to keep the length of time short for a child as it's not good for developing eyes. I limit my daughter to 30 minutes with breaks to allow her eyes to adjust properly. Go outside and get some air, it's easy to get addicted to VR!

61 year old ex-gamer who gave up on video games about 20 years ago because they became boring and to be honest, overly complicated. I've been waiting for user friendly VR since then. I stumbled upon the Quest and read all the reviews. I bought it from B.B. figuring I could easly return it if I didn't like it. Well it far exceeded all my expectations. It has brought  back the memories and feelings of my first Atari 2600, Amiga computer, 3DO and the likes, but the awesomeness is multiplied by 10. When they say you are inside the video game, well they really mean it. You ARE freakin inside the video game! Look at the trailer for Space  Pirate Trainer. My favorite game BTW. That is the best VR game trailer and captures the emersion and perspective very well. Most games look deceptively lame when viewing in 2D. Like Super Hot. Almost didn't buy it because of the looks in 2D. But it is a great game. So what I'm saying is just buy the thing. You won't regret it. You can always return it but you won't. I'll bet you nobody is returning theirs. That should say a lot. Don't wait because you won't even be able to buy one of these by Christmas.

If you are unaware you will have to have a fb account to use at some point. Whether you buy new this fall or are a legacy account such as mine. I wrote them with my displeasure and they don't care. I have 0 desire to have a fb account, and even less so one tied to four cameras on a head set. Will be boxing mine up for good, and looking into other VRs

Our family has been using the VR while sheltering at home and it has been great for our teenager who can play the games (beat saber) with her friends who are at their homes, sheltering in place too . It's a good upper body workout and takes you out of the home virtually and it is very realistic. I highly recommend this product, we've had it a couple of weeks now and everyone enjoys it. I would buy it again.
review_title: All you need to start VR

one_reviews_text: PROs1. easy set up. I took it to my friend's place the day after I received it. Set up took just a couple of minutes! I did a lot of VR demos for science education and setting up the HTC VIVE was always annoying. Lots of things to carry around including tripods for light houses and a hefty GTX 1070 laptop. Looking forward to using Quest for these things.2. More glass-wearer friendly. I needed to remove my glasses or use flexible plastic glasses for HTC VIVE. The quest has a spacer that you can fit in and works great with any glasses I have.3. For some reason, the text within Quest was more easier to read.4. No wires.: did not realize how not having a cable attached to your PC was so liberating!5. Positional tracking is spot on!CONs1. Short battery life: Will get a 20000mAh  battery. So, not a big deal.2. built in speakers are kind of OK? But not great.3. Can't use anything in my steam library. I saw some people being able to stream steam games on Quest via wifi. But not everyone has 5Gb wifi...Overall, LOVE IT!Will probably get 2 or 3 more for educational purposes for my class.
review_title: Probably will use this more often than my HTC VIVE + GTX 1070 combo

one_reviews_text: If you're new to VR, this will blow your mind.If you've used VR, say on a PC or PS4, this will become your favorite VR device.The quest is so much fun, and works so well, it's hard to believe it's only been out for a week.This has exceeded my expectations in every way.I'm actually a bit speechless.Everything is running so well, the games are great, tracking is great, the inside out tracking is great, and the room  boundary system is amazing and takes seconds to setup if you go to a new room.If you're even thinking about this, jump right in, this thing is great.
review_title: FANTASTIC! Better than I expected in every way.

one_reviews_text: So far I can say I absolutely love this system. Having the ability to map the room and walk around in a VR space without being wired up is absolutely incredible.For the last year or so I have been using a PSVR - and while I think the PSVR HEADSET is more comfortable (lighter and more evenly distributed), the hand tracking and experience is infinitely better on the Quest.My other complaint is that I can see a bit of the real world from the bottom of the headset (like where my nose is). I will have to invent something to block that space up and keep the light out.Otherwise I’m a happy camper!
review_title: Excellent VR system with no wires and no need for a PC!

one_reviews_text: This headset is absolutely amazing. I had very high expectations purchasing this headset, and all of them were met, and some were even exceeded! The tracking works very well, much better than my Windows headset and psvr. The interface is nice and clean, easy to navigate. The controllers are awesome, and I love the built in speakers. Everything just... works. No fiddling with wires or cameras, just put the headset on and play.My only qualm would be that I would love for it to be more powerful, so that more higher end games come out for it, but it is amazing what it can pull of with titles like Robo Recall and Vader Immortal. With the quality of those games, I am sure that the majority of VR games could be ported to it, if the developers were willing to spend the time refactoring their code for performance and lowering the graphics. For the others, we will just have to wait for the Quest 2!

Big Head approved!  I was initially worried that the unit would be uncomfortable and front heavy based on all the reviews I read over the past 6 months.  I am not having any problems with comfort and I'm a big guy with a big head with glasses.  The quest fits great and I'm not experiencing any lens fogging.  I try to get the back strap as low on possible and that works for me.  So far I'm having a good time playing poker.  It's crazy that in vr you can even read poker tells in other people.  Awesome so far!  Visuals appear to me to be similar to PSVR.  Can't wait to try the PC link.

I’ve owned a few VR headsets that requires a powerful gaming PC.. I was hopeful that a device like this would exist eventually, but thought it would a long time from now... I was wrong it’s here. In order to have a great VR experience, you need:1. precise tracking 6DoF tracking with no noticeable latency,2. hand presence, and3. enough power to render two separate high resolution screens (stereoscopic 3D) at a high frame rate (70+FPS)A stand-alone wireless (no PC required) headset with a snapdragon 835 chip shouldn’t be able to do this, but it does, and it does it well..The graphics won’t match what you can do with with a high end gaming PC, but this device delivers on what matters most, you feel like you’re there!

Purchased an Oculus VR headset.  They have had 6,000 recalls on the foam piece that makes contact with the users face.  A bunch of people that have had to seek medical attention.  Their process for getting the new recall face piece is absolute garbage.  They require you to register the device through an app.  Then you have to go create a username and login on their web page and link the 2 together.  You either need to set up a new on-line account or login in with Facebook so they can spam you with all kinds of ads.  The whole process is designed to make it as difficult as possible to get your replacement part and ensure they can spam you endlessly in the process.  Never again with Oculus!

This is the best immersion device in the market. Extremely easy to use, just put on and start experiencing. Has the power of a 500$ phone plus a 300$ headset for the price of 399$!!! Everything works fine. Remember this are mobile experience so do not expect extremely photorealistc quality experience but videos 360 and 3d video content. Battery last 2 to 3 hours. 2 Hours in intensive games. Can be taken literally anywhere. Buy one for your friend as well its much better with multiplayer.

I like this thing and am having fun with it, but I need to warn others about the magnetic battery covers.I was trying out the tennis demo and didn't have on the wrist straps (stupid I know)  the controller battery cover gave loose on a swing and the whole controller except for the battery cover flew across the room and smacked into the wall.Luckily it wasn't damaged, but I have felt the battery covers come loose several times since.  A stupid design. Beware.

The more time I’ve spent with this product the more mediocre it becomes to me. It is great when it comes to portability, but that’s the only great thing that I can think of. The rest is just meh. However, I do become infuriated with this product continuously. Every time I play Beat Saber the screen will go black randomly, which is quite problematic when playing Expert+ with faster song on. On top of that the app for it is terrible. Screen casting comes with audio glitches in the headset, and it lags quite frequently even on 500mps internet. You can’t even upload recorded video clips or screenshots to your Dropbox or Google Photos, even though you can download pictures and videos from them to your Quest. In the end they have a TON of work that needs to get done on the Quest before it’s worthy of any sort of positive review.

The Oculus Quest is fantastic except for one MAJOR flaw.  No multiple user function.  This is a single user device, which means game progress is saved each time it is played,.  This makes it incredibly difficult for multiple users.  One name, one profile, so you must wait for player 1 to finish a game before player 2 can try it.  I would be willing to buy another device for a family fun multi-player function, but not if I have to also repurchase all the expensive games.  My family of 4 is extremely disappointed.

You CANNOT add a second user profile without performing a FACTORY RESET and deleting ALL data thus far saved. In other words, one very expensive headset handles only ONE user. Not just one user at a time,...but ONE USER ONLY. Period.Unless you want to delete everything every time you put the headset on another member of the family or a friend. ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS!! All other devices and games accommodate multiple users.

I’ve had this since launch and it is amazing!  I highly recommend getting the 64Gb.  The extra $100 is better spent toward the Oculus Store.  Unlike Xbox games, the size taken up by the games isn’t a lot.  Add to that fact that as soon as I’m done I’ll delete the games.  Like I said, I’ve had it since launch and I’m only using about 50% of the capacity.  Also I use this almost every day.

I am absurdly happy with this console. It combines the immersive gaming with physical activity and I can read my emails better than on my phone.I honestly can find so many uses for it and I didn't know much about it before I bought one. It's only been a few hours and I can't get enough.Beat Saber and the Fitness games are great. The headset is comfortable over glasses and the head adjust is great too. It charges just fine during play. My only regret so far is not investing in the 128 GB unit.I just love the

I bought this product and was extremely excited to try it out. But unfortunately I have limited hand use do to a car accident,  when I tried to use the controllers I was unable to even grab a virtual object! This made me very upset that I cant Enter into a new virtual world and so on. I do have an Oculus Go device and I am able to use it with zero issues ! So unfortunately these new state of the art vr headsets will make it to impossible for disabled people to use...
review_title: Not for people with limited hand motion!

one_reviews_text: I purchased the Quest and Rift S on launch day expecting to return one or both if I didn't like either.The Rift S has been largely collecting dust - Quest gets 95% of my play time.  The convenience and portability are just too irresistible.Could it use a newer processor?  YesCould the battery life be longer?  YesCould it be lighter or more well balanced?  YesAll of these things quickly fade out of consideration when you put the headset on and enjoy completely wireless, near PC level VR bliss.What Oculus has managed to achieve with this two year old cell phone processor seems impossible.  I guess overclocking and active cooling make all the difference.  It makes me wonder how much performance our phones are leaving on the floor due to thermal restraints.Overall I couldn't be more pleased with the Quest.Oh...and I ended up keeping both headsets ;)
review_title: Oculus Hit It Out of The Park With This One

one_reviews_text: only had it a couple days, but have been enjoying it tremendously, my son as well, fun for all ages, only downfall, which should be expected, without be plugged in, your looking at maybe 2-3 hours, however, also must add, the charge is rather quick tho, you can also play while stationary, also certain titles are not offered to quest as to other oculus's, disappointing, but not a deal breaker as im sure titles will come with time..

The experiences are very high quality, the graphics very good, the game play is amazing.  Even the set up with the Guardian system will blow your mind as well as the initial tutorials.  Vader Immortal's Light Saber Dojo is unbelievable, something I've been wanting to do since I was 10 years old.  Robo Recall is awesome...  Super hot, BEAT SABER.  Honestly, i can't say enough as to what a great purchase this was.  For this kind of technology, I feel like a thief paying this little.  Oculus, you folks are amazing.
review_title: Wireless, Phone-less, Computer-Less Virtual Reality Gaming is a Miracle!

one_reviews_text: A few years ago, I became the proud owner of an Oculus Rift. The experience was amazing, but the tethers and high spec PC required made it a hard pill to swallow, and it didn’t feel nearly as simple to use as firing up a console, so I didn’t use it much. However, now that I own a Quest, I’ve used VR almost daily, as it gives you more freedom of movement and an easier experience to use. Instead of booting up a computer, launching your game, making sure your sensors are on, etc., with the Quest you just launch the game, approve to guardian, and you’re good to go. It literally takes 10 seconds to be ready to play a game. Their customer support and warranty is top notch, and you can tell they care about your experience, as there are new features like hand tracking getting added all the time. The Quest is a huge leap for VR, and I couldn’t recommend it enough to anyone interested in the future of tech.
review_title: An amazing, convenient leap for everyday VR

one_reviews_text: With a new update coming soon you will have to have a Facebook account to play, doesn’t sound to bad until you understand that Facebook now knows your height, your arm length, and you can no longer have your own username. When people click on your name it will say your Facebook name. No longer recommend for younger people.
review_title: Facebook account required. Can now track your height.

one_reviews_text: The head set is great except it’s shipping took 2 months and kept giving me false dates and I can’t complain to muck about the product after I got it but the time it took to get it to me was very disappointing.
review_title: Took forever to ship, 2 months, but the head set is fun to play.

one_reviews_text: I had about $6,000 sitting there waiting to buy the parts to build my next VR PC and upgrade to the latest and greatest headset.  And then I bought the Quest on a whim to see how it was before building my new setup.  WOW!  This thing is amazing, you get 90% of the PC experience at less than 10% of the cost.  They could release a new model every year for the next 10 years and I could get every one of them and still save a fortune.  The tracking is fantastic, the fit and finish is excellent and the library is great for launch.  Buy it, you won't regret it.
review_title: DON't HESITATE!!!! YOU ARE ALREADY MISSING OUT!!!!

one_reviews_text: I've followed VR through all iterations in the last 5 years and this is absolutely by far the first time the experience is consumer grade ready. The software titles, the device itself, is extremely easy to handle and way more comfortable in terms of optics and handling than anything prior. Pure VR bliss and sets the baseline for where VR is going to go. Eye strain that I experienced across Rift, Vive and GearVR is completely gone. Truly a significant leap. Highly entertaining, highly recommended.
review_title: Phenomenal stand-alone experience. The hype is real

one_reviews_text: My oculus quest worked for less than a month, and though it was alot of fun when it was working. Its basically trash now. The customer support is lacking to say the least and I will be returning it to the store after Christmas since I have to wait until then for customer support to respond. Thanks introducing me to vr but I would not recommend product to anyone due to the lack of customer support and the fact the only way to contact them is via chat or email. I am the proud owner of a $500 paperweight thank god its Christmas and I can take it back to the store.

Absolutely one of the most worthless purchases you can make. You pay all the money for a headset, and then you pay for all the overpriced games that are mediocre at best. Superhot, beat saber, In death unchained, boxing, and a graffiti game are about the only ones that feel great to play.If you don’t have a PC to be able to mod this thing to be good, you’re basically paying $400 for a paper weight
review_title: Paper weight that has 5 decent experiences

one_reviews_text: I'm very impressed by the software and tracking. It is also very easy to use. Cons: never feel picture get really sharp enough. It is slightly better than watching a VHS cassette from late 1980th. Netflix is okey without subtitles but with subtitles it is noticeable blurry text. How you put on the headset is also sensitive so I recommend to google on best procedure.

It's easy to scratch the lenses on the Oculus Quest (especially if you wear glasses) and your warranty doesn't cover scratches on the lens.  Oculus hasn't taken this into consideration in the design.  The lenses are built into the device and aren't easy to replace and if you scratch the lenses Oculus has no pity for you.  Imagine paying big money for these things and then having them ruined because of a scratch (very common problem)..  I'm giving this a bad review because I don't think that this sort of design flaw is acceptable.

DO NOT BUY THIS.  The controllers just stop working and the company will just string you along.  They have been saying they will replace it, and have not for over a month.  DO NOT TRUST THEM, this is a cheap headset but you get what you pay for, it will break and they will not help you.
review_title: Hardware breaks and horrible customer service.

one_reviews_text: As the title says, this is old stock of what WAS a great product.  Check the section on the page where it says "here is a newer version of this item"That's the Quest 2, and THAT is the one you probably want (Unless you are a collector or something)It's cheaper somehow, and came out late 2020, as opposed to Quest 1 which came out in 2018.
review_title: Excellent product, but don't buy this model anymore, the Quest 2 is newer, better and cheaper.

one_reviews_text: The product is good. What is not good is amazon raising the prize from $399:00 to over $600:00, RIDICULOUS.

Love the headset. There is nothing with hardware or software that I don't like. There's no wires, the quality is amazing and immersive but content better start coming soon and quick. I can see that after maybe 20 total hours of gameplay over the span of the top titles that this unit might make its way into Craigslist for the next person or in a box or shelved. Please Please PLEASE BRING MORE CONTENT FAST

first of all this is my third headset so this isn't a first impression of vr but its something so different than the rest of them i was going to buy the rift s but i took a chance and bought this and i never regret that this headset is like a nintendo switch vs a xbox with link its a pc powered vr headset but normally it's like a switch handheld don't get me wrong this is amazing and if you are on the fence to buy or not pls pls i can't stress this more than i already am buy this its freaking AWESOME!!!
review_title: BEST VR EXPERIENCE I EVER HAD.

one_reviews_text: It's incredibly easy to use, fun to share with friends, the games aren't crazy expensive, and as someone with lots of experience in jobs getting people to watch 360 videos in headsets, it's the first headset that needs no real explanation. Just plop it on and enjoy. Better looking than the Go and the black screens really look nice and dark.
And the new model is not only better but cheaper too.
review_title: I buy this, then I am forced to use Facebook...

one_reviews_text: In general Quest is obviously a big step forward.  Congrats Oculus!  However, I want take my 5.7K Insta360 One X and Pro 2 (8K) 360 videos into the VR domain.  When I watch the 5.7k videos from Instat360 OneX the video which is relatively clear on YouTube lacks detail when viewed on Quest.  That is a real problem for me.  Please jump the resolution up on your next VR generation Oculus.  As it is I just get head-aches watching blurry 360 videos.  Ugh.  Hoping the next version will be clearer on 5.7 and 8k 360 video.
review_title: 360 videos 5.7K and 8K are blurry. Needs better resolution to catch up to modern cameras

one_reviews_text: Waste of money honestly. Used it for like a month and its been collecting dust ever since. Super uncomfortable out of the box. Like painfully uncomfortable. Games are meh. Only way to get interesting games is to side load, which involves a computer and goes against the whole stand alone thing this headset was built around. Screen quality is pretty shabby too, it looks like you are looking at everything through a screen door. This also messed with my grip on reality in the first week and made me feel like I was still in virtual reality after I took it of my face. Altogether a boring, physically painful, and frustrating experience. I do NOT recommend this to anyone.
review_title: Bad and a waste of money

one_reviews_text: I would suggest purchasing the newer model for a more comfortable fit. The first model (Oculus Go) was more comfortable than this one. This version is heavier and a bit of a strain on the neck.  I’m not sure why the manufacturer allowed this to ship knowing this complaint. The comfort and price has improved with the newer model/Quest 2.

This headset really surprised me how good it really is. It isn’t like the computer attached headsets with room sensors and all. But for an all in one, this is great- except one big deal breaker is that u have to purchase games for each headset...  the same game on each headset to play multiplayer games with multi headsets.
review_title: Ea headset requires separate game purchase!

one_reviews_text: I saw a review saying that Facebook/ oculus made the quest so that it wasn’t compatible with steam vr and that it’s games aren’t able to be modded... to clear things up, the quest itself is like a console. Standalone device with its own AppStore and no mods, like an Xbox one or PS4... BUT with quest link however, it can be connected to a pc where all the steam games DO work on it and games like beat saber ARE moddable. Best of both worlds. Just got mine and it’s an unbelievable device for a great price and should be a staple of every household

I was just shy of the specs for a computer to support PC VR. When the Quest came along I gave it a year to mature. one_reviews_text: If I could rate it lower than one star I would. I have encountered a software bug twice now where the screen flashes black uncontrollably upon start up so you can't do anything. The only way to fix the problem is to factory reset the Quest and I'm not doing that every couple of weeks. This problem was discovered in the spring of 2019 and my Quest was bought roughly 8 months later. I shouldn't be having this problem. The other problem I have had with the Quest is my controllers not connecting unless I pop the batteries out and then put them back in. Skip Oculus and get a Vive or Valve Index. I cannot stress that enough.

The wrist straps are so long that you need your other hand to pick them up again, however you just end up banging the controllers together, which are awkwardly balanced anyways due to the sensor rings sitting above your hand rather than below. Good games, absolutely terrible design.

This was a really fun game, we had a great time playing it for almost a week - until the controller stopped working.  I called customer support and it has been one nightmare after another.  This was BEFORE Christmas.  They had me send it back, which I did immediately, but I *still* don't have a replacement controller.  Customer service has not responded with anything other than "we are looking into it".  So I have an expensive toy that cannot even be played.  It has been in the case since before Christmas, and the company is in no hurry to do right by a customer.

Straight out of the future.  This product is amazing.  It feels very immersive. There are no wires to worry about, which is incredible as VR. It has higher resolution than the Rift and Rift S. The tracking is amazing; better than I would have ever expected. The battery life is excellent and the interface is easy to use.Lastly, many of the games are phenomenal — but there are a couple duds, like Rec Room.  Try any of the other ports (Robo Recall, Super Hot, Beat Saber) and they will blow you mind!

So i had to send them the remote, took 5 days. They said once they get it, it would take an additional 3-5 business days for them to send the new one (I’m on day 6), and then you have to wait 3-5 business for it to get to you. I bought it over 2 weeks ago and I’m still unable to play it due to waiting on the remote.

Finally, 5 minute one time setup, 2 minute new room setup, long lasting, fast charging battery, NO peripherals, easy to take on the go and share with friends, simple casting, great tracking, multiple audio solutions, and some stellar titles!! I mean, seriously, this is so fun and so accessible.

After several failed attempts at ordering here, I finally got my Oculus Quest yesterday. I'm more interested in experiences than hardcore shoot-em-up style games so I was cautious but curious about what I was going to find. The long and short is this is an amazing product.  If you watch videos of game play and demos, the visuals look a bit lacking. There are limited polygons and textures and at first glance it looks like a Nintendo WII level presentation. But the immersion and the interactivity make up for any technical drawbacks. The controllers are responsive and intuitive. The display takes a bit of getting used to. It's light years beyond an iPhone strapped to your face style VR but the optics can be uncomfortable at first. I wear glasses sometimes but not usually for focusing something this close. The straps and adjustments you can make with the headset help you find a comfortable field of vision. The audio is a bit quiet on the built-in speakers but a pair of discount-drugstore brand in-ear headphones plugged into the headset were a cheap and worthy upgrade. The games are somewhat typical of, well, gaming. Lots of shooting and swordplay and tired fantasy elements. But there are plenty of free demos to get a taste for what is possible in the medium. That said, I found "Beat Saber" pretty intoxicating and even exhausting. It's a good showcase for what it is possible. There's a simple tutorial game included that has you tossing paper airplanes and whacking a tether ball that really show off the physics and interactivity. YouTube VR videos can be a bit smeared and lo-fi but the true 360 degrees/6 degrees of freedom (at least visually if not spatially) made for a decent experience. I thought the 2 hour battery life sounded kind of lame but personally, I don't think I could keep doing this without a break for that length of time. I am eager to try the included Link cable tethered to my PC for some more up-res experiences. If it works as advertised, I can't see the reason for buying a Rift for the same price (and it only supports tethered play.) In general, the tethered experience seems way too kludgy and awkward for most applications. I could see easily knocking over furniture or at least yanking out the cable mid-game.

Great cyber price, good product. Not many apps yet and graphics hopefully will improve with more detail. I hope realistic applications rather than animation follow. I'd holdout until it develops further. Has good area mapping; just dont walk by the user, you might get punched and remove items off tables..He fell over a chair twice within mapping and user forgets we can here everything! Can join friends in games which is cool. I would have waited until further development but he bugged the daylights out of me for this as Christmas gift. I was so worried it wouldnt arrive by then as it was a cyber sale that wasnt a stored item I suppose. These were unattainable locally. So I'm glad Amazon made good on delivery (which had early ship date not honored but made it on time);who are usually spot on with delivery when you purchase via them. Its was a life savior as deliveries by 3rd party purchases were deceptive and still not delivered (they displayed stock, took your money, then emailed product sold out).
review_title: Cool product but limited apps which are still just simple animation.

one_reviews_text: Pros:Game play, when the game (HL Alyx) actually works, is fun.  Once you finally master how to do something with your very clunky and awkward controls, it is satisfying.- Head set is comfortable (the other side of the coin is, it is heavy and after 10 minutes I really start to feel it!)CONS:-Price.  $400 for what are essentially, glorified 3D viewing similar to the 1950's, is too much for the hassle, inconvenience, discomfort, and cost.  Over-priced for what you actually get for all that expense and trouble.CONNECTING:I had lots of trouble connecting to play HL Alyx (the only reason I bought this).  I don't know where the fault lies, game or equipment, or my own WIFI.  Sometimes it hooks up in a minute without a hitch.  Sometimes the connection is impossible not matter what I try, and I'm seriously tempted to dump this whole cluster-f#ck and return the headset for a refund.On the other hand, Oculus apps, that of course they make it easy to buy as soon as the headset boots up (about 15 seconds) probably work much better.  I haven't bought any of those yet so IDK for sure.TL DRMy advice is try one of these headsets before you buy!  You may decide it isn't worth it.  Like I said, I think today's VR is just a gimmick, a very expensive one, that is still nowhere near being ready, both in terms of ease of use, comfort, and immersiveness and quality of the VR world they can create.- The view is kind of interesting, but not really revolutionary in 2020... I hope I can see VR in 20 years, or even 10.  But today it just isn't there.

In COVID-19, many of us can't really move around or leave our homes which is the perfect reason to invest in a quality VR headset. I've tried many headsets but the Quest stands out as one of the best. First off, no clunky PC wires needed - everything you need to start playing comes with it and for pro gamers, a link cable brings you up to Rift S level playing. I bought one for everyone in my family! Wonderful games and content

Pro:1.cheapest VR headset on market that capable for decent gaming ability2. Sensors in it are impressive and does their job wellCon:(These cons comes from my personal experience, maybe it just happens to me)1. Takes a long time connect to desktop through USB 3.0 cable(I used the anker one which officially supported here). The thing is sometimes I even have to reinstall graphic card drivers to reconnect to the headset. It’s just annoying.2. Fish eye effect still going on with this headset and only about 1 inch diameter circle in front of you is clear picture but out of that it starts to blur.3. Maybe software issue but some time the safe zoom could be moved even though I was just sitting on my chair.4. The front part is a bit too heavy, it’s nothing when I put it on, but after hours of wearing it, it’s really tiring to me.All in all, for 399, you cannot find better VR headset on market. It’s a worth buy if you want to experience real VR but don’t want spend much on it. But to me, I would wait till there are more technologies get applied and there is still a long way to go for VR headset
review_title: Still long way to go for VR headset

I enjoy watching people try VR for the first time and this is the best way to introduce others to it, in my opinion.If you are new to VR yourself, THIS is the product to buy. Only downside is the price of games, usually between $15-$30 a pop. But they are worth it. Titles like Space Pirate Trainer, Superhot VR, and Beatsaber run INCREDIBLY well on this thing. VR with no wires is just a game changer. Hands down.Great job to oculus on creating a wonderful piece of hardware.

one_reviews_text: My son wanted a VR headset for his birthday so I convinced him to wait a few weeks to get the self contained Oculus Quest.  Boy am I glad he was understanding.  Not having to be tied down to a PC is great and the prices for games isn't as outlandish as I thought it would be.  Most of the games released with the Quest will run between $15-30 which isn't too bad considering Xbox/PS4 charge almost $60 for new games.  The graphics are great...just like if you were running one off of a PC.  Unless you have a tricked out PC, I would consider the Quest equal to other PC VR based headsets.  I really like that you can set a circle and if my son steps outside it, you can see the real world.  Hopefully that will mean, I won't hear objects crashing to the floor or him running into things.  I can't recommend the Oculus Quest enough.

I am greatly impressed with the quest even though I saw a lot of reviews calling it nothing special but for a completely wireless system it is worth every dollar. The amount of games available is a bit limited but it is still fairly new. The tracking only very rarely had issues and rare odd crash but I highly recommend it if you want be but are unsure about the high cost of pc vr.

I was pretty excited to receive the oculus as I bought it for my sons birthday. But honestly it’s not worth. It’s so expensive and there aren’t many games available to play. It’s fun for a day or two and then it’s good to collect dust.

If your buying for VRCHAT... stop now and get  a rift s for your PC.The quest can do vrchat BUTIt only does a default set of low poly"ie low detail" worlds and low poly default avatars.People love the insane variety of vrchat.But quest makes it dull as you can't see the people in avatars other than quest ones .Which is lameSo no Ugandan knuckles seenHowever it does good in a bunch of other quest designed apps.And no external room trackers neededWhy the rift s insteadYes it has a cordYes it has better graphics based on pc.Yes it can do every app and gameYes it is not limited to a set of specific low poly games.If you have a PC you can run a Rift SCPU I3 or ryzen 3Videocard gtx 960,1060, radeon r9 or rx480If your pc doesn't have a graphics card.Heads up these graphics cards are like $100-$150 and most have newer versions cheaper. Got this for Christmas a few years back and absolutely loved it! Totally blew my mind. A wireless headset is a great choice! However, there are some major things to be aware of here.1) Facebook acquired Oculus and (as an evil empire does) broke its promise not to require Oculus owners to login using a Facebook account. For some of us, this is a total deal-breaker.2) If you intend to use this with your PC via Oculus Link, be aware that Link really doesn't work all that great and regularly loses its connection to the PC. The Quest really wasn't made for this, and so the connection they had to adhoc onto the device is slow, which means your PC has to perform the extra work of compressing the feed on top of rendering whatever VR application you're using, then the Quest decompresses it. So naturally this degrades the quality of the experience. The framerate is also locked at 72 Hz, which is good but not great. If you're serious about PCVR, this just isn't the right option.3) While the display is nice with deep blacks and vivid colors, the clarity really does lack. This is to be expected to some degree for any VR headset, but you will definitely notice it here as well. It's especially pronounced when trying to read any text. The screen-door effect isn't terrible (imo), but you will notice it on any bright solid colors that take up a larger portion of your field of vision.
So long quest 1 your newer counterpart shall replace you
Wow, I have never experienced anything like that before. Even interacting with objects is so fun.
review_title: Never experienced anything like this before.

There are a lot of positive reviews for this headset, but I feel like there's a lot of problems that people didn't detail about. I bought this optimistically, thinking it would be amazing, but there was a lot of trouble I experienced during its set up and use. This is a bit of a long read, but please bear with me.First off, you NEED, and I mean NEED, a (newish) smartphone with an Internet connection to set up the Oculus Quest. You can't even emulate an Android to do it. You CANNOT avoid that requirement whatsoever. In my case, I didn't have any smartphone that wasn't old, so I had to call a friend over to use his to get it set up. You also need Wi-Fi, preferably 5 GHz. There is no PC activation with the Quest; heck, the Quest can't even connect to the PC without a third-party hack. Don't expect this headset to be the same as a Rift, because it isn't. It is purely standalone, and you're stuck with its own Oculus app store. Plus, you must connect your Facebook account to the Oculus AND provide payment details (e.g. credit card info) in order to complete registration. This is a huge privacy issue that many will not like.The Oculus app store doesn't have a lot of apps in it, let alone free. All the apps that are available are easily upwards of $20 a pop. This doesn't bother me too much since my sole reason for buying it was to wirelessly watch 360 videos on YouTube VR, but for others, it will be a major turnoff, since the Quest doesn't come with any free games, just demos. For such an expensive headset, you'd think that Oculus would be generous enough to bundle some free full games with it, but I guess they just want to milk their customers with the novelty and hype.The headset itself is heavy and a bit uncomfortable. It constantly sags forward no matter what you try to do, so you'll often need to support it with your hands. The cushion that goes on your face isn't really that great either; it feels like it pushes in on random spots.Another problem I experienced, which Oculus needs to address, is quality control. The lens that came with my Quest had permanent streaks on the INSIDE, which you can't avoid seeing. It almost felt like the headset was refurbished. It's not too bad during bright scenes, but anywhere else, I see them blurring my vision. I'm not going to get an exchange for something like that now that I've gone through such a pain to get it set up, but Oculus seriously needs to get better quality control.Overall, aside from all of those issues, the headset itself is nice and does what it is intended to do, but the video quality is really poor for 360 videos (other apps seem to be fine though). I don't know if it's just because most YouTube content is still at low resolution right now, but it feels like I'm watching 480p video most of the time. This is likely not a Quest issue though; it's probably the same no matter what headset you buy.As a beginner "early adopter" headset, this is pretty good for its price, but that's about it. I'd stay away from VR headsets for at least a few more years, since the technology still isn't perfect. In my particular case, since I'm strictly planning to use a VR headset for 360 videos, I'm content, but for people looking to immerse themselves in gaming, I'd recommend not doing so for now. There's still not enough content, quality, and performance to justify the price.
review_title: A good VR headset, but with many caveats; READ THIS BEFORE YOU BUY!!

one_reviews_text: Wow!!! Its the very first word that i said as i put on this headset. Amazing Product, and Delivery time was also great. And product reaches me fine and is working great. Amazing graphics quality and with the latest update Quest is getting better and better. Tho it has some pros and cons. You dont need high end Gaming pc for playing VR games now. No need of wire and external sensors. Now you have gurdian mode in which one can see if hes crossing the line and camera will open up so that you wont hit any object in real life. Pixels are fine. Controller tracking are good as well. Cons will be like product too much costly as i know its not available in india and import duties are expensive. You need to buy games in Oculus store only free demo of games will be provided. Games price ranges from 9$ to 29$. Front heavy but with some modding it can be work. Now you can play PC steam VR gaming with the use of Oculus link cable, so its a standalone headset as well as pc headset as well. Its a bit expensive in india but i like the purchase that i made. Great and Amazing product.

It is great but you need to keep some things in mind before you buy. First, you need a mobile phone to do the initial setup. Comfort- I find it pretty good for about an hour then the contact points on my face start to get irritated.  THis isnt a huge problem because I can only play for 2 hours anyways before the batteries are getting low. 2 hours of gaming is long enough for me.  Ive tried HTC vive pro and Vive, both of which need a powerful PC to work. BOth didnt feel any more comfortable to me than the quest. I also didnt feel any video resolution difference between any of them was worth noting (vive seemed worse but it was still enjoyable) but I also only like watching movies in 720p max because I dont like 1080p. Being wireless and not reliant on a computer is great but the option will be there in NOvember to connect it to a powerful gaming computer and give you access to the Oculus Rift games library on Steam. I find the Oculus controllers were way more comfortable and nicer to use than HTC  (personal preference I am sure). I spent alot of time between spending a massive amount on $$$ on a fancier headset but in the end, I loved the controllers better than the HTC, I love the portability of the headset (people at work can try it), it is super simple to setup, no messing around with sensors, just draw a circle around you with the controller and start playing.  I loved that it is ANdroid and there is a large unofficial sideload site for games and I love that I still have the option to play all the steam VR games so I have all the same options for games as any other headset and the price is right.
review_title: Its great but there are some "buts".

one_reviews_text: Basically, a PlayStation/XBox Killer. The trade-off in graphics is well worth the added playability of this standalone device. Even veterans of VR will agree. This is a milestone for VR and gaming. Cannot recommend enough.

one_reviews_text: This is a great upgrade of Oculus Go. The rendering Quality is pretty good, with almost no Dithering.  360 degree photos look awesome especially since you can move around. The Guardian is a bit of a pain since it keeps getting reset.This is a very good buy and a better value for money compared to Rift, if you compare the ease of use, no wires, but still have the ability to move aroundHowever, if you have a very powerful Desktop/Laptop with a high end GPU, then I would recommend going for Rift.

My 14 year old wanted this to replace his Oculus Go that he got last year. He found he was not using the GO, as gaming was not great. The Quest is definitely a step up and rather a neat concept, where you can set boundaries and play. The games are good, but a couple issues where the device was not perfect for our family. First our ceilings in our basement are only 7.5 feet tall and many of the games required hands above the head and you hit the ceiling. So our living room was the only room it worked in, but this is not s gaming room. Next my boy loves playing online with his friends, as he was the only one who had the system this could not happen. Lastly the video is good, but not perfect. I am sure Oculus could make it better, but suspect that would raise the cost too much. So in the end after playing extensively for a week the device began to collect dust and we sent it back.

Está excelente, no me arrepiento para nada de esta compra y se las recomiendo por completo!!Las únicas cosas que no me agradaron tanto es que no hay muchos juegos disponibles todavía (lo cual no es sorpresivo porque tiene poco tiempo en el mercado) pero lo bueno es que están agregando varios juegos de manera regular a la tienda, por lo que muy pronto eso ya no será un problema. Otra cosa es que si te enfocas demasiado en un lugar se pueden apreciar los pixeles. Si buscas un VR con la MEJOR calidad de imagen tal vez este no sea para ti. Eso no es para decir que las gráficas son de mala calidad, ya que definitivamente si tiene buena imagen. Si puedes dejar eso a un lado, te garantizo que te encantará.Es increíble poder jugar en realidad virtual sin tener ningún cable que se esté enredando en tus pies y entorpeciendo la experiencia. Para la gente que no tiene computadoras que pueda correr juegos en buena calidad, el Oculus Quest es la oportunidad perfecta ya que no requiere usar computadora para correr juegos. Todo se encuentra dentro del visor.Hay algunos juegos donde te puede dar nausea o mareo ya que el nivel de intensidad es muy alto; pero afortunadamente si eres de los que se marean fácilmente, la mayoría de los juegos tienen ajustes para reducir dicha intensidad y jugar de manera más cómoda y tranquila.Fuera de los juegos, el visor también cuenta con aplicaciones como Youtube donde puedes ver videos excepcionales e increíbles en VR en muy buena calidad. Si quieres ver tus series favoritas también puedes ver Netflix en el visor,  lo cual les recomiendo intentar ya que es una experiencia diferente e interesante. De momento no cuenta con aplicaciones como Hulu o Crunchyroll, pero afortunadamente sí cuenta con un browser para acceder a los sitios que quieras directamente.Si es tu primer headset de VR entonces no tengo duda de que te va a dejar encantado. Todos mis amigos que lo han intentado se han quedado impresionados por la inmersión que sientes al estar dentro del Oculus Quest y ya están haciendo planes también para comprarlo. Usar el Oculus Quest es entrar a un universo completamente nuevo y diferente al de la realidad y te sentirás como si de verdad estuvieras en el universo de lo que sea que estés jugando/viendo.En resumen, si tienes dudas sobre si vale la pena o no comprarlo, yo te diría que es una experiencia realmente increíble y divertida, ampliamente recomendada. No conozco a nadie que lo haya intentado y que no le haya gustado. El precio además es accesible si lo comparas con otros headsets. Dale una oportunidad al Quest y ya verás que no te arrepentirás.
review_title: Acceso a miles de universos en un headset

one_reviews_text: Everything about the Quest is incredible, but it has two major flaws, it is too front heavy and really uncomfortable, strapping a weight to the strap that wraps around the back of the head helps, but this shouldn't be necessary for a device of that price, the second flaw is that casting to a TV is barely functional, there is an up to 10 seconds delay and the image is highly compressed and constantly stutters, with that said I decided to keep the Quest and I'm having a blast so far.

VR is really awesome, much more awesome than any youtube video can make it look like and Oculus Quest is a great implementation of VR. If you've already tried "phone to the face VR" understand that this is a very different type of experience, and Oculus Quest delivers all the key features.You feel immersed in the world, the games are fun the controllers feel great. Battery life is about 2 hours on a full charge, and while it might sound short don't compare it to a Nintendo DS's 5-8 hours or the like .. as you don't really carry this with you on the bus. You can play and charge if you want really long play sessions.Low point(s) are some potential discomfort due to the weight of the device and the so-so speakers. With regards to comfort, I've played around with the adjustable straps and found a good position that works with my rather large head. With regards to sound, the speakers are serviceable but not very loud and gun shots or music will lack bass, but you can easily plug your own headphones with a 3.5mm jack (I don't recommend Bluetooth due to general latency).All paid games I've tried were a lot of fun, and even the free to play games were great. If you've had the itch to try out VR, you can't really go wrong with the Quest.
review_title: Prepare to have your mind blown

one_reviews_text: Un visor de realidad virtual que sin duda esta revolucionando el entretenimiento, si no tienes una computadora/laptop para VR, estos visores sin duda son la mejor opción ya que no la necesitas, solo lo linkeas con un smartphone, y se pone mejor con el oculus link, ya que si en algún momento llegases a tener una computadora lista para VR, conectando vía USB el visor, ocuparas un cable para esto, podrás disfrutar de los juegos de VR que tengas en PC.Es un paradigma muy bueno para el VR, totalmente portable, compacto y cero cables, a no ser que lo conectes a PC como ya mencione, lo único malo, creo yo, es que los touch controller necesitan de baterías AA, pero nada que no se pueda resolver con baterías AA recargables. El paquete llego mucho antes de lo previsto, llego en buen estado, un pequeño golpe en la caja, pero nada de que preocuparse.

So much fun, and only getting better as more games are becoming available.As a stand alone unit it works simply and intuitively, my daughter (9) can set it up for a session on her own.It has the ability to also play linked to your PC, from there you can access and play Oculus Rift games, "sideload" many more games either by independent coders or still in development, or access many VR games only available on Steam, though this was a lot trickier there are tutorials available to guide you though the process. To play Rift and Steam games on your Quest your going to need a decent PC to run them as all the game processing is done by your PC and streamed to the Quest headset.Is 64GB version enough?? Sure seems to be, 4 weeks later and i havnt filled it yet. VR games on a whole dont seem to require much storage space, mostly they are around 1GB each.
